Summary: This hotel worked out great for my family.  On the way, I requested an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite with a bunkbed, which my kids loved.  The 1 bedroom would've been ok, but I was so happy that they got us into the 2 bedroom, which just gave us more room to breathe.  It's a three room space, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and then a kitchen/living room with pullout couch. The pool and hot tubs look really nice.  The breakfast is huge and has everything you could need.  There's a CVS in the same parking lot, so if you need any supplies you have them too.  And Disneyland is a 10 min walk!  You could really go there and back throughout the day if you needed. Parking is separate charge, and self park. Being part of the Marriott membership came with a lot of perks. This is a great place
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the wonderful review with us, jgalanti!  We're happy to hear that you had such a pleasant stay at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center! It was our pleasure hosting you. It's great to know that our spacious accommodations, breakfast service, and ideal location had such a positive impact on your stay. We love providing our guests with great amenities and services and we're happy that you had all that you needed.  Thanks again for sharing!

Summary: We had the best experience at this hotel for our Disneyland vacation. The rooms are nice sized and allowed us to let family members sleep while others got up and had coffee. The breakfast is such a nice perk of this hotel. The staff works so hard to keep everything stocked and ready for guests. The front desk staff was willing to answer questions and help with any request. The walking distance to Disneyland was great. It only took 10-15 minutes depending on the light and crowds. There are many restaurant options close to the hotel. We used the hot tub one night, and it was a nice break from the park. The weather wasn't the best for the pool, but it was still an option. I would definitely book this hotel again when we go back to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and that you found our rooms to be spacious and our breakfast to be a great perk. Our team works hard to ensure that our guests have a comfortable and enjoyable stay with us and we are so glad that we were able to provide that for you. We are also happy to hear that you found our location to be convenient for walking to Disneyland and that you enjoyed the many restaurant options nearby. We hope to see you again soon at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center!

Summary Heading: Best family place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: 2 bedroom/2 bath suite for my family of 5. It's like Marriott knows what families need, so they built this hotel. Not having to stay all in one room=amazing! A fantastic breakfast included- even better! Walking distance to Disneyland- sweet! You get so much bang for your buck here compared to other hotels. I was amazed they had a room ready for us when we arrived hours early and they gave us an extra hour for late checkout. This allowed us to take the time to use their laundry facility before we boarded our cruise. The laundry room is such a great amenity! All of the hotel staff were super friendly. Having the kitchen area was great, too. We could bring snacks and had a place to eat them. We used the fridge for leftovers.  The CVS next door is a hidden gem. I highly recommend
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review, X5033YYlarissag!  It's wonderful you enjoyed your stay at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center so much! We strive for excellence so we're thrilled you appreciated not only our spacious rooms and ample amenities, but also our convenient location, friendly staff and delicious breakfast! Your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We can't wait to host you again soon for another amazing experience!

Summary: I am a traveling Nurse and I travel to different hotels weekly , I subcontract for the military, so I live out of my suitcase, I am just now getting around to this review because I am very busy. I stayed at this hotel back on Dec 2nd and 3rd of 2022.  I always stay in the Residence Inn because my company has contract rates, so its usually about 15 or more of us occupying a hotel when we are on a big assignment,. With that said, I checked in on the the early evening of the 2nd of December, not sure what the front desk person name was but she was a middle age blonde lady, she proceeded to check me in and saw that I had a contracted rate, through my company and proceeded to ask me to show her proof that i worked for this company , I was take aback at this time, because IVE NEVER
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, lvettej.  It's unfortunate your time with us was less than ideal. We're always looking into feedback to continue to grow our establishment. However, it is our policy that if a room was booked under a military rate, our front desk agent must verify identification upon check-in.  We do hope you allow us the opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: We stayed here three days. The staff was nice. The breakfast looked good (although I bring my own, healthier fare), and parking was easy.  The rooms were comfortable enough and (most important) it was quiet at night. I got a great night’s sleep every night. The living room furniture is slightly more functional than comfortable but still not that bad.  If you are going to Disneyland the walk is not bad. It warms you up for the ten miles that you walk throughout the day.  There is a CVS and Walgreens just down the street if you need to pick up some items.
Room tip: We stayed on the south side of the hotel. If you want to see the fireworks at Disney you might...
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing this glowing review, TravelDonCA!  We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center! It's our pleasure to accommodate you to the fullest extent. Your compliments for our kind staff, comfortable accommodations, and ideal location let us know we're doing our job. After all, we pride ourselves on your happiness. With this said, we'd love to share another perfect experience with you soon!  Thank you again for taking the time to share your feedback!

Summary: Would pick this one again.  Safe, clean, all the staff friendly.  Convenient to Subway, Pizza, Starbucks.  Pool esp the spa was a relief from Disney.  Things that could improve - no body wash the whole stay, spa bubbler didn’t always work; but they didn’t bother me much I didn’t get around to asking about them but I’m sure they would have helped if I did.
Manager Response: Thanks for the nice rating, Jacqui!  We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We're happy that you loved our clean accommodations, kind staff, and ideal location. We strive to provide our guests with warm hospitality, efficient service, and clean rooms. Regarding your concerns with our amenities, we will bring those to the attention of our team as we continue to improve for the future.  We'd love to share a more positive experience with you next time.

Summary: Staffs were super friendly, polite, and did they their best to keep us happy!. Our parking fee was discounted. we stayed 12 days and loved every moments of it! hotel was clean, breakfast was very and hotel was having amenity we needed.
Manager Response: Thanks for the amazing review, Explorer691202!  It's excellent your time at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center was so fantastic and enjoyed our clean accommodations and convenient breakfast! We take great care in providing top-notch service for all of our guests. Your praise for our team lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to hosting you again soon so we can share another splendid experience with you!  Thank you again for sharing your feedback!

Summary: Stayed for a week in late August for a Disneyland vacay with the kids. Rooms are tidy, overall interior feels at par with what you pay. Mattresses are 7/10 for hotel standards. Shower has swift temperature changes for no reason. The hotel is severely understaffed, esp taking into consideration that this was high season. BEWARE: cleaning personnel will grab anything you leave outside your safe. In my case, wait for it…they stole a pair of sneakers! You read that correctly. After 6 very polite and eloquent calls with both housekeeping manager and lost & found people, they recklessly covered for the cleaning personnel that took them. This has never happened to me at a hotel, and I’m still flabbergasted that this happened at a Marriott. Still considering filing a police report.

Summary Heading: Given a different room type than booked. Hotel lacked transparency and blamed the booking site.
Summary: We booked a 2 Queen Suite at this hotel though an online booking service, as we've done previously. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told the actual room that was secured was a 1 King Suite. We protested that this was incorrect, but the hotel assured us they were not mistaken and that there was nothing they could do about it. It was late, with small children ready for bed, so there was no time to get into the nitty gritty.  The next day, we contacted the booking site to complain and they assured us that what the hotel told us was in error and that a 2 Queen Suite had indeed been secured. They called the hotel and said they confirmed this with Juan. They told us the hotel had put us in the incorrect room.  When we brought this up with the hotel, they insisted it was
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Alvord,  As we had mentioned during our previous conversations, we had given you the room type that was booked in our system at the time of your arrival, for a Deluxe 1 Bedroom King Suite. Unfortunately, we were unable to send you what you had asked for, because our hotel systems are encoded and will not allow us to do so. We had asked you to provide information regarding the third party company that you had booked with so that we can sort out the discrepancy, but we never received that information, nor did any representative from the third party contact the hotel directly, so we have been unable to resolve your issue. Because your reservation had been prepaid through the third party, the hotel cannot provide any direct compensation. Please contact us with more information so that we can further assist you.   Thank you.

Summary Heading: Excellent reviews are right on the money
Summary: Excellent hotel, with a very professional young man working the check-in desk. Room was spotless and breakfast was excellent. everything you can expect from a well run Residence Inn. Right across the street from Disneyland, yet surprisingly quiet given the overwhelming number of guests who are there for Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this glowing review, John!  We are delighted to hear about your experience at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center! We truly appreciate your kind words regarding our team. It's wonderful that you felt valued by each member of our top-notch team. We strive to provide our guests with the warmest hospitality and most efficient service, so this is fantastic to hear! Your compliments are not only rewarding, but also encouraging.  We'd love to share another positive, fun experience with you in the future.

Summary: Well located for both the Convention Centre and Disneyland, the hotel was a good choice for our six night stay.  The King Suite was big; well appointed with a large bathroom (excellent shower !); sitting area with a pull out sofa bed (that we're glad we didn't have to use for six nights); and a good kitchen area with fridge, freezer, toaster, dishwasher and microwave.  Typical of this sort of hotel, it did feel a little sterile and short on atmosphere.  Breakfast is included - not a huge choice but sufficient to get the day off to a start; there is a small shop and also a small bar area that was never particularly busy.  The roof top pool area was great - lots of shade if wanted and places to relax; nice pool; and some great water fountains to cool off under for the kids.  And
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this stunning review, Duncan!  We're thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center so much! We strive for excellence so we're pleased to hear you appreciated not only our well-kept, spacious, and comfortable amenities and accommodations, but also prime location! Your praise lets us know we're succeeding!  We can't wait to host you again for yet another unforgettable visit!

Summary: My family and I have been staying here every year we visit Disneyland and every year our stay is even better. I highly recommend you to stay here because there is free breakfast, great customer service and housekeeping, especially the staff at the front desk. Jazzmarie Arteaga, front desk supervisor, was more than happy to help us with all our requests and was quick with her assistance. WE HAD INTERNET ISSUES WITH OUR TV AND SHE SENT A MAINTENANCE GUY RIGHT AWAY. Housekeeping kept our room clean, we felt as we were home and comfortable. Also, they made really cute designs with the towels and bedding. The staff working in the breakfast room are so hardworking, they kept refilling the food stations.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing the excellent review with us!  We're so glad that you had an exceptional experience at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center from beginning to end. It's wonderful to know that our staff treated you so well and made you feel welcome throughout the entirety of your time with us. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!  Thank you again for taking the time to leave your feedback!

Summary: Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was modern and clean. Complimentary breakfast had lots of choices. Location was great—within walking distance to Disneyland. It was an overall great experience. Our family would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review, Russell and Tra... B!  It's wonderful you enjoyed your stay at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center so much! We strive for excellence so we're thrilled you appreciated not only our courteous staff and refreshed accommodations, but also our amenities and prime location! Your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We can't wait to host you again soon for another amazing experience! Have a fantastic day!

Summary Heading: Great Family Trip to Disneyland from the East Coast
Summary: We love this hotel because we love the great location.  We don't mind the walk at all and take advantage of of the bigger rooms for our family.  Rooms were clean, updated, and staff was super friendly/helpful.  The breakfast and full kitchen are key for our family.  I love a hotel room with a full fridge...especially when we need to store lots of snacks.  We plan to return again next year.
Manager Response: Thanks for the excellent review, DJML11!  We're delighted your time at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center was so outstanding as providing our guests with an excellent experience is very important to us. It's fantastic you appreciated our prime location and refreshed accommodations, as well as our courteous staff. That's what we like to see! We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience.  Have an amazing day!

Summary: We have had a stay booked for an upcoming trips for several months. We have a toddler and I called the hotel to ask about getting a crib or pack n play. I was given a very rude monologue of why we shouldn’t count on it. I wondered if I was being pranked by how rude she was. We have switched our reservation elsewhere. The hotel looked nice and maybe she was having a really bad day, but it was simply too offensive to want to stay.
Manager Response: Good morning Traveler0117,  Thank you for sharing your experience, even though it was not the best. I would like to apologize on behalf of the Residence Inn team on how you were treated. Our pack n plays are not guaranteed, it's a first come bases. If you have time, I would like to speak with you personally to get a better understanding on how the conversation was like and so I may assist you. The phone number to reach me will be (714)-785-7500.   I hope this past stay does not discourage you from visiting us in the near future, have a great day!

Summary: We had a disappointing stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim. When we arrived after 4:00, our room was not ready. I checked in on the Marriott app when we left the airport but apparently that didn't matter. We waited a long time without any follow up so I had to keep checking with the front desk. Finally the front desk supervisor said that the housekeeping staff reported a "funky smell" in that room and they were trying to clear it out. They did not have any information about what the smell was. From the beginning they said that there were no other rooms available but when I expressed my concerns about the smell, they somehow arranged for another room. I'm not sure why this wasn't offered in the first place. We paid extra for a suite with a kids themed bunk room and theme park view.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your feedback.  We are disappointed to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. We strive to provide every guest with excellent experience and we regret that your stay with us did not reflect this. Please know that your concerns have been passed on to our management team so they can be properly addressed.  We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon so we can show you the quality experience we know that we are capable of sharing with our guests.

Summary: Great hotel in Walking that is walking distance from Disney Land. My family and I stayed and were very impressed! Great service, professional staff and extremely help. This is hotel is great for family’s or romantic get aways. I highly recommend visiting!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this wonderful review with us!  We're thrilled to hear you had such an enjoyable experience at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center! We also appreciate your kind words regarding our team. We're pleased to know that you felt valued by each member of our top-notch team. We strive to provide our guests with the warmest hospitality and most efficient service, so this is fabulous to hear! Your praise is not only rewarding, but also encouraging.  We'd love to share yet another unforgettable visit with you someday!

Summary: We stayed here with our family and friends. Breakfast in am was more than adequate, room sizes were good and this was easily walkable to Disneyland . We used the pool almost everyday and it was good sized. Clean and updated hotel. Would recommend !
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review, munttel!  We're delighted your time at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center was so wonderful! It's fantastic you took advantage of our convenient location in the heart of the city. We endeavor to offer a memorable experience for all of our guests. We look forward to hosting you again soon for another excellent experience!  Please come see us again soon!

Summary: Clean rooms/facilities,  decent breakfast, lobby bar and a CVS right next door - all the basics for a great trip with small kids. However, one night, we arrived back to the hotel after staying at park late and closed when we arrived back to the hotel at around 11:30pm the front doors to the hotel would not open and were locked - not even our key cards worked to open the doors. There was another man there also trying to back in to go to his room. We all had to collectively bang on the front doors and windows to get the person in the back office to eventually come to open the doors for us - very annoying with small, tired kids but also a huge safety issue if you were alone and needed to get to your room, deducting a star for this. Overall would recommend to those staying to go to
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback, Preshellis18.  We appreciate your input. It's great that you loved our cleanliness, breakfast, lobby, and location. However, we'll be addressing your concerns about the front door incident with the appropriate members of our team. Our front lobby doors generally lock from the outside after 11:30 PM for the security of our guests and for our staff; guests are required to use their room keys for entrance and we have a call button for assistance as well. However, the front desk is staffed at all times, and please know we have treated this as an isolated incident to ensure that it doesn't happen again.  We look forward to having you back again soon for an even more positive experience.

Summary: Amazing trip! Hotel location ideal, perfect room and amenities were just what we needed. What made it special is the personalized service from Johnathan Trujillo at the Front Desk. He was very engaged with us and even when busy, he really showed how much he cared about our trip by taking time to write down suggestions of his favorite places nearby that we could visit since we needed to bypass time before meeting with friends. This was so useful! I look forward to returning in the future with family.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this wonderful review!  We are very pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable experience at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort! We appreciate your praise for our team; they work very hard to ensure every guest feels right at home. We are delighted you felt welcomed and valued during your time with us!  We'd love to share another positive experience with you in the future!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel within walking distance to Anaheim Convention Center, Anaheim GardenWalk, and Disneyland
Summary: Stayed at this hotel because I was attending a convention at Anaheim convention center. Very convenient hotel for both the convention center and Disneyland. There is an additional charge for parking but that is standard for many of the hotels in Anaheim. Very close walk to both convention center and Disneyland. I booked a theme park view room. My room was on the 8th floor and I could see the Rollercoaster and the Ferris Wheel of California Adventure as well as the Matterhorn and the top of Space Mountain at Disneyland. It was great! Each morning there is a complimentary breakfast which was nice. Lots of different breakfast options and a large area dining area with tons of tables. Before booking this hotel I read some of the reviews, both positive and negative. I don’t understand
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us this wonderful review, Misty!  We're thrilled your time at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort Convention Center was so enjoyable! It's also great to hear you took advantage of our convenient location in the heart of the city. We endeavor to offer our guests only the most memorable of experiences and your praise lets us know we're succeeding. We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fabulous experience!

Summary Heading: A place you would come for both business and pleasure.
Summary: Room clean and well maintained. Several options in the hotel to eat. Pizza place, Starbucks, hot grill and hotel restaurant. Car rental facility attached to hotel and it not not over priced. Very centrally located and best of all, very polite and friendly staff.
Manager Response: Hello sandranH8747HP,   Thank you for providing us with your feedback! We strive to offer top-notch service and comfort for all of our guests here at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort, so it makes us happy that you had a pleasant experience with us. We hope you see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful new hotel within easy walking distance to Disney!
Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn by Marriott at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center during the last week of January.  We were there with our daughter for her high school semester break.  I chose the hotel for its proximity to Disneyland and the type of room we booked.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a courtyard view (vs. a Park View), however we were on the top floor and had a peekaboo view of the fireworks one night.    The hotel is or at least looks brand, spanking new.  I'm going to guess due to Covid travel restrictions that it was mostly unoccupied for the past two year.  The new and stunning Anaheim Convention Center is beside this hotel and once conventions start to book again, I'm sure this hotel will be fully booked.   There was a full hot breakfast served in the
Manager Response: Hello mumofthreeabc,   Thank you so much for your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Narrowly delivered against the criteria 1) option for self-catering 2) proximity to go back and forth between hotel and Disney multiple times in a day.   1) the kitchen was well-equipped for frozen meals but anything more than that was impossible. Knives would not cut anything and the stove took forever to heat up. 2) I would say it's on the borderline of being too far to walk to/from Disney, especially if you're toting kids and other things.   Other feedback - Weird that they would have a kids room but the dining setup is not suited for kids. Counter stools were too low - kids would have to kneel/stand to reach the table, and then fall off because they were slippery against the tile - Kids room has no windows, I usually like to have them but kids didn't miss them. The view was
Manager Response: Dear Nitpicker011,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. Providing guests a relaxing and comfortable stay is one of our main priorities and I sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations. Thank you for providing your comments to help us improve. We hope we have another opportunity to be your hotel choice when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great choice for families.  Very short walk to Disneyland. Will stay here again
Summary: The corner of Katella and Harbor has become a center of hotels that are within very easy walking distance to the parks.   Residence Inn is very well located and a beautiful property.   Breakfast in the lobby.  Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf 200 feet from the front door.   Room was a bit tighter than many Residence Inns, but still ok.  Some rooms have a theme park view (for an extra cost) which would be nice to have a view of the fireworks.  We will certainly stay here on future Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: Hello SanFranciscoTRVLR,   Thank you for providing us with your feedback, and we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  We look forward to having you again!

Summary Heading: AVOID THIS PROPERTY - DAMAGE CHARGE SCAM
Summary: We stayed here for two nights to visit with friends and go to Disneyland. We used our hotel room only to sleep, and felt wonderful about our stay until checkout. That was, until two days later, when we noticed a $500 damage charge and several other unauthorized charges. When we called the hotel, they could not initially provided further information and let us know some of the charges would likely be removed. A couple days later, the $500 charge was processed. Upon calling the hotel again, we were informed of alleged damage in our room - a cracked stovetop - on a stovetop we never used in a room we hardly spent any time in. When asking for evidence of this damage, we were provided a photo of a cracked stovetop which was not dated nor did it confirm that it was taken in the actual
Manager Response: Dear Katyzee422,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us. I do understand your frustrations regarding the charge and sincerely apologize. It looks like it's still an ongoing investigation, the case is still open and we are looking further into it to resolve the issue.  Feel free to contact our property if you have any questions.   Thank you,

Summary Heading: AVOiD!  Does not comply with mask mandates!  Bot Safe!
Summary: We stayed at the hotel in the midst of Omicron surge.  California mandated masks indoors effective December 15.  This hotel not complying.  They ask for masks only for unvaccinated.  There is widespread non usage of masks.  I was trapped on several elevators with unmasked guests.  I’m furious now that I’ve learned this is in direct noncompliance of state mandates.  I plan to report.  If you are concerned about Covid, DO NOT STAY here!
Manager Response: Good Morning PassionForTravel42,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. It is through guests' feedback that we continue to improve upon the service we provide.  As we continue to navigate these challenging times, the health and safety of our guests and hotel associates remain our number one priority. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I appreciate you choosing to stay with us.

Summary: This is my first time staying here…won’t be my go to for future stays. Overall, hotel is clean but it lacks amenities…no ice bucket in rooms and ice only available on 1st and 6th floor…no water bottles available upon request. For the price one pays for a room here, I feel there are better options. It’s just ok.
Manager Response: Dear takemetravelingpleas,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We do apologize for the misunderstanding as we do have ice buckets in the room; the freezer does make ice for you and we sincerely apologize if that wasn't explained. Thank you for providing your comments to help us improve. We hope we have another opportunity to be your hotel choice when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: We stay over 100 nights per year at Marriott Bonvoy hotels. The only thing we ask for is our room to be cleaned.  We requested it when we checked in and then confirmed it was going to get done the next morning at 9AM before we left.  It was very disappointing to find out when we returned at 3:30 that our room was not cleaned. To add insult to injury, they offered us a measly 1,000 points. They want to charge you in full for the room, but they don’t want to give you what you are paying for. I suggest you try any hotel other than a Bonvoy.
Manager Response: Dear Venture615011,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. We do apologize for the miscommunication regarding our housekeeping scheduling and that we were unable to accommodate the requested housekeeping service time you made. We will use your feedback to ensure we're doing our best to communicate with our guests and housekeeping department to fulfill guest requests to the best of our ability. Thank you again for taking the time to leave your feedback.

Summary: We spent 6 nights here, and really could not have been happier. The hotel sits right behind Cars Land at DCA so it's a quick walk over to the parks. The location was great, plenty of stuff within walking distance. If you're only doing Disneyland, you don't even need a car. Our room was really nice, big, had everything we needed for a family of 5. The lobby was huge and very welcoming, and the breakfast was nice in the am! We would definitely come back!

This was my first big trip with my girlfriend and her family and I was given the opportunity to pick out the place to stay for our 5 night vacation so I had a lot of pressure on me. Them knowing I work in the Hospitality industry also gave me room for no errors in where we were going to stay so I had to choose wisely. I have to say, they were more than impressed by our stay! They loved everything about it, from the rooms, pool, hot breakfast and to top it all off, we’re just a few blocks from Disney. We booked 2 separate rooms and they were quite large and full of the essentials, not once did we need to request anything since we were loaded with everything. Super comfy beds were a huge relief given we were going to tired from being at the parks all day. I highly recommend this

Summary Heading: Excellent Property Made Magical by Great Service
Summary: Stayed here for  a short trip to Disneyland and California Adventure.  I had a problem with my reservation and asked for a change from the property.  I ended up talking to APRIL who was very helpful, and explained that the room type that I requested was full.  APRIL said she would talk to her manager and let me know.    I assumed that was the last I would hear from the hotel until my check-in.  Imagine my suprise when APRIL called me back to let me know that they had my room type available!    Not only did she take care of my request, she went out of her way to let me know.    My 9-year-old asked me "Why is our hotel so nice?"  Thank you APRIL.  BTW.  I type APRIL in all caps on purpose.  you should shot it when you read the review!

Summary Heading: Not a great value for the money
Summary: I’m so tired of businesses being super busy yet telling customers there’s no services like housekeeping. When I checked in, the front desk informed me then I couldn’t get room service unless I gave them 24 hour advanced notice. No room service for two days of stay. How about you email your customers this info on advance? There’s no mask enforcement and lots of entitled people with their too young to be vaccinated yet old enough to wear a mask running around. No one said a thing to any of them.   The room had no enhanced cleaning. None.   After paying $309/nt had to pay for parking too at now $24/nt despite advertised at $20.  Also the breakfast was never hot. Cold eggs, sausage and potatoes, and no microwaves downstairs to use. Gross.   Will not stay here again or any Residence
Manager Response: Hello amandainindy2015,  Thank you for providing us with your honest feedback. Due to new policies in place amid the pandemic, our housekeeping procedures had to be modified, and in order to respect the space of our guests, housekeeping services are provided only upon request, and the information had been conveyed upon your arrival.  We encourage our guests to wear a mask, but masks are optional and not required within the hotel if guests are vaccinated, following the guidelines set forth by Orange County's Department of Health.  Our breakfast is kept warm within warmers in our buffet and are constantly monitored by our team members. We apologize for falling short of your expectations, and this will be forwarded to our department managers to ensure that the issue is corrected.   Thank you for choosing the Residence Inn, and we hope you give us another chance the next time you visit the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Nice spot near Disneyland if you’re ok with walking 10-15 minutes! We (two adults) arrived on a Monday just around lunch and our room was ready. It was one of the corner rooms some people reference- lay out was a little strange. Luckily didn’t need the living room TV a lot, it was oddly placed relative to the couch. Kitchenette was clean/stocked. The pool was empty or almost empty all 3 times we went. Breakfast was plentiful and staff very covid conscious. Right near a CVS, Walgreens, local spots to eat. Would recommend if you want a spot where you can have your own snacks/meals. I would definitely consider staying again if in the are.

Beautiful hotel with helpful staff, even being short staffed. Great restaurant and bar area. Was there for my sisters muscle contest, and wish all the hotels hosting them were this great! Valet guys were awesome, wish I would have got their names!

Summary Heading: Don't stay until they have enough staff
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights. Our room was a studio suite king bed.  We didn't notice any enhanced cleaning if anything it seems that they are so understaffed that a lot of areas have been neglected. They only clean your room if you request a day in advance. When we got to our room, the carpet was dirty and could use a vacuuming and shampooing. I asked for housekeeping to come up the next day to vacuum since the floor was dirty. The next day, we left for Disney in the morning and came back to take an afternoon nap and the room still hasnt been cleaned. Housekeeping didn't come until around 4:20 pm. When they knocked, I asked if they can come back in 20 minutes so we can get ready and head out but they said it was too late. We don't blame housekeeping since they're probably so
Manager Response: Dear JoySM- JoySM,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. Maintaining a clean atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas is always a key priority, especially during these unprecedented times. On behalf of the entire team at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations.

Summary: My daughter & I stayed for 8 nights attending a dance convention/competition at the nearby Marriott. The 2 Queen rooms were a little small, but we made it work for the long stay. Beds were VERY comfortable. We loved that there was a hot breakfast option. The pool was GREAT to hangout during the day, although if you didn’t get there early-ish the towels would usually be all gone for the day. We also loved that you could request cleaning every day - just need to request the night before. Alexis at the front desk was also AWESOME. Anytime we needed something the service when calling the desk was VERY prompt. I also used the grill 2x and it worked perfectly. I would definitely recommend if you need to stay in the area.

We stayed at the end of June for 5 nights.  The room was a good size with 2 beds, separate living room with fully stocked kitchen and full size fridge!  The bathroom was really nice, the shower was huge and contemporary.  A big plus was they allowed dogs, they even had a dog park to go bathroom.    The pool area was our favorite.  They had a huge pool, a 20 person hot tub,  huge splash pad. and 2 fire pits.  Lots of tables and chairs to relax and congregate.   The gym was also big and had good cardio and weight training machines.   We would use the hot tub every evening after walking all day at Disney parks.  The parks are about a 15-20 min walk.   The breakfast was yummy.  The hot food was pre-boxed (due to Covid) and simple with scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage.  They

Summary Heading: Nice hotel unless you are sensitive to sound
Summary: There is so much about this hotel that is great... proximity to Disneyland, nice pool deck, modern decor, functional kitchen. BUT the AC/heating unit has some sort of condensation pump that turns on and off all day and night every few seconds. It was maddening. I called the front desk to complain, and the engineer they sent said they get a few complaints every day about this issue and that every room does it. The only way we could escape it was to completely shut off power to the AC via the circuit breaker. So you have to choose between AC or annoying pump noise. For this reason, I cannot stay at this hotel again, and I would advise anyone that is sensitive to noise to avoid as well.
Manager Response: Hello Y7655RD,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. We do apologize that your stay was not relaxing due to the noise from the AC unit in your room. We have shared your comments with management to have this corrected. Thank you again for taking the time to leave your feedback and we hope we have another opportunity to be your destination hotel when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: It looks nice but looks can be deceiving
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for four nights with my wife and 2 year old daughter. We were taking my 2 year old to Disneyland for her 2nd birthday. We wanted a property within walking distance to the gate. The hotel is new and looks beautiful. The staff was nice, polite although unhelpful and uninformed about their own property and did not follow through on requests for assistance. The biggest issue was the noise. The hotel was not built correctly and the walls are very thin. You can hear other parties very loudly through the ventilation system. There were several clicks/drips in the walls in the bathroom that lasted hours after flushing the toilet or using the sink. This was incredibly unnerving and persistent. You could hear everything being done in the room above you (sounded like
Manager Response: Hello Chris,   Thank you for taking the time to provide an honest review of your experience here at the Residence Inn.  Your comfort is our main priority, and on behalf of everyone at the hotel, we sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations. Since there were clicks and dripping sounds coming from the walls, our Engineer had to check the AC units and vents to ensure there were no issues there, but we understand your frustrations and we apologize for the delay in our response times and for being unable to resolve the persisting issues. Rest assured, your concerns have been addressed with the respective teams to prevent the same issues from occurring in future stays.   Thank you again, and we sincerely hope you consider giving us another chance the next time you visit the Anaheim Resort!

Summary Heading: Great location to Disney parks! Plentiful breakfast!
Summary: This was our first venture with a lot of tourists since the beginning of the pandemic. The hotel lobby was buzzing with plenty of Disney fans. We had a one-bedroom suite which was clean and nicely decorated. The clerk at the front desk advised us there would be no cleaning of the room unless we requested it 24 hours in advance. We appreciated the advance notice but we didn't bother with housekeeping since we only had planned a 2 night stay.  The Disney parks are located about a 15-minute walk away. You could choose to drive to the parks, but the parking shuttles aren't running, so you still have to walk anyways. In the neighborhood, there is a CVS located 2 minutes away from the hotel for any basic groceries, toiletries, and other items. Cheesecake Factory and Anaheim Garden

This Residence Inn at 640 W Katella Ave has been one of our favorite Disney area hotels because of the extra room in the family bunkbed suites, the proximity to the parks, the view of mission breakout, and the previous cleanliness of the hotel. But this trip did not meet our expectations.  Cleanliness: The hotel lobby was clean, open, and bright. Unfortunately, our room was not. I always do my own wipe downs before unpacking and regrettably discovered vomit or spilled milk (something dried, white, and chunky) on the couch. Kitchen counters had food crumbles. Bathrooms appeared clean but smelled vaguely of mildew. Housekeeping just did not seem up to par. We requested services on day 4 of our stay. I am not sure what they did, but it did not seem like much. They did provide a

This was our first hotel stay since COVID so I was extremly on edge over it all.  We mainly picked this hotel as it was a suite style and had a full kitchen and two queen beds.  The only downside is the room only had a shower.  Traveling with a toddler that is not really ideal but we managed for a couple days.  We had a theme park view.  While it was the backside of DCA, my toddler still loved to see the ferris wheel and rollercoaster so I would most likely book that view again.  Clenlieness - This is where I knocked off the star.  In a COVID world, I expect everything to be immaculate.  PRISTINE!!! While I was generally okay with the room, the bathroom could have been cleaner.  I had to wipe things down before it passed my own inspection.  Housekeeping was only done if

Summary Heading: Family's first trip to Disneyland - hotel sucked
Summary: Our family spent a fortune planning a 2 day visit to Disneyland and decided to make it a mother's Day weekend of fun. We booked a 1 bedroom suite with a king bed based of the pictures and information on line.  When we got to our room it  had two full beds. I called down and told them we booked a king.  I think the girl was annoyed because we wanted the room we booked with a king. She said she upgraded us to a city view and that's why we had 2 full beds. We literally had a view of the 10 story  parking garage wall. We went downstairs to switch keys to move.  To our surprise the room she gave us is half the size with a smaller couch. It's a tiny weird triangle corner room. The TV is stationary focusing toward the window so the kids can't even watch TV. When you unfold the couch it
Manager Response: Dear A7897RLmaggiem,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. We do apologize for any miscommunication during your arrival. We do our best to ensure we're providing our guests with all the necessary information at the time of check in. I understand how frustrating it must have been for the lack of information regarding the size of the originally booked room compared to the one you were upgraded to. Thank you again for sharing your comments and be please aware we will be addressing it with the appropriate team to ensure this is an isolated issue.

Summary Heading: PERFECT hotel for Disney and beyond!
Summary: My husband and I are big Disney fans, and even though the parks aren't open, we wanted to head over to Downtown Disney (which is open) to celebrate. We chose this hotel since it's dog friendly and was a close walk to the Harbor Boulevard entrance to Disney. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by Gloria who was so accommodating and even helped us get a park view (since it's COVID and was mid-week). Our suite was incredible- it's the perfect place for a family to stay with its modern kitchenette, living room and bedroom. Even though the restaurants on site were closed, the bagged breakfasts were awesome, and appreciated. Gloria also explained that postmates can easily deliver to the hotel. Finally, the best part of the hotel was its rooftop pool- large, sunny, and with a

We had an excellent experience here. Gloria at the front office was most helpful, and went above and beyond to ensure our long-term stay is nothing less than home-like. Thank you!   Highly recommend for families, couples, or if you are on a business trip. Excellent hotel with excellent service. Will definitely stay here again!

Stayed at the hotel during a conference and had a great experience. Edgar at the front desk was extremely helpful and had great customer service. The hotel is at a great location walking distance to restaurants and downtown Disney. The room was very clean and having a kitchen in the room helped during these pandemic times. I will definitely come back with the family once Disneyland fully opens.

The clean-up here is amazing as well as the set up. This place is so comfortable and will automatically feel as if you are living in your own mini house. The staff and service here are so kind as well, this made our family stay for a longer time than we intended! 100% recommend for those who are traveling around the area :).

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel with equally great staff!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 10 times in the past two years. We travel for medical treatment for our children and this hotel specifically the Assistant Manager Diego Ortiz has been so wonderful and welcoming to our family each time we come. Many of the staff has gotten to know our children well. They are so great they let us leave a suitcase with our frequently used items  and car seat on property so we Don’t have to fly with it. We came about every 6-8 weeks and they were wonderful year round. Walking to Disney is very manageable even pushing a triple stroller. I can not recommend this hotel enough, clean, well managed and personable.

Residence Inn by Marriott at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center (Disneyland)  640 W Katella Ave, Anaheim Ca 92802  3 1/2 Star  Value ☆☆☆ Cleanliness ☆☆☆☆ Location ☆☆☆☆ Room Comfort ☆☆☆☆☆  Extras – Vons Groceries, City Stroller Rentals are all delivered there. FREE Daily Continental Breakfast Free WiFi Parking $27.60 usd  Suite, 1 Bedroom, Resort View (Theme Park View) Sleeps 6 – Beds very comfortable, Floor 8 * Two Queen * 1x double sofa bed that offered good padding. * Full kitchen  $400 AUD a night (you can get it much lower around $300 aud a night) We paid extra for the 'Theme Park View', Guardians of the Galaxy and Pixar Pier views. Some of the pictures used in advertising the 'Theme Park View' are a bit miss leading, you are not that close to the park.  Staff are super nice

Summary Heading: Most upscale Residence Inn  I’ve ever seen!
Summary: I am a titanium elite member and don’t typically care to spend many nights in Residence Inns. I prefer the higher brands of the brand such as Ritz Carlton, Westin & JW Marriott. I selected this hotel because it was the closest in proximity to Disneyland, as I knew we’d be walking. The free breakfast rivals that of a more upscale hotel. Waffle makers in the shape of Mickey mouse, an oatmeal/parfait station with toppings such as almonds, coconut and chocolate chips. Their fresh fruit selection was really nice. The rooms, beds, kitchens and bathroom were all really nice. The lobby was spacious and huge like a regular Marriott.  The only thing that needed improvement in my opinion is the couch in the living room. It is like vinyl pieces of brick. If you lean back the pieces of the

My family and I recently stayed in a family suite (the one with the separate kids bunkbed room). We had originally booked a theme park view, however upon check in they informed us that they had accidentally given away our room the day before, and that the view would be different. Long story short, they reduced the rate we paid and we had a view of the pool instead.  Housekeeping is a significant problem with this hotel. The kids bathroom was really dirty:  the door frame ledge on the bottom was  covered in thick dust, the corners of the floor were gross, with piles of debris and hair. There were dried urine spots on the toilet bowl. The adult bathroom (specifically the toilet) was only cleaned once during our stay (5 nights) and the sheets were not changed on a regular basis.
Manager Response: Dear Chicagomama1234,   Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center with us.   As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your guestroom fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team  in an effort to improve our service.   We hope you choose to stay with  us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim. .

Summary: My family of 3 spent 3 night here in the Theme Park View King room. It cost $1,400 Cdn. What a rip off.  Pros: close to park and CVS       breakfast buffet decent  Cons: although I requested early check-in months earlier and extra towels, we were told to bugger off when we came in a couple of hours early. Flying in from Canada with a 3 year old we would have loved to have a nap and freshen up. We came in at 130 and they said they'd text us at 4 when the room was ready but they didn't. We didn't get extra towels either.         they sent an email saying I could check in online and I requested an early check-in and extra towels. We recieved neither.         their was no view of the park for which I had paid extra for, although the palm trees outside our window and the hotel across
Manager Response: Dear 369vikingf,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for not being able to accommodate and early check-in for you; early check-ins are based on availability. We also apologize for the room type not meeting your expectations; for the Disney view rooms you are not able to see inside the park because Disneyland does not allow any business to look inside the parks; however, you are able to see the fireworks from the room. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: Great location.  Clean, spacious, comfortable and nicely decorated rooms. Great breakfast. Pizza Hut in lobby was good. Nice little bar in lobby. Easily walk to Disneyland parks and downtown disney.  Easy access to drug stores, restaurants. Area surrounding property felt safe and was clean

Definitely enjoyed our stay. Clean room, very spacious suite with plenty of room for everyone, great customer service, yummy complimentary breakfast, and perfect distance to Disneyland. Enjoyable and perfect stay for the family.

Just a short walk to the front gate, this hotel is within walking distance of less expensive options outside Disney and has many amenities to offer.   Kids took advantage of my Bonvoy suite upgrades and got the bunkbed suite they wanted.  Free breakfast, pool, spa, and splash park!!!! for non-Disney days.  Tolerable parking costs per day with plenty of parking room available.  Kitchen allowed for packing meals for on-the-go.

Everyone we came across at this hotel was super friendly and helpful.  We stayed 2 night in the middle of a trip to L.A. while visiting Disney.  We walked to parks each day with two kids - one in stroller and didn't find it too far.  The Pizza Hut on site was an added bonus as it was easy to grab on way back to room, and having the fridge and kitchen helped.  The breakfast each morning was plentiful and got us going full and ready to tackle the parks.  WOuld definitely stay there on a future trip to Anaheim

We were really happy here and will return. They had balloons and a birthday card signed by everyone with some treats in the room for our 5yo birthday.  He was soooooo happy about it. I don't even remember telling anyone it was his birthday!  The property was very nice. Lots of space for a family. Great walking distance to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Fell short in a couple of areas
Summary: The hotel is lovely and clean. Breakfast was awesome, and the pool is heated well enough for swimming in February.  Unfortunately we only had a single sheet on our queen size bed- I’m 5’11” and had no trouble stretching the sheet between my hands from side to side. We also had to ask for toilet paper, and even then only got one roll.

Stayed for a Conference in December. What can I say, there are no words to describe the  attention to detail, the customer service, the cleanliness and overall ambience of this hotel. My only wish is that my trip was longer. Front desk was very helpful. They gave me positive advice for finding a  particular restaurant that I  wanted to walk  to one night.  The breakfast was out of this world, fresh and delicious. Mickey shaped waffles were a plus for me. Made me get that real Anaheim-Disney vibe. Still trying to figure out that delicious vegetarian breakfast option, soooo good and it was  refreshing to  go somewhere that has something more than bacon and pork  sausage options.

The staff who work the morning breakfast are great. I'd like to thank Raymond O. Who went above and beyond to make sure my wife had her breakfast the way she likes it. It's the lil things that matter here like toasting someone's sandwich. Thanks ramyond.

We stayed here 2 nights as a family of 4 while we went to Disneyland.   It was about a 10-12 minute walk to the parks which was so nice.  We had a two bedroom two bathroom suite which was huge.  It was like an apartment and we enjoyed having the extra room.  Service was very good, complimentary breakfast was very good as well.  They are busy but everything run very smoothly. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Planned a week long trip to Disneyland and spent a lot of time deciding on which Marriott property to stay at. Since we had 2 young grandkids with us, we opted for the Residence Inn and went for the kids suite. It was a great choice. 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, one room had bunkbeds. The bathroom off the kids room had a bathtub rather than a shower.  The free breakfast was delicious and had a great selection. The front desk staff was helpful and responsive. Highly recommend this hotel for a Disneyland vacation

You can’t beat the short walk to the Disney front gates. Hotel was super clean. RI “Cast Members” (a la Disney) were spectacular and knowledgeable. Surrounding areas felt very safe no matter what time of day or night. Only wish somehow garage was connected to the hotel without walking outside.

Hi we have just returned from a 3 week stay at your hotel. AMAZING is one word that comes to mind we could not fault a thing from the house keepers to the breakfast staff every person that works there is so pleasent and helpful!!! This hotel is so clean and smells great the added bonus was the pool and laundry room best I have ever  seen in a hotel. A very pleasent 7 minute walk to Disneyland. We have stayed at alot of hotels and this one would have the best breakfast selection and actual space to always be guaranted a space to sit.

We spent days agonising over which hotel to choose for the 3-day Disneyland part of our trip & couldn't have been happier with the Residence Inn. Staff were friendly, suites are ginormous, well equipped & spotlessly clean. This was somewhat wasted on us, as we spent the entire time/ every night in the parks, but did squeeze in a swim on the rooftop pool before we checked out for our long flight home -- ah the beautiful blue skies of LA! Breakfast was surprisingly good, especially considering how busy it was with excited children/ convention attendees etc. Only 10-15 walk to the main entrance of Disneyland, meaning no need for taxis/ Ubers or buses. Nice to stroll along in the morning with a takeout coffee from breakfast. Would highly recommend.

The hotel is modern and very clean.  The staff is professional while friendly.  The staff made our stay nice and they were very helpful.  We had a problem at check in, the staff was very helpful and pleasant during this frustrating time. The manager stepped in  and took care of everything.  He stepped up to make the customer satisfied. This hotel was not as fault (booking error with Marriott) but he stepped up and straightened out the issue while keeping us happy.  He was polite and professional while maintaining our satisfaction.  We will be staying here from now on after our experience here!  The staff made our stay wonderful!

Summary Heading: Great place to rest your head
Summary: Here for a convention, great location - right next door to the convention center.  Plus, great proximity to the parks if you don't mind walking a few blocks.  Breakfast is delicious and very convenient.  Beds were too stiff for my taste.

Summary Heading: great for families - next to disneyland
Summary: This suite hotel was perfect for our family of 6 when staying for disney. When we checked in, Livy and Mary were so cheerful and attentive, finding us the best room for our family. Great breakfast with little details like Mickey Mouse waffle makers, and a 10 -15 minute walk and you're in the parks. Pool and hot tub deck was also beautiful and fun for kids.   I would definitely stay here again! Thanks !

Room is odd layout; toilet and closet share a door. The door that separate living room and bedroom cannot be closed because doors are bigger than the entrance. A/C and heater was noisy. Kitchen door no thigh because my 2.5 years old can open easily (scary to see that). Front desk was not helpful and don’t care of guest. I lost one of my diamond earring in my car, since it was late (8pm) and my phone was only at 5% battery life, I went to front desk and ask to borrow their flash light. The girl said she need to call her engineer and he will have to come with me. I said okay, I sat there, waited for 15 minutes, went back and ask if someone will come soon; the front desk girl said I should wait and turn back laughing with her peers. I wait for another 5 minutes then left since
Manager Response: Dear mandy2004,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim resort/Convention Center.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for room layout not meeting your standard as well as how our staff was not helpful. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue.  Once again, thank your for your valued feedback.

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights to visit Disneyland over New Years. Only a 10 minute walk to Disney entrance so very convenient. Very modern with breakfast included which was handled very well considering the crowds. More like a convention hotel but we had an enormous 2 bedroom apartment which was stunning however because you are in Disney all day it was a bit wasted. There did not seem to be a restaurant at night which would have been good

Summary Heading: Everything about this place is excellent
Summary: We stayed here for a Disney trip with a 9, 7, &3 year old. Couldn’t have met all our needs more perfectly. We got a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and pull out sofa. Plenty of space for all 5 of us. The room and entire hotel was very clean. Staff was awesome-friendly, prompt, cared about our experience. Location was great. 10 minute walk to the park entrance. Free breakfast every morning was very good. Always a big selection and they were well able to accommodate the rush of people trying to eat before heading to the parks. Huge hot tub! Pool was also warm enough for our kids to swim middle of January, even when it was only 60 degrees outside.

Overall I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were well set out, spacious and had everything needed to support a family. The location was walking distance to everything you need and nothing was too much trouble for the staff if you asked. Well done and see you next time.

After reading tons of reviews we selected this hotel for our first ever Family Disney vacation. We were not disappointed. We loved the hotel so much that we have already rebooked a return trip this summer.  The location is ideal (15 minute walk to the gates with kids), the rooms are generous (standard two queen suite slept all five of us), the breakfast is plentiful and well run, the staff is pleasant and accommodating and the pool area is super fun (no water slide, but it’s on the roof!!). You won’t find a better family hotel off Disney property (and Disney hotels don’t come with free breakfast folks).

I like this hotel a lot this is my 4th time here. There is a nice view from the  pool and the jacuzzi. Is walking distance to Disney. There is this place call the Garden Walk that there are a lot a restaurants, me and my husband usually go walking to diner. Right in the corner if the hotel is CVS and across the street is Walgreens. We checked inn early and the room was ready, the receptionist was really attentive and polite, sorry that I don’t remember your name.  The rooms are spacious with a bedroom, living room and a full kitchen. Is a full delicious complimentary breakfast, that saves you a lot of money. So you can go with a full stomach to enjoy your day to Disneyland or any place you go for the day!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay by Disneyland!
Summary: This is a great place to stay close to Disneyland!  We stayed in a two bedroom suite with bunk beds & bathroom on one side & two queen beds & bathroom on the other side with kitchen, living are in the middle. So nice & quiet for kids & parents, grandparents. So nice to have two bathrooms getting ready to spend a magical day in Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again!  Oh & the breakfasts were wonderful!

We were meeting up with all my children and grandchildren to spend two days at Disney/California adventure.  We were able to check into the hotel at 7am, leave our bags with the front desk and enjoy the breakfast buffet before heading off to the park.  It was an easy walk from the hotel.  we got the text when our rooms were ready and checked into our rooms for a little rest.  I was pleasantly surprised by the free upgrade to a two room suite with bunk beds that made the stay even more pleasant as the little ones got they're own room and bathroom.

Great place to stay for our second Disney trip - the front desk was very accommodating and extremely helpful.  Location is a quick walk to Disney and the complimentary breakfast is a good way to start the day.  I would have no hesitation in recommending this Marriott.

Great location for Disneyland!  We were able to park car in the garage and walk to Disneyland.  We had a suite and it was perfect for a family of 5.  I was very impressed with a gorgeous pool, large spa, kids water spray park and relaxing fire pits.  I wish we had more time to enjoy it.  Finally, the breakfast is the morning was excellent!  Lots of choices with food and drinks.  I loved the iced coffee machine.  We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Highly Recommend This Hotel for 2020 Disney Goers
Summary: Out of all the Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotels, this is by far the best...and we've stayed at A LOT of hotels in the area. It is on the pricey side, but if you can afford it, it gives you the most bang for your buck.  We stayed in a one bedroom king room and we LOVED IT. The shower & bathroom is one of the best in the area, the bed was firm but comfortable, the room was well appointed, quiet and spotless, the TVs allowed you to access your Netflix account but the best feature of the room was the fully stocked kitchen. It had a dishwasher, fridge with freezer and ice maker, toaster, coffee maker, cook top and all the dishes/pots & pans you could need. There is also a safe, full sized hair dryer, tons of towels and premium toiletries. One thing to note is there is no oven in the

The location was second to none. It’s an 8 minute walk from the park main entrance. It’s next to a big cvs and close to the a variety of restaurants. The rooms were spacious. The breakfast had a big selection of food.

Very close to Disneyland, entrance is within walking distance. There is a shuttle, but we never used it. Nice room with lots of space, nice view of Disney. Really good complimentary breakfast, but can get pretty crowded.

Very close walking distance to Disneyland.  The staff was friendly and nice. Cool room. Liked the touch key room access.  Stocked kitchen was nice and suite setup reduced noise. Seat in shower was ridiculously small for size of shower. Was put on 4th floor although requested 'High floor' (Hotel has 9 floors).  Parking structure was detached from hotel.

We had a wonderful stay.  I will simply list the pros and cons, as well as conclude the I highly recommend staying at this property for anyone who has a family and/or needs a suite. I am comparing this stay with a neighboring property with the same exact philosophy as the Residence Inn does.  Pros: - Newer modern construction - Very clean - Comfy pillows and bed.  Nice linens. - Great hair and body products in the shower. - Very descent breakfast offering hot food, and almost anything one could imagine they would want to eat for breakfast. - Great location for access to Disneyland - friendly, professional staff at the front desk, as well as at breakfast - a small bar for those who need a drink - Decent pizza and hot snacks available at the Pizza Hut downstiars. - The living area

Summary Heading: Love this hotel for Disney Trips!
Summary: This hotel is within walking distance to the parks, we love the location.  Has an amazing breakfast, so many options. Love the rooms, plenty of room for the whole family.  We enjoy the pool, splash pad for the kids and hot tub!

So, lots of ups and downs (service, breakfast, cleanliness, housekeeping, location) - but overall it was an enjoyable stay. On the map it seems much closer to the entrances to the parks, so be ready to trek to the gates.  Breakfast was delicious, always full, always hot and the staff in charge were very friendly.  We felt like the price was really high (averaging $60/person) when a typical hotel stay averages half that per person - but the property is newer and has all the amenities you need. I wish we hadn't run out of body wash halfway through our showers, and they really get busy so it's always full in the lobby and in the elevators. Parking surprisingly, was not as expensive as we imagined and there was a lot of availability.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but you are on your own!
Summary: We just finished staying eight days at this hotel and had a wonderful time. We love the property with its location and amenities, but the housekeeping service in this Inn is challenging.  The first day we had no service at all; each other day we had to ask no less than twice to get cleaning. One day we had to call and ask four times. In no case did we get service before 3pm each day. I even left a $15 to $20 tip each day!  I guess the ultimate insult to injury was the feet last day, when the housekeeper was banging on the door (with a Do Not Disturb sign) at 11:02!  They could just do a better job.

Rooms are really nice- modern- nice kitchens!!  Great convenient location- 10 min walk to parks.  Convenient parking garage next to hotel.  Lots of amenities nearby-CVS & Walgreens on sand block. Would stay here again!!

Overall a good stay.  Breakfast repetitive.  rooms were not cleaned on a regular basis. I had to rwquest room cleaning.  Shower gels and shampoo not checked for refills.  Had to request these too.  Shame the room have not windows which one could open for fresh air.  No regard for climate protection-  Excessive use of disposables and one time plastics.  Sad to see in 2019.  Staff courteous and readily available.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, here at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center we strive to provide all guest alike with excellent customer service. Based on your review it looks like we have fallen short of your expectations of this property and for this I apologize on behalf of the hotel. We have shared this review with the appropriate staff to correct this issues from occurring.

Summary: The hotel was a block from the convention center which is where our conference was.  The one bedroom suite was nice with a frig, small stove and microwave.  The hotel is walking distance from downtown Disney and close to the Disney park.  Plenty of restaurants near by as well.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The complimentary breakfast spread was one of the best I've seen.  Plenty of food and options.  I would stay here again if I came back to Anaheim.

We had a great time at this hotel and were so impressed with the service, particularly Rocio who helped us out during breakfast. She was just delightful!   This hotel was a perfect centre point for our trip. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable, but all that aside it was the friendliness of staff and Ricio that made our trip

The hotel was beautiful. The rooms were spacious with comfortable beds and a plethora of pillows and the bathroom was awesome. The full kitchen was very well stocked and the refrigerator would be very useful for a family with young children. We loved the breakfast which was beautifully presented and plentiful. They also had Soy milk! I We walked to and from the parks and there also is the shuttle bus service, which you need to purchase passes before use.

Stayed here a few weeks ago and blown away on how amazing it was. Front desk was so friendly and went way above and beyond my expectations! The free breakfast buffet was amazing!! Would keep us full and the walk to disney was only 15 minutes. The rooftop pool was just what my sore feet needed.  Amazing! Cvs within a 2 minute walk so we would stock up since we had a fridge. Would absolutely stay here again!

We stayed at the Disney view 2 bedroom suite. It accommodated our family of five comfortably for 2 nights while we visited Disneyland Park. We took UBER to the taxi drop off areas at Disneyland which took no more than 5 minutes during a busy morning. You can also walk for 10-15 minutes. Getting back to the hotel with Uber took less than 5 minutes. We actually went back to the hotel for a nap in the afternoon and returned back to the park in early evening time.  Hotel is a good value for families, breakfast buffet is included. Unfortunately, No room service or restaurant for lunch or dinner. Right outside there are many restaurants. Gym very simple, I wished there were free eights. Pool and jacuzzi seemed nice, we didn’t use.  If you plan to go to the parks and want to stay close

My family and I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. As a large family of 6, we really enjoyed the extra space the room had to offer. Everything was clean, and well taken care of. The daily complimentary breakfast was amazing. The staff was friendly as well. Our view was of the back side of Disney California Adventure but the kids still enjoyed seeing everything lit up at night. It is only about a 10 or 15 min walk to get to the Disney entrance. My only minor complaint is that our room only had a shower, no bathtub. Which isn't a big deal for myself or older kids, but it makes it hard to bathe toddlers or babies.  We plan on staying here again next year.

Summary Heading: Family friendly property close to Disneyland
Summary: A beautiful property which provides everything a family could need if visiting Disneyland. A delicious buffet breakfast each morning was a great way to start the day, and returning to a clean and tidy room with kitchen facilities made our stay very pleasant. Great pool and spa facilities as well as a water playground for the kids. Easy walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney, as well as other nearby dining options.

Nice hotel with modern upgrades. Would definitely stay there again. Large rooms and good breakfast included. Also a really nice pool area that we took advantage of. Close to Disneyland, only about a ten minute walk and conveniently located right beside a cvs pharmacy and across the street from Walgreens.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for your Disneyland Visit
Summary: We stayed in a double queen room for 3 nights during our visit to Disneyland. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk to the park entrance so it was manageable without needing to pay for a shuttle ride. The room was great, 2 queen beds plus a separate living room with pull-out couch. The kitchen with a full-size fridge and stove allowed us to eat in dinner in the room. The breakfast was very good - but I'd recommend going early (before 7) as it gets quite busy later in the AM. Lastly, the pool area was amazing - the kids enjoyed the large pool, splash area and large hot tub after returning from the parks. We'd definitely recommend staying at this hotel when we head back to Disneyland.

We stayed at this location from 10/11-10/14. The resort is a short walk to Disneyland, which was our main reason for booking at this location. Our check-in was quick and friendly even though we arrived around 11pm. We were given a room upgrade to a 2 queen bed suite with a couch pullout versus our King Studio suite with the couch pullout. This worked out very well so both of our children could have their own space during our stay. The room was spacious, well maintained, and the beds were soft and comfy. I enjoyed the Paul Mitchell shower products versus the regular cheap toiletries. The front desk staff were always polite, courteous, and said hello every time we walked in the doors. The free breakfast every morning was wonderful! Providing enough variety for the entire family to

Summary Heading: The Staff Makes All The Difference
Summary: Starting at check-in, I was most impressed with the professionalism and friendliness of the young women at the front desk. In the breakfast room, the staff did a splendid job attending to the needs of the many guests and kept the area spotless. Well done to all!

Summary Heading: Spacious family hotel walkable to Disney, with amazing breakfast and pool!
Summary: This was the first of two hotels we stayed at in Anaheim. We were able to walk about 18 minutes to the pedestrian entrance of Disney, so walking there and back with a hotel break in between was easy.   The breakfast was one of my favorite parts of staying here - lots of hot food options and a make-your-own waffle station in the shape of Mickey!   The rooftop pool was AMAZING - a splash pad for toddlers and plenty of available shade and umbrellas. This was a haven for those sticky afternoons when the kids couldn't take the long lines and the crowds.   The room itself was good - clean, comfortable, and quiet, with views of the World of Color fireworks! However we were in the corner room, so the living room portion of the suite was a little small and in the weird rhombus shape.

Lovely hotel with great breakfast and large rooms for families.  The pool and spa were a great bonus and the hotel is within walking distance to and from the Disney Parks.  We would recommend this hotel to all families traveling with a large number of people and how convenient it was to get around the area.

We stayed here for 5 nights and couldn’t have been happier with the room, facilities and location. We had a two bedroom family suite with Disney view and it suited our family of four perfectly. Great to have a pool, small gym and laundry facilities on site. And so close to Disneyland!! We would definitely recommend and come back here 😊

Nice, clean, quite and close to Disneyland Was a stress free place and the workers and checkin people were very helpful. A free shuttle would have been nice. The only downfall was breakfast was lukewarm at best.

Booked a room for 5 adults. $503.00 a night for a postage stamp with bathroom.  What really tee's me up was they had a better room for 2 ofour 3 night stay.  But they would give it to us even though we were willing to pay more and move.  Customer service is typical CA. Millenial.   Pretty much go Fuzz yourself.   Stuck for the girls dance at  Disneyland.   My recommendation blow off Marriot like they will you.    And blow CA. because just about ever were in the world is a better value with real appreciation for you business.
Manager Response: Dear Motoair1,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for not meeting your expectation.
