Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great location walking distance to D-Land and Family Friendly
Summary: 3 blocks from the park entrance so you can take a break mid day and come back and relax before going back to the park. Awesome pool deck with kids water zone and hot tub after a long day at the park. Free large breakfast buffet daily which was perfect before heading out. It is a busy hotel with a lot of kids but we found the staff to be fantastic and helpful. New redesigned hotel and it shows.

No I was not  visiting Disneyland!  I wish I had young children to give me some reason to go. I was visiting my son who attends Chapman University near by. We are Marriott members so we choose this hotel and used points. Great choice. It is across the street from Disney and was a short drive to Chapman. The hotel room are in the apartment style with a living room and kitchen. Immaculate. There is a lovely pool and outdoor area on the sixth floor so quiet( except for the tons of kids in the pool at the end of the day!). The breakfast buffet is extensive and child oriented but  lots of fresh fruit, eggs and oatmeal to satisfy a healthy diet. They did have make your own Mickey waffles with whipped cream- I looked the other way with difficulty. The breakfast is included and is in a

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for Family Disney Trip
Summary: We loved our stay here! The property was immaculate and very new feeling. Rooms were nice and big and we loved how close it was to the park. We also loved having a full kitchen and a separate living room, it made traveling with a toddler very easy in regards to meal time and nap times. The pool/splash pad was a welcome break from the craziness of the park, and breakfast offerings were excellent. Would 100% stay here again!

Everything about this hotel was amazing!! I would highly recommend it to all my family and friends. I have stayed in many off sites hotels throughout the years and nothing compares to this.   It's about a 10 minute walk to the parks, 1 minute from a CVS and a coffee shop if needed. The hotel serves a free continental breakfast that was filled with everything you heart could desire.   We stayed in a kitchenette/one king/one sleeper sofa room, it was very large and had plenty of room for the four of us, 3 adults and 1 child. Everything about the room was clean and the beds were very comfy.    The only con I have is the price of parking, which is $25.00 a day. The bright side to this is it's in a  secure parking garage right next to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: My family was originally staying at a nice hotel down the street, but we had a few family memebers decide to come along for the last two nights of our vacation. We called  Residence Inn and we were greeted professionally and friendly. We were able to get a room large enough for our families. (Two families). Breakfast was great, hotel was very beautiful and clean. Will stay here again. We were also given the military rate, and so thankful for that!

Great location near the convention center and Disney. Clean and modern rooms and  property with 24 hr security guard. Pets are allowed and they take extra measures to make sure the rooms are thoroughly cleaned. Friendly and accommodating staff.

When we walked into the lobby, we thought we were at the wrong hotel! Our company never puts us up at places this nice! As my husband said, the suite was bigger and nicer than his first apartment! The room had a wonderful kitchenette and was very clean and modern. I personally loved the layout of the room and all the counter space. The hotel is within walking distance of the shuttle stop for Disneyland, the Convention Center, and the Garden Walk. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and a Walgreens and CVS just a block away. I would definitely stay here if I were to go back to the Anaheim area.

We booked Residence Inn by Marriot for 2 nights and it was a very nice experience. The room was spacious, clean and quite. The location is also very good: close to Disneyland (15 mins walk), a lot of restaurants nearby and an amazing pool at the 6th floor.

The hotel was a good location for the D23 expo. Although it was on the pricey side at over $300 a night.   If going to the parks I would chose the howard Johnson or Paradise Pier.  My husband is a titanium member and it would have been nice to have been upgraded or have a late check out. This was our third stay but because of the high price and really horrible view I will book elsewhere next time.
Manager Response: Dear JamieMarieB,   Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. I do apologize that you felt your Elite status was not appreciated and that the view was not up to your standards. We appreciate your loyalty to Marriott and will speak to the respectful teams to ensure that we are recognizing our members and doing our best to provide the quality service to our guests' expecations.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: beautiful hotel..will be staying here again for sure...great location walking distance to Disneyland and rooms were very nice and spacious and it's great that it has a kitchen and all that you could need to have a nice family time.  Would recommend it highly.  Have stayed a lot of places close to the park and this is one of the nicest.

Summary Heading: Was a good stay. Disappointed jacuzzi was not working and room had only been partially cleaned.
Summary: Stayed September 10th to the 14th, 2019.  Nice hotel, great location to Disneyland Resort for a family without young children, so we didn't mind a few minutes longer walk (12 to 15 minute walk depending on if we caught the crosswalk lights) to the park than closer hotels.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had two queen beds in the room and a pull-out bed/sofa in the living room.  Had a TV in both rooms!  Upon arrival we found there was some sort of powder on the carpet and the overall appearance of the room looked as though it had NOT been thoroughly cleaned.  Appeared as though housekeeping forgot to finish vacuuming.  Kitchen counters were sticky too.  Called to have the room finished up and was told that the powder was put down to rid the carpet of odor.  Many apologies

We are a couple in our 50s. My husband does computer work from the room and I attended an event at the convention center. I saw this building go up and I was excited as we are longtime Marriott members. The location could not be better if you were going to Disney or the convention center. You do not need to rent a car.  Probably none of my review pertains to the amazing staff who is professional nor the cleanliness or maintenance of this hotel. What I hope or who I hope reads it, is upper management who can pass this along to Marriott corporate who designs their buildings and rooms etc. I am perplexed what they were thinking this cannot be their first time out the gate? Again location is great but you know many of your clients will be going to the convention center as they cater
Manager Response: Dear Dawn,   Thank you for taking the time and writing a review on our beautiful property. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us at the hotel. Concerning an alternate entrance towards the back of the property, this building when it was design and been built did not have the convention center parking structure located behind it, it was just an open area thus the reason why the back entrance does not exist. However I do want to apologize for the lack of luggage rack and storage area in your suite. Here at the Residence Inn we strive to provide a service so memorable that our guest tell stories about it. We will be sure to share this review and information to our leadership team here at the Residence Inn so we can better ourselves for all guest alike. Once again I appreciate your feedback and I hope you have a wonderful day.

Summary Heading: Clean, welcoming, & very close to Disneyland.
Summary: Great hotel, loved the full refrigerator, & Pizzahut on site made for easy late night snacks. I appreciate the option to turn off daily maid service. Room was specious & the A/C worked great. 15 minute walk to Disneyland & lots of restaurants in walking or short drive distance. Complimentary hot breakfast is good & coffee is fresh.

We used points to book a last-minute night by Disneyland and this is the one we chose, while it could use some updates and small fixes here and there it was amazing. I even recommended to my brother and his family because the family suites are perfect for those with little kids.  We got there early in the am and our room was ready but the room key didn't work so they moved us to the same room type on a lower floor-we left went to the parks to return at 11 pm and the air conditioning wasn't working, it kept switching to heat so we moved again and this time they put us in one of those family suites--which we didn't need but was great to see so I could recommend.  Really spacious. Big kitchen. Bunk beds, sep bathroom. TV in all three rooms.  The service was amazing. They were so

Just a great hotel. Friendly and competent staff. 15 min walk or 5 min drive to Downtown Disney. Had a room with park view. Watched the Disney fireworks from the room. Parking in a structure next to hotel for an extra fee. Disney tickets sold on premises - saves time at park entry.

Summary Heading: Rooms may be different than advertised
Summary: I was really excited to stay at this hotel. My family of 6 and I arrived from out of state and upon entering the room to seemed different than what I saw on the Marriott website. I looked it up and realized our main room had a small window and smaller couch than shown in the picture and the bedroom didn't have a chair. Then 2 days later I saw the room across the hall that was being cleaned and realized our room was much smaller and darker due to the smaller window. I don't know how we ended up with this room, but I was very disappointed. Also there is very little storage. There are 3 small drawers that aren't even 12 inches deep in the bedroom and a few hangers. Luckily I brought hangers with me or we would not have any place to unpack. Not being able to unpack for 5 nights
Manager Response: Dear Flyer496906,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We apologize that the room did not meet your expectations. If it was brought to our attention that the room did not meet your standard during your needs, we would have done our best to accommodate your family and your requests.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Best Residence Inn Ive Stayed At
Summary: As a Bonvoy Platinum, Ive been to many Residence Inns.  This was by far the best one Ive stayed at.  Absolutely beautiful property with great service to match.  Not to mention its so close to Disney.  Ill absolutely be back.

Excellent suites -- comfortable beds, amazing pool area,  excellent kitchen. Such a nice easy walk into Disneyland. Awesome breakfasts. The perfect accommodation. I would recommend this hotel to any family looking for a Disneyland vacation.

This was a good Disneyland hotel. We weren't there much. Just took advantage of breakfast. The buffet spread was good, they had everything you would need, waffles, eggs, bacon, ham, yogurt, fruit, muffins, etc. Their drip coffee was surprisingly good also.   Location is about a block and a half to Disneyland which is perfect and a totally doable walking distance. There is also a CVS in the same parking lot which is convenient when you have kids. There is also a Coffee Bean in the lot which was also handy. They also have a Pizza Hut onsite, though we didn't take advantage of that.   We had a one bedroom suite which was perfect, it gave us the space we needed to wind down after the kids went to bed. Bathroom was a nice size. Was able to fit 2 of us at a time.   We took a break

The hotel is located very close to Disneyland and is a nice, clean hotel.  We had a 2 bedroom executive suite that happened to be located under the exercise room so there were times when there were loud bangs coming from the ceiling (someone was obviously using equipment that made a lot of noise).  I don't understand why any hotel would put a room under an exercise room that is open from 7 am to 10 pm???

Mrs. Lourdes, Maria, Rosio have provided excellent customer service, hospitality, and patience to our family.  They've always been very kind, helpful, and positive towards their approach.  We would like to thank them for all their hardwork, dedication, and passion.  Thank you very much!!!! ~The Bhatt Family <3

Stayed here for D23 Expo 2019. One of the closest hotels within walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center. Not having room service is SUPER annoying, but many of the restaurants nearby deliver with one or more of the popular apps. Took a star off because one of the replacement hand towels was dirty and there was errant hair on another. Otherwise the rest of the room was cleaned well every day. If you’re staying here more than one night, bring your own water to store in the fridge, and if you want to brew your own coffee, bring filters for the machine.

There is not really anything that I could say bad about the room or stay.  Marriott customer service is always exceptional and if anything is needed they never hesitate to meet that need.  They are almost apologetic that you had to ask for anything.  They accommodated many requests from various people while we were there for the week and did so with a smile and as quickly as possible.  We always stay at Marriott due to the level of detail and customer service, but it is because the staff put their heart in it and I never feel like I am getting the corporate line.

Good points: excellent amount of space in a two bedroom suite; confortable beds; good breakfast if a little crowded at times; nice pool; friendly staff; really convenient for Disneyland - it's an easy 12 minute walk that felt safe at all timnes of the day or night because of the large numbers of other people taking the same route.  Minus points: parking expensive though very convenient in a large multi-storey garage right next to the hotel; house-keeping a bit hit and miss - our room wasn't touched on 3 of the 7 nights we were there; two roads to cross to get to Disneyland on foot, one of whic is VERY busy so the light controlled crossing is infrequent and rushes you.  The one bedroom suites are better value if you don't really need two bedrooms. Also, some of them have views of

Summary Heading: Modern property with extremely small living space
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with how modern this hotel was. They have high end hansgrohe fixtures in the bathroom and very sleek/modern/minimalist furniture and finishes which we appreciate. We have two young girls with a lot of food allergies so we always need a place with a full kitchen. As a result, we have stayed at many residence in properties. Very modern, but this was by far the smallest living quarters we have ever experienced. We made it work, but would not have been comfortable for more than a night or two. My husband and my 4 year old slept on the sofa pullout and it was like most others-very thin mattress and uncomfortable due to the bars.  The location to Disney was amazing. We walked there both days during our time there. The convenience was perfect and would do

Excellent location.  Disney is within walking distance and there are plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from that are all within walking distance.  Staff is extremely nice and helpful.  One of the few Residence Inns that has a bar in the lobby, bartenders are great and very welcoming.

I love this hotel. There is a free breakfast buffet, and a Pizza hut located near the entrance. Close by is a Coffee bean and leaf as well. Rooms are always clean, housekeeping comes prompt, I've had no issues with requesting items or needs. There is free water in the lobby, plenty luggage carts so they're always available. Nice kitchenette with full fridge, dishwasher, stove and they provide dish cleaning soap!

Staying here for a meeting at the nearby Convention Center (two blocks away). I like Residence inns because of the room space and the kitchen. Breakfast in the privacy of my room trumps a free breakfast downstairs.  Typical Residence room, separate bedroom.  Comfortable and mostly quiet (someone above me jumping around in combat boots in the evening).  Only drawback if cost---$360 per night. I realize that this is a 'high rent' district next  to Disneyland, but still high.

We stayed in a suite room, it's nice to be able to have a large TV in each room and a separation door between.  Helps the kids and adults be able to have the privacy space they need.  Nice, spacious bathrooms too.

My travels always bring me back to Southern Cali- the team, the cleanliness and consistency are just a few of the reasons I continue to come back to this Residence Inn. While pricing can be a little more than the value at times, that seems to be “par for the course” in the entire area. Breakfast is also a plus- would be nice to see them maintain the food area and options even when breakfast is almost over.

This is a great hotel for families visiting Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  Rooms are spacious (we had two queens with sofa bed), which was pretty much a one bedroom with two televisions.  Great small kitchen area with a perfect travel sized dishwasher.  The breakfast buffet was busy, but the staff did an excellent job of refilling things quickly.  Very little interaction with staff except for the check-in (one of the fastest and most efficient I've experienced) and housekeeping.  Everyone was very pleasant.  The entry area is fairly large with ample luggage carts to use.  The parking garage had lots of room.  Evenings were a little busy and parking was available on upper flours.  There is a CVS located right next door at adjacent Springhill hotel.  Be aware that you

The hotel was wonderful!! Very clean and comfortable, and within walking distance of Disney, 7-11  and CVS. There were also a variety of nearby restaurants. The breakfast was very good. My daughter was so happy with the Mikey shaped waffles. I would definitely stay here again.

Location: 20 min walk (with a stroller) to Disneyland security.  If you catch the two stop lights just right, you can probably do it in 15 minutes or so.  There isn't much on property but there is a 24 hour CVS Pharmacy with a decent selection of essential grocery items.  That same CVS has a clinic during part of the day.  Service: The front desk and employees I ran into were all very nice without being stuffy.  In seven nights, I ran out of consumable supplies twice.  Once was cascade for the dishwasher (the bag was empty and on top of the counter where it could be seen) and the other was both bar soap and the liquid soap in the shower itself (again, this should have been easily noticed).  They replaced both very quickly once I pointed it out.  There were ample towels and
Manager Response: Dear Michael N,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. I would like to apologize for your amenities not being refilled during your stay, but happy to hear that we were able to get that resolved for you right away.   We really appreciate your review and it will be shared with the respectful team to help us improve! We hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and clean.  There is a public shuttle that runs near the hotel to disneyland every 20 minutes or it’s an easy walk to the entrance! We picked this hotel based solely on location but were pleasantly surprised by the rest. Breakfast has a great variety and a large space to accommodate not having to wait for people to make their waffles (which was a huge bonus with kids)

This hotel is almost perfect. The room was clean. Breakfast is very good (I normally do not eat the free breakfast provided by hotel, but I ate breakfast everyday while here). The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. I have never experienced the level of courtesy and genuine feel that they really want to help you. The only issue I had was after a long day of making sure the family had a great time when I would come back to the room the internet was always slow. I could never watch anything online. Even when I connected using their internet TV it still would not play a show with out constant buffering. Other than that I have no real complaints. I believe there is an option to purchase a faster connection speed.

We had a great space with kids in separate bunk beds room and kitchen. 2 bathrooms. Good to have space for a coupe of nights while busy at Disneyland. Quiet too. Pool nice. Not great food choices around. Pizza Hut as expected on site, otherwise didn’t find anything. About 15 minutes walk from Disneyland.

We got to the hotel a lot earlier than Check In time, but we wanted to get to Disneyland Parks, so the front desk clerk stored our Bags for us until we come back! All the staff were so friendly and helpful! The Breakfast you get is absolutely amazing. One thing that took away from the score, is that on the second day, we didn't have any washcloths, and had to call twice to get some. But, overall, it was good!

Summary Heading: Perfect for Family of 5 with Teens
Summary: The "Kids/Bunkbeds/2 Bath" 2 BR suite is perfect for a family of 5 with pre-teens/teens who don't want to share a bed or are just too big to do so. One BR has a staggered twin bunkbed and the other BR has 2 Q beds. Both BRs open to the common living space with sliding barn doors. We found over the years that being able to close BRs off to common space is ideal for family members that have different bedtimes: the younger (or elderly) set can turn in while the older kids can stay up without disturbing them. No more hiding in a closet or bathroom to watch a show on your laptop! We got a 5th floor room with Disney View, but due to a row of palm trees along Katella, we really couldn't see much of the park. The fireworks would probably be visible from the room, but since we were in

We had the huge family suite, with 2 bedrooms (with bunk beds for the kids) and 2 bathrooms. The kitchen had everything you needed and everything was clean. Even though we were on the street side, the noise was low. The breakfast was huge, had a large variety and staff was efficient. There was a lot of space for everyone to sit down. We were 17 minutes away (by walking) from the Disneyland gates. Near the hotel, there was a CVS, with nice options of lunch/snacks for Disney. One of the best Marriott I visited so far.

Summary Heading: Great room, great service and great pool area
Summary: Great location! walking distance to Disney and convention center, we had 2 bedroom suit, kids love the theme room with bright green/blue dot (monster inc. inspired room, classy not taggy) and bunk beds. our room is over looking the roof top swimming pool, my little ones love the splashing figures, I personally love the oversize hot tub and fire place.  Front desk super friendly and helpful!

The hotel location was perfect.  I was here for a conference and everything was at walking distance including Disneyland.  The surrounding was safe.  The room was very spacious and the kitchenette was a plus.  The breakfast options however can be improved

Summary Heading: Great Option for Families Going to Disney!
Summary: I stayed here one night with my aunt and cousin, who were going to Disneyland for a few days. My aunt typically books the other Residence Inn by the Anaheim Garden Walk, but wanted to try out the new facility. This Residence Inn did not disappoint! It is different than their other properties in that there aren't multiple smaller buildings, it is set up like a hotel. Friendly service, easy self-parking (though the stairs don't open to the lobby, they open to the driveway and you have to walk all the way around the building to the lobby).   She booked a two-room suite and it is PERFECT for families. Living room and kitchen upon entry and a room off to either side, one with bunk beds and a bathroom for kiddos, one traditional room with bathroom for adults. Everything was new, I

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a great location
Summary: I had a vacation with my family few days ago and the hotel offered all the amenities I could expect for a great getaway time. Location was great, in the neighborhood of the Disneyland and good restaurants around. Great for a family with kids.

Summary Heading: relaxing and luxurious hotel so close to many points of interest.
Summary: Overall the hotel was good.  We had some minor mishaps which some where out of their control.  Be aware that so close to Disneyland you will encounter unruly children - but that just comes with the scene.  Full breakfast in morning is exceptional and the pool is lovely and good for kids as well.  Overall customer service is strong - as they aim to please.

The facility was very clean and well maintained, our suite worked with plenty of space for everyone and it was next to the Convention Center, close to Disney, restaurants  and we couldn't have asked for more.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel (But they are obsessed with Pizza Hut)
Summary: A good hotel with a good location. If you are staying with a family, you'll probably be happy. We booked a "Disney view" room and we indeed could see a great view of the 9:30 pm fireworks. Hotel is clean and room was quiet. The pool area is great for kids with a nice pool and a splash area that kids can run through sprinklers, etc. There was also a small hot tub/pool for parents. Breakfast was nice. Several hot foods, fruit, and mickey mouse waffles. A man walking around blowing up animal balloons (for tips). If you are looking for faults (not many to  find)... no one to help with luggage the day we checked in. There are some carts for self-serve use but in busy times you have to wait for them. Frustrating. No valet parking. You have to use their garage around the corner. Okay

Stayed with a friend for 3 nights. Everything was great. The only thing that I would not rate a 10 is the parking garage.  It’s quite a hike. If I did not have a friend to sit in the lobby with the bags, it would have been 2 trips back and forth from the garage to the room.

A lovely hotel, very well located near grocery stores, restaurants and a short walk to Disneyland. Beds were comfortable, bathroom huge and kitchenette convenient with having a little one. Breakfast served was delicious great variety of food. Waffles were the best! Service was excellent. There is complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby as well which adds a nice touch. Overall we had a lovely stay and would recommend this hotel to families.

Summary Heading: Stayed with kids for a volleyball tournament
Summary: Probably the nicest Residence Inn we’ve ever stayed.  We had a 2 bedroom with bunk in the kids room. Spacious suite and bathrooms.  Ample parking in the structure and always a security guard on foot monitoring the lot.  Daily hot breakfast included with plenty of seating.  My kids absolutely loved making their own Mickey waffles each morning.  Lobby bar open from either 5 or 6 till 11:00 pm There is a CVS super close by if you need groceries or toiletries.  Pizza Hut attached to hotel, Coffee bean & tea leaf across the parking lot.  Easy walking distance to the convention center and I believe Disney is probably about 15 min or less walk away.  My kids loved the nicely heated pool and my little one enjoyed the splash pad.  It be cool if they had a bar poolside, the Hyatt House

10-12 minute walk to Disneyland. CVS pharmacy right at your door  Great location for families Buffet breakfast was great.  Can not fault this hotel at all.  Executive suite had plenty of room for a family of 5

My kids and I arrived around five in the morning after a six hour drive and the man working that night was kind enough to let us check in to our room early. The room we had was a suite, and it was absolutely amazing! Everything was neat and clean. The next morning, my son and I went down for breakfast, and the waffles were really cute! They were Mickey Mouse shaped waffles. The other food served was very good. The location of the hotel was very convenient as it was a ten minute walk to Disneyland. I would totally recommend this hotel to everyone who asks.

We recently returned from 8 nights at this hotel. We had originally booked else where but I changed our plans a week prior to arriving from Australia and I’m so glad we did. We were able to check in early which we were so grateful for given our 14 hour flight. The location was great- walking distance to parks (10-15 mins easy walk) close to stores and restaurants. Rooms are huge, clean and homely. Pool area was perfect, large laundry and breakfast- wow! So many choices and the breakfast staff worked really hard to keep everything stocked and clean (one man who was there everyday always greeted us with a smile each day). Reception staff were friendly. The only tiny issue we had was that on a couple of days housekeeping didn’t come to service our room but it didn’t bother us. We

We rented the 2 queen suite and were very pleased. The room was large, attractive and very clean and comfortable. The kitchenette was completely supplied for cooking. We didn’t do much of that but a large family could save a lot of money by preparing their evening meal there. The breakfast buffet was great and plentiful and the area was large enough to accommodate a lot of people. It also had a nice rooftop pool area with hot tub and splash pad and a lot of nice sitting areas. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

We have stayed in a lot of hotels in the USA and some in Europe and Canada as well. At some point it’s less about the minibar and more about the way we’re treated. This residence inn has a number of staff who genuinely care; one of them is Jonathan in the breakfast room. He went out of his way to help my family enjoy breakfast each morning, always with a smile. I predict he will rise to management in any organization he is with, and we won’t stay anywhere else when in Anaheim.

We love this Residence Inn.  Each time we are here everyone one and everything meets or beats our expectations. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.  This one was very spacious.  The front desk staff are very professional.  And friendly.  The breakfast is great.  Plenty of food.  No one should every go hungry,  And the location is quite convenient.

Front desk staff 24/7 was superb. Facility was awesome, clean, spacious and updated. My kiddos were mad we stayed at a Hampton the next night of our trip in SD. We were there for volleyball but next time we do Disney this will be the place we stay.

Our family of 4 stayed in a one bedroom suite for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland for two days last weekend.  Room was clean, modern & worked well for our family.  Bed was comfortable & our boys didn't complain about the sofa bed.  It was an easy walk of about 10 minutes to the parks.  Breakfast was plentiful with loads of variety & I appreciated the protein options available.  Only thing missing at breakfast the 3 mornings we were there......BACON.  Turkey sausage, link sausage, Canadian bacon yes but no BACON.  Hopefully I just missed bacon morning but if not.....that is my only suggestion for improvement. :) Parking is $24 per day & website does make that clear.  Parking in other parking lots would be a similar price so I can't fault them for this fee.  Cheesecake Factory,

Wonderful hotel!  Clean and comfortable, wonderful breakfast and friendly staff. Only thing that could be improved is the Wi-Fi, I could not get it to connect. Other than that this was a great hotel! This will be our go-to hotel for Disneyland visits from now on.

We stayed here on a family trip to Disneyland. The hotel is a short walk to Disneyland which was awesome, but the suite and amenities made our experience go over the top. The suite was huge with a room and bathroom for our two grandchildren and their parents and a huge room and bathroom for us, the grandparents! In addition, we had a living room and kitchen which made it like home away from home on breaks from Disneyland during the day. The rooms were clean and roomy and the staff helpful and friendly. The breakfast was amazing with tons of choices for both adults and children.  This hotel has spoiled us for traditional hotel rooms!!  It was a great vacation and the accommodations contributed a lot to our overall experience.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel within Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: This is a very nice hotel.  It must be fairly new because everything seemed to be brand new.  We had a one bedroom suite, with a sofa bed in the other room, which also had a small kitchen area.  The refrigerator has an ice maker in the freezer so there is no central ice machine on each of the floors.  The suite comes with either two queens or one king in the bedroom. The bathroom was pretty large and very clean, with thick towels.  The only small complaint I have about the bathroom is that the water pressure in the shower was on the low side.  They offer complimentary breakfast buffet, which I thought was very good.  Everything seemed to be very freshly made.  Like other hotels that offer complimentary breakfast, you can make your own waffles. But unlike other hotels we have

This is the best hotel for a Disney vacation, perfect location, modern upscale design and amazing service from each and every team member.  We stayed for 3 nights with my family 5 in a Family Suit which I highly recommend if traveling with kids.  Location is perfect, short walk to Disneyland.  Kassidy at the Front Desk was amazing at both check-in and checkout, made my whole family feel welcome.

Summary Heading: Overall a great place to stay
Summary: Stayed here for a night while visiting Disneyland.   It is right across the street from Cali Adventure but it is still a good 15-20 min walk to the entrance.  Hotel looks very new and everything was very clean.  As others have noted it has a more modern look/feel than other hotels in the area.  Check in was a breeze (arrived at 8pm on a Friday) and they even gave us a little gift bag (with some cookies and a water).  I'm a platinum member.   We had a nice little corner suite on the 7th floor (room 734) from which we could see the Friday night fireworks from the park.  This was a nice bonus.   The room itself was great-- very clean and bright.  Having a kitchen was nice too.   Overall we had a great stay here and would come back.  The only negative thing I have to say is about

We stayed here for three nights last November in their Disney view king suite and will be staying here again this year around the same time. This hotel has been exactly what we have been looking for when we come to Disneyland - close proximity, a nice hot tub, and something that is more upscale than most of the motel options that are along Katella. It is about a ten minute walk to the parks which is perfect when you want to relax in the afternoon. They have a nice pool area with a large hot tub that is essentially the size of two they combined into one. We found in the afternoon we had the tubs to ourselves but around 5pm it got busier. Their breakfast area is really well done with lots of hot food options like eggs and bacon as well as cold food options. The hotel also shares

What a fantastic time! From the moment we arrived Mary at the front desk took care of all of our needs. She was extremely attentive, friendly, and had such a warm genuine smile.  Mary even referred us to a wheelchair rental business so that we could transport our older mother back-and-forth to the Disneyland Resort Park. It worked out perfectly! The resort was clean, our room was clean, and there was a full hot complimentary breakfast available every morning.  All of the other hotel associates were helpful and friendly as well. I would definitely recommend staying at this property while visiting Disneyland!!!

So since I couldn’t write two reviews since trip advisor wouldn’t let me. I going to tell my story again about their bed bugs that they claim they don’t have. The hotel was great for breakfast walking distance and all and the chick Ashley was great at front desk.  But on my third day of 2nd  night  of staying I started seeing bites on my chest and on the insides of my legs and back. I thought maybe it was mosquito bites so I didn’t say anything and then the next day. No I didn’t mention anything to the front desk because i thought they were something else but mosquitoes are big bites these are little and red and burn and itch more then mosquitoes. Well fast forward to getting a review email and I told them about the great stay and all but I got bit and the manger or at least I’m
Manager Response: Hello,  We are sorry to hear that you experienced an in adequate customer service while staying at the property. Here at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention center we pride ourselves on providing a service so memorable a guest tell stories about it. After reviewing your case I noticed that an external company came in and inspected the property, including your room for any pest and the result came back negative. However what concerns us is the level of service that you received. We sincerely apologize for not contacting you directly when this issue first appear and are constantly working and seeing ways we can better improve our service. Your concerns have been passed down to the adequate team so we can ensure no further incidents like this ones occur. If you feel like you have not been heard yet, or would like to speak to us more directly concerning this, please feel free to contact the property directly at. 714-782-7500 Option 0 and ask to speak to a Manager on duty and we will be more then pleased to assist you.

Summary: We have been staying here both years of the CA FFA convention. Each year, i have taken 27 students and three adults. Heather and the team has been very considerate of our schedules and needs. Sh sends many updates and reminders, is always pleasant on the phone, and does her best to accommodate all of our requests. We are only 2 days post event, and she has already sent a follow-up email and began to take holds for next year! Being able to plan this far ahead take so much stress off my very full plate!  The breakfast is delicious! The students enjoy the options, and there is plenty of space to get through the line quickly.  The on-site staff is polite and patient. I have stayed at many different hotels with this large of group, and some places just cannot mentally handle the

We have stayed here a few times. The location is great. The parking can be a bit scarce. The breakfast area is crowded but there is always enough selection and plenty of food... just seems to be a central hub for chaos. I guess its to be expected. IF you are traveling with a family this is a great location. The pool is kind of small but the jacuzzi is amazing.  The locations cant be beat if you are going to visit the mouse.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, here at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention center we pride ourselves on providing a service so memorable our guest tell stories about it. I am glad to hear you enjoyed our amazing 6th floor pool area and Jacuzzi, it is always nice to be able to come back to your room and have a place to relax after a long day at the parks. Our parking structure can also get a bit overcrowded sometimes due to large number of convention guest staying at our property but with luck we also have alternate options in case it fills up. As far as our breakfast area, I will be passing down this information to the correct personal so we can better improve our service at the property.   Sincerely, Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.

Summary: The staff were friendly and helpful during check-in and we were even upgraded to a larger room for our stay.  The room modern, clean and spacious.  Absolutely no issues with the bed, kitchen or bathroom.  Housekeeping came later in the afternoon as our little one was napping.  Knowing that she was pretty busy, we didn’t have an issue with it and she supplied us with additional towels.  As far as the breakfast, I’ve stayed at other Residence Inn’s where I avoided the breakfast altogether, but their breakfast was decent, and they even had a waffle making station which was a plus...just be prepared for a lot of families and kids running around.  Altogether, it was a great stay and we will definitely consider this hotel for our next Disneyland trip.

We arrived well into the evening, check-in process was painless; room was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast options varied each day but are what you would typically expect; however, I though the Mickey Mouse waffle irons were a great touch! Pool area is also very nice and spacious which is helpful for relaxing after putting in a full day at Disneyland. I looked inside the fitness center and it's equipment looked very nice; however, did not feel a need to utilize as walking around Disneyland for multiple days is all the exercise I needed!  Friendly staff will greet you as you come and go!  If you decide to utilize ART buses to go to Disneyland instead of walking, they do sell passes for it here, just ask the front desk.  CVS is also conveniently next door which is perfect

The hotel far exceeded our expectations. The room was huge, clean and wonderful, the breakfast was great and the pool area was quiet and relaxing. The front desk staff were warm and welcoming. We would absolutely stay here again.

I booked a 2 queen suite facing with a Disneyland view.  I got a family suite with two bedrooms and a parking deck view.  Rooms were clean and comfortable. It was convenient to Disney and restaurants.  Breakfast was fine and while crowded, was very well stocked. The staff was great.

My family's flight was cxled so they were in the area for one more night. I chose this property because of the great reviews and their ability to accommodate us. Every experience was incredible from check-in to checkout. Staff was friendly, amenities plentiful, and the hard work and dedication put into this property definitely show.  Stay here!

The breakfast, location, things nearby, pool area. Was very nice. The room was good as well. The staff very nice.  Parking is offered. CVS, Walgreens all within walking distance. Great food choices near by.  Great place for families with children.   I would visit again

A couple issues but overall a great stay. Took my family for spring break at the parks. Great location! We walked back and forth from the parks each day. No need for cabs or Uber. Our suite was at the end of the hall past the staircase. No neighbors so we could make as much noise as we wanted. Hotel is extremely clean, and staff is super responsive. Pool was great! Our dishwasher leaked and toilet didn’t flush properly, but didn’t cause any major hangups. Close to Walgreens and CVS. I would definitely stay here with my family again!

Rooms were large & had kitchenette & enough space for all of us. TV in the large bedroom & studio. Hotel happily supplied extra towels. Continental breakfast was the best I've seen with so many choices. Food was excellent. Place is kept spotless even with all the kids. Lots to do here. Pool was good, large & hot tub excellent.

The Residence Inn is a modern, well maintained hotel with easy access to Disneyland and the Convention Centre. Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk along paths which are designed for high volume traffic. All the standard American fare (PF Chang's, Bubba Gump, Cheesecake Factory, McCormick and Schmidt) can be found at Garden Walk which is again about an easy 10 to 15 minute walk. Next to the hotel is a Coffee Bean and Tealeaf and a bit further on is a CVS Pharmacy/Grocery store. Further down the road is a Starbucks and Walgreens. So the hotel is designed to cover all of the basic needs of someone on their way to a convention or to visit the Disney attractions. While the room was large and comfortable, it is designed to handle large volumes of people and as a result, lacks some

We stayed here for six nights recently while we combined a business trip with a Disneyland visit. Let me start by saying that the hotel location is very convenient, it is very modern and I also thought it was very clean. The free morning breakfast was without a doubt the best I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying.  Unfortunately, there were issues during our stay that put a bit of a damper on our stay. The very first day, we noticed that the stopper in the bathroom sink would not open which meant that the sink took forever to drain. Not a big deal and thought I would mention it when I walked by the front desk, which I did on that first day and again on the second day. It never did get looked at and I finally just pulled the stopper right out of the sink. I had opted to go
Manager Response: Dear R1843zzdanb,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay with us. I'm sincerely apologize for the amount of times you had to request these items to be fixed and replaced. We do our best to provide the best service and resolve all our guests' issues in a timely manner. We will definitely share your feedback with the respectful teams to ensure that this gets corrected. I am glad that you enjoyed the breakfast and hope we can get another chance whenever your travels take you back to Anaheim.   Once again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Clean, great breakfast, pleasant staff.  Definitely walkable to Disney, though we did sometimes grab a $6 cab outside of the parks at night after we had walked all day.  The Pizza Hut on property is outrageously priced, but so convenient we did eat there once.  CVS across the parking lot in the Springhill Suites was super convenient.  Subway and some other fast food places were nearby.  Would definitely stay here again.

We have stayed here a couple times, after finding the Grand Californian to be very pricy. The 1br suite is amazing and allows people to sleep while others can stay up in the living room area. We also enjoy having a kitchen for snacks and leftovers. The free breakfast is a bonus. The walk to Disneyland is a short 10 minutes and feels very safe, even in the later evening.

Last August we stayed at this hotel for three nights when we went to Disneyland. Kids loved it so much that they’re still reminiscing about the hotel. From the clean modern rooms to the pool and the hot tub. I would say probably the only thing that could be improved is the breakfast experience. But when breakfast is free it’s usually difficult to control the large crowds. Still I can’t imagine going anywhere else when visiting Disneyland.

I was reading through other reviews and trying to add helpful information. We arrived and rented a car, stopped by Target which is a half of a mile away for snacks and drinks. We were greeted and welcomed by the hotel staff each time we entered the lobby of the hotel. It is easy to find and within the Disneyland Resort area. There was really no need for our rental car as there are many shops and restaurants within walking distance. Our two bedroom family suite faced the parking garage and was quiet. It had a full fridge, lots of counter space, and plenty of seating area. The bunk bed room was a bit smaller. I appreciated the safety of the bunk beds that are built into the wall. It had a connecting bathroom with a shower/tub and a tv in the bedroom. The separating door between

i stayed there during holidays and its the best option for families to stay when you are visiting disneyland, the park is very close to it  you have to walk less than when you park your car at disneylands parking so i was very satisfied with the location, the hotel looks brand new and the buffet was nice too

This is a very  nice hotel within walking distance of Disneyland and the Convention Center. There are many restaurants and convivence stores within easy walking distance. It is new hotel and all public areas as well as the rooms are beautiful and spacious.  The rooms are suites and are designed to use the space very well.  I think the desk staff was not as informed as they should be.  They were all young and seemed inexperienced to me, but they were friendly.

I spent a week at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort / Conference Center.  This review is based on that stay.  Read my last paragraph for a tragic and disappointing (but correctable!) flaw with the property  Check in was quick and easy. Three minutes and I was off to the room.  Room 909 is a two room suite with a kitchenette.    The kitchenette included a full-size refrigerator with an ice maker, a two burner stove, a microwave oven, sink with garbage disposal, dishwasher and eat-in counter.  The sitting area includes a couch and television.  The windows overlook the main entrance and if you look over the other side of the building you can see parts of Disneyland.  The bedroom features two comfortable queen beds, a small three drawer dresser, a closet with in-wall safe and a

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disneyland with kids
Summary: This is only a few blocks from Disneyland, has a very substantial breakfast included with the room, and a very nice pool on the roof.  The rooms are large and great design with small kitchen, full size refrigerator and dishwasher.  Room for several people on sofa and chairs - great for just "hanging out"!  Huge windows and we were fortunate to look out at the lights of California Adventures.  Helpful staff.

Stayed here after convention.  Brought family in.  New super clean hotel.  Walk to Disney.  Everything is right by...CVS, Walgreens, Starbucks, several restaurants.  Would stay here again for sure!!!  Breakfast was great as well.  Lots of choices.

We stayed at this hotel because we stay at Marriott properties. We were in town to go to the Honda Center for a four night ice-skating international championship.  We stayed in a king studio suite which had a full-size fridge, microwave, a nice eating sitting area and kitchen counter. We had several meals here from food that we bought at a CVS pharmacy just next-door. You could buy food for the microwave, fruits, or anything you want to drink or snack on.  The room also had a very nice leather sofa which was a good size. And the bathroom was very large with a nice walk in shower.  The breakfast has a large variety of food, both hot and cold.  There is a Pizza Hut on property which we ordered and brought to the room.  The Wi-Fi in our room was the best we have had in a long time!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel near the convention center
Summary: This hotel is fairly new; clean, beautiful rooms with kitchen, nice free breakfast, lovely little lobby bar.  Comfy bed, too.  Easy walk to restaurants and the convention center. Relatively quiet as well.  I've stayed in 3 or 4 other local hotels over the years, this one is the nicest I've been in.

We’ve stayed at multiple hotels over the last 10 years coming to Disney. This was by far the best! 10/10!!  Room was clean and large, family friendly- fit our family of 6 very comfortable.  It was a 10 minute brisk walk from lobby to Disney security gates.  Convenient CVS right around the corner to stock up on water and things we needed to take into park.   Breakfast was AWESOME!! different varieties every morning. Mickey Waffles for the kiddos and more adult friendly options as well! Plenty of seating and they never ran out of food- even with A LOT of large families eating every morning.  The staff were so awesome and friendly! We had to check in our first morning at 8:00am and they were ready and willing to help accommodate us.  We won’t even consider staying at any other

We stayed here with our infant and would not hesitate to visit again. We booked a king bedroom suite which enabled the baby to sleep in a separate space for naps. The full kitchen came in handy, especially dinnerware and utensils. There was ample counter space. The bathroom was huge with a large shower. Staff was friendly and there were many tables available for breakfast despite the buffet looking crowded. Also our pack n play wasn't in the room when we checked in but was brought up 10 mins later when I asked.   This is more an FYI but be careful obviously if you have infants learning to walk. There were many sharp edges like the tv stand and bottom of kitchen counters. Also the crib just fit where we had it - be careful not to put it too close to the shades with the tight

Really enjoy our family suite with Disneyland park view. Plenty of room, nice kitchen2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms and room for 6-8? We had 4. Nice breakfast. The walk was about 10-15 minutes from park entrance. A lot of food places near hotel to get food.

Summary Heading: First time visitor and will be back
Summary: We go to Disneyland about twice a year and usually stay at the Sheraton around the corner from this hotel.  We decided to try something new and am so glad we did.  Rooms were huge and beds were comfortable.  We didn't use the kitchen since we weren't in our room much but it seemed well appointed.  We appreciated the coffee/tea/water stations in the lobby and although we didn't have the breakfast, we walked through and were impressed by the range of choices.  The staff was very nice and we appreciated the proximity to Disneyland as it made for a quick walk to the park and back.  Parking was easy and was $24/night which is on par with other hotels in the area.  Only wish the parking lot was connected with a covered awning to the hotel as it was pouring during our stay.  All in

The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself was very nice.  The room was very modern and was well cleaned in between days.  We also really enjoyed the breakfast. The only negative was we arrived around 3 and were not able to check into our room until around 5:30.  The front desk gave us several good ideas to pass the time.  My group would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good option for Disney, amazing breakfast, thin walls though!
Summary: Just got back from a Jan 2-4 stay at the Resdience Inn Anaheim. Here are my notes. I would probably stay there again for the cleanliness, value, and space.  - We has a queen suite. It was a good size but a couple of things to note: The doors to the bathroom and bedroom and sliding barn doors. The doors are mainly frosted glass, so it doesn’t really work to have the kiddos go to sleep in the bedroom and watch TV in the living room (if the lights are on in the living room, it is light in the bedroom). Same goes with the bathroom, if someone gets up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and turns on the light, the light will go through the door to the bedroom and wake people up. -The shower is clear glass and there is not a separate space for the toilet. So hard for two

Check in: I had requested a high floor and a crib in advance and had neither upon checking in, but we did get a crib at least after 2 more calls. FYI the crib is a pack n play similar to the graco but slightly different dimensions. I brought our own sheets to put on it and they fit well enough.   Room: We had the two bedroom family suite with two queen beds in one bedroom and the bunk beds in the other bedroom (room 244, 2nd floor). The room is nice and fairly kid friendly. It appeared clean, but could definitely use a deep cleaning. There was sticky residue on the drawers, dust bunnies next to the ceiling, and my white socks turned black on the bottom after wearing them in the room for a while. The bedrooms are on the small side. The kids bedroom was especially small. I’m sure
Manager Response: Dear VacationLover1985,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  We take these cleanliness issues seriously and have notified our housekeeping team of your concerns. I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast and staff!  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: Loved the hotel, the location and the amenities.  Walked to Disney from the hotel with two 7 year olds without an issue.  The ART stops right in front of the CVS which is nicely situated in front of the hotel.  The hotel is nicely appointed, spacious and ideal for families.  There is a free breakfast we just never took the time to eat there.  We hit the road to Disney at 7am and took breakfast bars in our backpack.  Plenty of people were taking advantage of the free breakfast though.  We had Pizza Hut delivered to the room and while it’s not my favorite pizza it did the trick and was nice to have it delivered in my room within 15 mins.  Lots of food options within a mile of the hotel.  I must say this hotel was busy but we didn’t hear one neighbor or noisy guest the entire time.

Highly recommend this hotel. Nice room, very spacious and well laid out... The theme room with the bunk bed for the kids was great... Lots of towels and 2 bathrooms made it easy for us.. the location is walking distance to Disney..  The breakfast was as expected, got boring after 4 days of the same thing...   The location for going to universal, Venice and Hollywood is roughly 1 hour without traffic and 2 with...  There are lots of good places to eat close by the hotel..  Overall highly recommend for families going to Disney, perfect location!!!

I stayed with my teen and tween in a one bed apartment which is relatively new so clean and fresh but basic, as you’d expect. Easy (10 min) walk to DL. 24 hour pharmacy/mart in the same car park as well as Pizza Hut. Breakfast is fairly wide ranging for an included breakfast in the US. By Australian standards the food is poor quality but standard American fare. No porters. Ubered into LA after we checked out easily.

Fantastic location for Disneyland. It's maximum a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Wish the towels were a bit larger but cleanliness is first priority. Breakfast is free and has all the necessities. Coffee machines, drinks machines, waffle makers, scrambled eggs, meat, fruit, yogurts, fruits, delicious cakes (I fell in love with the Apple crumble cake). Such a big hotel but I honestly felt it was quiet and had such a pleasant stay. My room was next to the the carpark and I could hear cars every now and then but it wasn't bothering me at all.

Summary Heading: Very close to the convention center & Disneyland
Summary: If you are looking for a place to stay for a business meeting at the Convention Center and near the Disney Theme Parks this is a great location.  It was a relatively short walk from the hotel to the Convention Center and the entrance to California Adventures and Disneyland were both about 1 mile away.  Downtown Disney is also within walking distance.  The hotel room was comfortable and included a full size refrigerator, a small stove, a microwave, and a small dishwasher.  There is a Pizza Hut on site on the first floor of the hotel.  In Room 516 you can see the back side of the new north section of the convention center.  You can’t not see the theme parks or the fireworks, but you can definitely hear the firework from Disneyland each night.  There is a Walgreens, CVS Pharmacy,

Quick trip to Disneyland from Phoenix. The hotel is very convenient, within walking distance to the parks. Our trip was unfortunately ruined by a ton of rain, but the hotel was nice. The breakfast was good, and the rooms were spacious and clean. My one concern was the shampoo and conditioner containers were empty. If you want to have the big reusable containers, then they must remain filled. While the parking is expensive, it is the standard fair for the area. I would stay here again.

Excellent location for Disneyland ,it was just walking distance.Room was spacious , comfortable and clean.Breakfast was included with room and breakfast were great  with varieties of choice. This Residence inn was well equipped with gym and swimming. Reception people were very helpful .

The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and welcoming. A short flat stroll down to the Disneyland. Good choices for the buffet breakfast - our tummies were full so we could enjoy the fun at Disneyland. Hotel has a gym if you need to work off holiday treats!!

We were recently visiting family and wanted to stay near Disneyland to spend a couple of days at the park. The hotel is an easy walk to Disneyland and near a good number of dining options as well. The Residence Inn has a good breakfast included in the stay to get your morning started. The lobby is spacious, modern and well kept. Their is a lobby bar with a decent selection or wine, beer and cocktails for a nightcap after a long day at Disney. The rooms were spacious and clean. Maid service could have been a bit more timely.   We came back for a mid-afternoon nap for the kids and the room had yet to be cleaned. We were offered fresh towels and toiletry replacement on request.   We had a room with partial views of California Adventure and the taller points of Disneyland. This was

We just returned from a four night stay here and had a terrific experience.  We booked a family suite which had enough beds for five adults and two children under the age of six.  What made this a great suite was the two bathrooms (and a kitchen).  We did not cook but the fridge and bar seating was very handy.  The included breakfast each day served up quite a few choices to keep everyone happy.  An especially nice area is the pool deck with a lovely pool, splash zone for the children, and a large jacuzzi.  Towels are provided for the pool area, music is piped in and it is an oasis away from the crowds at Disneyland. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, great location, fantastic staff!
Summary: My family and I are long time Residence Inn patrons, but this was our first stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Convention Center. We were very impressed with the way the Concierge personnel (Lily and Eloise) greeted us and accommodated us during our stay.Enrique Reyes (Maintenance) and manager David Contreras went above and beyond for us as well! For a Disneyland vacation or a business trip,if a home away from home experience is what you're after, look no further, this is the place!

We, total of 4 adults and 4 small kids, came to LA for Disney visit... We were told that suite will suffice... though small, it was very good....see pics... also breakfast spread was diverse and good...well worth the money... made use of Landry machines... quite a no though cleaning of dryers was bad... swimming pool - Awesome.... Pizza Hut - pathetic...

Summary Heading: What's going on at this hotel?
Summary: My stay started off pretty decently. I had a uniqe check-in situation, but the front desk agent was not only able to accomodate me, but also ended up giving us a free upgrade to a one-bedroom suite.   I had to leave my room early in the morning to go pick a up a puppy that I was dog-sitting, since I had no one to watch him that morning. I returned to the hotel, notified the front desk that I would be checking out in a couple of hours, and that I would only have the dog in the room for a few minutes, we were about to go eat breakfast. The front desk agent, with supervisor present, had me sign a "pet waiver", without really explaining what was in it. Turns out that I made the mistake of trusting whatever paper they had handed to me and signed it without reading it.   Taking the
Manager Response: Dear Kevin H,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are explained thoroughly to avoid any miscommunication.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel in a great location
Summary: We stayed here for 2 weeks and it was like a home away from home. This hotel has everything we needed, lovely kitchen area and living area and a great separate bedroom and bathroom. It’s really close to Disneyland and the bus stops. Also within walking distance to Anaheim Garden Walk.

Summary Heading: A hotel to always return to!
Summary: This is our 3rd stay in this property.  Disney is walking distance, breakfast is world class, rooms are consistently in great order and the staff is wonderful!!  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim. There is no other hotel that compares to this hotel!!

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, and although the hotel was quite nice overall, there were some very disappointing aspects of our stay. We stay at Marriotts quite frequently and thruthfully, the service was really lacking – especially for a Marriott property. We had some issues with a loud, constant, intermittent humming sound that seemed to come from the thermostat. We requested for someone to look into/fix it, and nothing was done. We didn’t even receive any communication that they had even attempted to fix the problem. We also elected for the green option during our stay as we didn’t need them to come and clean the room everyday (we love this option). However, there was not a back-up of Kleenex, or toilet paper in the room when we arrived and we eventually had to request
Manager Response: Dear ChrisA,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. I apologize that we were not able to resolve the noise issue you had during your stay or provide you with another solution to sleep comfortably.   As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate team to ensure the necessary guidelines are taken to ensure guest issues like these get resolved immediately.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: My family loved staying at this hotel! The rooms/common areas were very clean, elegant, and spacious! They did advertise grocery delivery on the fridge in our suite but unfortunately it wasn't available anymore. It was a bit disappointing as we were down for Disney with no rental car (being in walking distance) and had zero time to shop for food. The showers in the rooms were amazing! Housekeeping did a fabulous job maintaining the room! The buffet breakfast was wonderful, except I couldn't partake with my family as they have nutella available which means in a common serving setting it puts anyone with nut allergies at high risk (someone using nutella and going back for seconds touching utensils or food is a huge risk). No one wants to be in hospital on their Disney vacation!

I stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn last week as part of a visit to LA and Disney with my wife and two kids (Aged 8 and 6).  We decided on this hotel due to it's locality to Disney and selected a Suite-type room (Room 908) with main bedroom (2 queen beds), living room/kitchen and a separate kids room with bunks.  We were very happy with the three night stay - a seamless check-in where the associate also gave us a map of the area, parking close by in a multi-storey carpark, excellent breakfasts, close to Disney and a fantastic roof top pool with spa.  The breakfasts had Mickey shaped waffles which were a big hit with the kids (and adults) and also had healthier options of yoghurt and fruit.  We walked to Disney on the first day but took Uber thereafter as we ended up walking

Summary Heading: Family friendly and close to Disneyland
Summary: Nice sized rooms with a modern contemporary feel.  Rooms have full sized kitchens which come in handy when traveling with kids.  Since it’s a Residence Inn the kitchen is stocked with pot and pans, dishes etc everything you need to cook and reheat your leftovers.  There’s also a CVS next door so it’s easy to stock the refrigerator.   Nice bar style eating area in the room with four stools.    Sofa is not the most comfortable but it is a sofa bed.  Lots of outlets and USB chargers throughout the room so helpful to charge all the phones, iPads, laptops etc.     Bathroom has shower but not a tub.  Very nice pool area with lots of lounge chairs, a few bungalows, jacuzzi and roof top bar.  Very family friendly with a splash pad for kids and movies shown at night.    Morning breakfast

We got a great deal on a room and were upgraded (at no charge) to an even better room. The room was absolutely beautiful, complete with kitchenette, living room, bedroom, and really nice bathroom. Breakfast was good, although very busy. They also have a Pizza Hut on site that delivers to your room. Very close to Disneyland, food, shopping, and the freeway. Great staff, too. They charge for parking, but it was worth it. Free wi-fi if you are a Marriott rewards member.

Stayed for 4 days with my kids ages 11 & 6.  Arrived earlier than check in and they were not only able to give me a room but upgraded me as well.  This was such a lovely surprise. Our unit had a kitchen fully furnished with basic coffee and tea and sugar etc.  Living room with TV. Bedroom with 2 big beds and seperate bathroom.  The unit was very modern and well kept.  Breakfast was average.  Disney waffles was great for the kids.  They even allowed me to take breakfast up to the room when me kids slept in.  We didnt have much time at this hotel as most of our time was spent in disney.  It really is such a nice 10 minute walk to the main entrance of disney so dont even stress about the bus or uber ... it really is close enough... my kids didnt complain at all.  There is a pizza

My family and I LOVE staying in hotels when we can. We booked a suite and arrived extremely early (around 9am) to drop off our luggage. I was helped at the front desk by Allie B. She was ready to accept our luggage when she started to look up our room. She informed us that our room was actually available if we wanted to check in right then! We did. She went above and beyond and was extremely professional and personable. She was an excellent first impression of the hotel. We went up to the room and we were beyond pleased with the gorgeous suite. Our windows faced Disney and we had a really cool view of the fireworks! During our stay, we went up to the roof top pool and our kids played in the awesome splash pad and pool for hours. Breakfast was excellent! The entire hotel stay was

Summary Heading: You need to stay here for Disney visit!
Summary: I was really happy with this hotel.  The friendly staff and cleanliness of the hotel make it a must go for Disney visits. I chose this hotel so we could avoid eating junk out every night.  This worked well.  Between the EXCELLENTLY RUN breakfast buffet and the option to buy groceries and cook for dinner, it offered a much needed respite from the junk food.  Disney is like 2 blocks away, and we could go there every day without needing to fight traffic.   Pool is pretty cool for the family as well. If you need wine and other adult drinks, CVS is on the same block. This is a must stay for Disney visits!

Stayed here on our Disneyland vacation and I couldn't have picked a better place to rest our heads. I must say the accommodations they have here are top notch! this place is a must stay. my check in lady was superb and the staff was on top of everything

We stayed here six nights while on vacation. The hotel is really nice, new, and clean. We had a Deluxe Queen one-bedroom suite. We were disappointed with the customer service at the front desk upon check in because they weren't able to look up our Marriott loyalty number and the room they gave us had a view of a room and HVAC equipment. We called to ask for a Disney view and provide the Marriott number, which we looked up ourselves. They said it would be $50 extra per night so we declined. They didn't offer any other view and we didn't ask so we kept the one we had.   The room itself was a bit on the small side, which was fine for just two of us. It had a full kitchen, separate bedroom, spacious bathroom, and nice living room area so we were happy to have a condo-like

We spent a night at the Marriott near Disneyland for my wife’s birthday. We have stayed here before and enjoyed our time. But when we went to check in the room was not available yet so we left our number and they told us they would call when it was available (they never did). We eneded up checking in late that night (with a toddler who could have used an nice place for an afternoon nap).   The next morning we requested a late check out (recoup a bit from the previous says excitement at Disneyland). They were a bit rude (curt) in their negative responce. Considering the cost of the hotel I expected a bit more customer service. Not sure we will be stay here again :-/
Manager Response: Dear David,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center and providing your honest feedback.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are taken to avoid and prevent any check in miscommunication for our guests as well as providing a better closing experience during your check out process.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: Just a perfect stay! Beautiful room with great views. 15 min walk to Disneyland and tons of restaurants/coffee shops nearby. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. Bed was super comfortable, room was clean, quiet nice sleep. I honestly have nothing bad to say, only small complaint was some other guest food was left in the refrigerator but happy side there was an unopened case of water which saved our lives after Disney. Just was a great 2 night stay for Disney.

Summary Heading: A good, spacious and clean hotel with well-kept kitchen and bathroom within walking distance of Disney
Summary: Relatively new hotel on great location in relation to the Disney parks. Quick check in with friendly reception. Luggage trolley available to bring (self-service) your luggage to your room. Room is spacious with sitting area (TV, sofa and side table) and a full kitchen. Dishwasher available, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, large fridge with separate freezer. Separate bedroom is spacious and nicely cared for. (2nd TV). Bathroom complete and cared for. Everything you exspect in a bathroom is available. On the 6th floor a nice large cared pool, (with towel service), fitness room and laundry room. Breakfast is more exspected with enough choice for a "complimentary breakfast". Since Disney is within walking distance there are plenty children in the hotel making plenty of noise.

Location is perfect.   Issues experienced: Breakfast in caoitc, unorganized mass frenzy and understaffed by hotel.  Most nights the projected for kids movie night at pool was broken and nothing replaced it and notifications not put out to communicate the changes.  Beds were beyond so soft and horrible that you sink to the bottom boxspring, Housekeeping doesnt always come and clean room.
Manager Response: Dear Danielle,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent stay with us. I am sorry to hear that you weren't able to enjoy our movie night at the pool. Please accept our apology about the lack of service you received. We have share your feedback with the hotel team to make sure these issues are corrected.   We hope to have the opportunity to deliver a better experience to you whenever your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed for two nights as we were visiting Disneyland and CA Adventure for one day. Check in was fast and easy. Staff was very friendly. We had a one bedroom suite which was large and very clean. Breakfast was good and had variety. The hotel is within walking distance to the park which is nice. We did take Uber back to hotel mid-day to take a quick rest. It was about $6. I would stay here again if visiting Disneyland again!

Definitely recommend this stay. Walking distance to Disneyland. Rooms had all amenities full size fridge, full kitchen with dishes. Clean and comfortable. It was like living in an apartment for the week rather than a hotel.

This hotel caters to families in every way. It’s decor is modern and spacious.  Early arrival and the hotel accommodated us. Large two bedrooms with plenty of towels and two bathrooms.  The early morning breakfast has so many options and two Mickey Mouse waffle making stations.  The dinning area is large and spacious.  The pool area has several options for families:  Large Heated Pool, Large Hot tub, Splash area for kids, and a seating lounge area with fireplace tables to enjoy a glass of wine while the kids swim and play.  Watch a movie or fireworks at the pool area also.  The walk to Disneyland main gate is a short 15 minuets Walk.

We booked the Residence Inn by Marriott at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center for our family vacation to Disneyland.  The room was a perfect fit for our family of six!  We loved having a kitchenette and two bathrooms.  Access to the facility's barbeques made for a yummy steak dinner one evening.  The continental breakfast buffet surpassed expectations.  Our kids lived on Mickey Mouse shaped waffles for the whole week!  Thank you for accommodating us beyond expectations!

Summary Heading: Wonderful and convenient stay while at Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I had a wonderful stay here over Labor Day weekend. We had a king bed suite for the first half of our stay and then switched to a two bedroom suite to accommodate my parents who were visiting during part of our trip. The front desk was extremely helpful when we switched rooms/reservations. We inquired on how to best go through with the transfer and were informed that we could call early the next morning to ask if the room would be available. We called at 6am the next day, confirmed that the room was available and ready for us to move in, went downstairs to switch keys, and were situated in our two bedroom suite all within maybe 15-20 minutes. This was fantastic, since we didn’t have to leave Disneyland during the middle of the day to conduct the check-out/check-in

It's hard to beat the convenience that this hotel offered!  I was in town for a trade show, and it was steps away from the Anaheim Convention Center.
