My downtime was spent at Disneyland, which was only a few blocks away!  Tons of restaurants and shops within a very short walk too!  The breakfast was also fantastic each morning!  My biggest complaint about the hotel was that the dresser drawers were *laughably* small.  I have never seen such tiny, inadequate drawers in my life.  I wish I had taken a picture of them.  They couldn't have been much more than 6" deep.

This hotel is great is you are staying at Disneyland!! We were a family of 5 and had plenty of space in the room. The breakfast in the morning was amazing!!  The only problem was the parking, very hard to find a space if you have a larger vehicle and can’t fit in the ramp

Summary Heading: Awesome suites and fun pool area
Summary: We booked a stay here and got upgraded to the 2 room suite with a kids bunk bed and bathroom. Loved the size of the room. More than enough space for all of us. Pool area was a lot of fun along with the splash pad and bar. Great place to relax and enjoy the beautiful weather.   Lots of options for breakfast and it was being replenished quite quickly. Kids loved the mickey mouse waffles.   Great to have CVS and Walgreens walking distance as well as Coffee Bean. Walked to Downtown Disney one night. Bit of a isolated walk and it was further that we thought it would be but had a great time there.

A wonderful clean Hotel in an excellent location. Friendly staff and a great complimentary breakfast each morning. Facilities were good with a well equipped gym and an nice pool area. If I was to have any gripes it was the 20dollars per night parking fee otherwise fully recommended hotel

Stayed at the Residence Inn for our trip to Disneyland.  Specifically chose this hotel since it had a kitchen and sit down eating area and separate living area.  It's nice to be able to spread out when traveling with kids and definitely the free breakfast is helpful in the mornings.  The breakfast options were great!  The pool and hot tub on the roof top was fantastic although we didn't get to use it as much as we would have liked due to the weather being a bit cold in February.  The bathroom were spacious and easy to move around to help the kids in get cleaned up.  We walked to Disneyland in the morning but at the end of the day it was easier to uber back with the tired kids and it cost about $5 which wasn't too bad.  The location was great and the rooms were clean and spacious

Summary Heading: Stunning room, great location and price
Summary: Our family of 4 (two teens) stayed here for three nights on our visit to Disneyland.  We upgraded to the Executive Suite (two bedroom and two bath).  The room was pristine and gigantic with a full kitchen and laundry facilities in the building (a must for us as we were traveling for 11 days).  It was within walking distance to the entrance to both Disney parks (and an iHop). The price was very reasonable—especially considering the room we had.  I would definitely recommend and/or stay here again.

Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel for Disney adventures!
Summary: I LOVE this hotel. This is our absolute favorite hotel to stay at when visiting the Disneyland resort.  First off, the location is prime. It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the main gate of Disneyland. Super easy to get to and from the parks or even go home for a nap or midday rest. It is also next door to a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf when the free breakfast coffee just wont do AND next door to a CVS for when momma needs a wine or last minute diapers/milk/food/snacks/etc.   I love grabbing snacks at CVS and bringing into the park to avoid paying $3 for one applesauce pouch.   Second, the hotel itself is just great. The rates are totally reasonable, there are several room types to choose from, breakfast buffet is great and the rooms all have full kitchens which is

We choose to stay at this hotel for a trip to Disney for our sons 3rd birthday. It did not disappoint at all. We are late sleepers so breakfast was over a bit early for us. Although we did manage to head down one day out of the four days we were there. There was plenty of food and the waffle maker was a hit. The staff does a great job of keeping things clean. The room was awesome. The pull out sofa was perfect for our son and I loved the barn door to the bathroom. The kitchen was a definite plus for us since I have a picky eater. The only downside was the fact that our room was right across from the convention center so we had to hear the beeping of trucks reversing early in the morning but that’s no fault of the hotel. The walk to Disney can be a bit far after a day at the

When looking at accommodation for our stay in Anaheim it was an easy choice. We stayed here last year and loved the convenience, location and cleanliness of this property. This year was the same. Seamless check in, an upgrade and a clean room was just what we needed after a long flight. The breakfast buffet could use some healthier options but that just one minor detail amongst all the positives. The rooftop pool Is a great way to escape the heat, the bar staff are friendly and the drinks options are plenty. We will definitely stay here again.

We really love the location of this hotel. It is close enough to walk to Disneyland and California Adventure, but far enough away that it is quiet and away from the crowds. The hotel is clean and had plenty of room for 3 of us in the 2 queen suite. There are washers and dryers that take credit cards only that are very convenient. There is laundry soap available in the laundry room as well.   There is a coffee bean and tea leaf cafe downstairs across the driveway, there is a pizza hut connected to the hotel, and there is a CVS just down from the coffee shop as well. These are all great conveniences.

Summary Heading: The Hotel that all Hotels will be Judged By
Summary: We were able to stay at the Residence Inn during our summer Disneyland vacation. After staying here, I will definitely judge all other hotels by this standard.   First the room. The room felt roomy even with all our children and the queen beds were comfortable. The kitchen was wonderful with a great bar to sit around that seated all of us. Because of the amazing kitchen, we decided to go get steaks and grill them on the grills that are on the property, and have a great dinner in the hotel. After eating out on vacation A LOT, a home cooked meal felt wonderful. The decor is modern and clean and the couch that holds the couch bed was roomy. The bathroom was modern and had an amazing shower. The counter was roomy and even with all of us getting ready, it felt fine.   The breakfast

Excellent motel. Staff really helpful and friendly. Clean rooms and wonderful buffet breakfast each morning. Shuttles to Disneyland are an added bonus. The activities they offer for families at night are fun and interactive  Would definitely recommend

Summary Heading: Awesome family hotel! Easy walking to Disneyland! Great Breakfast Included!
Summary: We are a family of 5 with 3 children under 5. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and it was perfect for us! We had a 1 bedroom suite with kitchen and it was new and clean. The only this I found odd was that you have to go into the bedroom to be able to use the bathroom but it was totally fine for a family! I was a bit worried about the walk from this hotel to the Disneyland entrance (especially with walking so much once in the resort) BUT I worried for no reason! It was such an easy walk to get there! We did have a double stroller and single stroller as we knew our days would be long in Disney so that got us there quicker as we were able to put all the kids in the strollers and just get there!  The breakfast buffet was what made this hotel for me! It was so great to be able to

With this hotel! Clean modern rooms, bright beautiful bathroom, friendly and helpful staff...what more could you ask for? Maybe a better breakfast (food not replenished quickly and a very chaotic process) and better parking (public lot, hard to find parking when returning late at night, small spaces for suv’s and minivans). Wonderful pool (with cabanas!) and 24 laundry room. Walking distance to Disneyland and plenty of restaurants nearby. This is where we will be staying from now on!

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, rooms with space, but prepare to go to battle for breakfast
Summary: We stayed next door at the Springhill Suites on our last trip and chose the Residence Inn for our four night stay, this year. We arrived at 1:30 am and the staff was friendly and very accommodating.  They even encouraged us to leave the car our front and get settled in our room, prior to parking.  The garage was full to the top, however if you turn left past the handicap spots, there are usually a few spaces available at the lowest level.  Parking is $20 per day. We purchased Disney tickets at the hotel (vs. standing in line at Disney)  The process was simple. Our family of 4 really enjoyed being able to spread out.  Having a full kitchen and a living room is a bonus compared to a standard hotel room.  There is also a CVS located in the bottom floor of the Springhill Suites,

We stayed at the Residence Inn for 8 nights in July - overall it was a great stay with only a couple of very minor issues. We would definitely stay again.  Main points - location:  1. Close enough for Disneyland, we strolled down the block or so each day without any issue. The path is relatively shaded for a maybe 15 minute walk.  2. CVS downstairs, very useful. 3. Anaheim Garden walk, 5-10 minutes walk down the road where you’ll find a Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gumps, etc.   Rooms: 1. Plenty of space with a separate living area and small kitchen. 2. Clean and well laid out 3. Comfortable bed, decent water pressure  Hotel Generally: 1. The kids enjoyed the splash pad and the pool 2. Breakfast had the standard fare - the Mickey Mouse waffles are worth an instagram post.  3. Staff

We traveled by car from WI, booked a house rental 8 months prior to the trip, we couldn’t even stay at the house an entire night - it was a disaster. We called this hotel at 1:00 AM and Diego was amazingly helpful. We were traveling with our dogs and they allowed us to bring them too. When I called the hotel and explained our terrible experience with the rental Diego said, “Don’t worry ma’m. We will take care of you”. I cannot express how seemless the process was. We finally arrived at the Marriott at 3:00 AM and Diego was waiting for us with a clean and quiet room. We could finally get some rest. The hotel is exceptionally clean with extraordinary customer service. Diego and the Marriot were like a beacon of safety and comfort for us weary travelers. We are forever indebted to

Our family had a 4 night stay at this Residence Inn for our week in Southern California this July - You can check my other hotels stays from this trip at the Legoland Hotel and the Ritz Marina del Rey as well.  On a busy weekend we arrived around 9PM to check in and we were able to get a view of the Disney theme parks, albeit from the second floor. We could still see the fireworks that were shot high into the sky but we also had to contend with the street noise (I had to wear ear plugs to sleep).  We reserved a 1 bedroom unit and the rooms are huge and have all the amenities as described on their web site. You could easily sleep up to 6 with bed sharing but I believe the official occupancy is less. The service is consistent 3 Star hotels. You have to Self-Park your car and move

Summary Heading: Nice new hotel with large rooms
Summary: Stopped here with our two teenagers during a recent trip to California. The hotel was new and nicely decorated. Rooms were large with two queen beds and a sofa bed and a kitchenette.  Breakfast was the typical buffet style with lots to choose from.  The only oddity was there wasn't a safe in the room. Location was great for Disney as its easy walking distance.

The suite design including a kitchen (with dishwasher) is perfect when traveling with children. The kids stayed on the sofa bed in the living room, allowing the adults the bedroom.   The room was spacious, well equipped and comfortable. The bathroom included lots of towels (enough for four of us) and the pool had a splash pad that the kids enjoyed more than the pool itself.   The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland and several restaurants nearby.   The only negative I can add is that it’s expensive!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disneyland holiday but needs to be cleaner
Summary: This hotel room is very large and accommodating for families. We had a room with 2 queen beds with a pull out sofa, a kitchen and large bathroom. Unfortunately I was immediately disgusted to find a dirty, used cotton bud sitting on the cabinet below the TV and baked beans washied into the sinkerator but not cleaned through. This was supposed to be a freshly made up room! Yuck. I spoke with a man on the front desk and politely informed him and he said that housekeeping would be advised and a full clean would be done the next day. Our room had absolutely no view whatsoever and looked out over airconditioning pipes and the roof above the lobby. Thankfully we weren't there enough to be looking out the window. The breakfast in the morning is adequate but there were no staff in the

I looked at multiple hotels near Disneyland before booking this one and was searching for several criteria: It had to be within walking distance of the park, clean and spacious enough for my family of 3, quiet away from busy traffic noise, had breakfast and a pool. This place checked all my boxes and then some. CVS is right next door which ended up being a life saver to grab supplies and refreshments. The only snafu we ran into was that our room was not ready by the time we checked in so we ended up waiting in the lobby for about 30-40 minutes. We didn't mind but the hotel desk clerk gave us free parking for the entire stay which was unexpected but appreciated. Overall it more than met our needs for a comfortable retreat after walking all day at the parks.

Stunning hotel, absolutely perfect in decor, bedding, shower pressure, service...its just a helluva long walk from Disney's Maingate.  If you have older kids you'll make it, but younger kids, think again!  Love the stocked kithcens, ideal for a longer Disney vacation!

Summary Heading: Very high standards, and they pretty much delivered
Summary: Ok. Weve stayed at the Gansevort, and Plaza, yadda yadda yadda. Yes we are very impressively swanky. We live in Manhattan when we stay some place we want it to be nice, so sue us!! :) long story short our standards are high. The main reason we do this though is for some guarantees and high standards on cleanliness and being able to sleep soundly in a bed that has been frequented by literally 1000's of people before us. This place got a 4.5 from what i expected. I didnt expect the gansevort. What i got was a very nice comfortable, clean, professional stay. Its nice to have your room as an oasis from disney and not a further burden. Pros: clean, new, nice/modern decor, ok walk to disney, nice staff, GREAT continental breakfast incl. Room was everything we needed. I felt

The hotel was amazing. The walk from the hotel to Disneyland was not bad at all and we didn’t have to deal with traffic. There is a Pizza Hut attached to the hotel so it made it very convenient for us to pick up a late snack or dinner for the kids. Also cvs is right there as well and made buying the little things very easy as well. The pool area was amazing and the play area for the kids were great since we didn’t bring the kids floaties on our trip. They were able to play and get wet even though they couldn’t swim it was great. Room service was amazing and quick any tome we needed anything they were there within minutes. We will for sure be staying here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

This hotel location is so convenient and clean! We stayed here for 6 days comfortably with 3 teenagers. The breakfast is lovely and the selection is terrific, something for everyone. There is a Pizza Hut , Coffee Bean and a CVS Pharmacy located right next to the hotel. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. It is maybe a 10 min walk from Disney and just steps away from the Convention Center. Put this location at the top of the list!

The hotel property is pretty new (it was built 2 years ago).  We were upgraded to the room facing Disneyland so we can enjoy firework just in our room. Thanks the wonderful front desk staff, Diego. You absolutely delighted our trip to Disneyland  The bed is super comfortable just like HOME!   It is a great hotel recommended to families with kids. The swimming pool and free breakfast are adding extra memories to our trip! We'll definitely stay in Residence Inn again!   Kevin

Great hotel; clean ,, new, 15 minute walk from Main Gate.   Breakfast is full (meat, eggs, fruit and 8 waffle makers!).  Kids will love the splash pad and the pool - adults will live that there are plenty of loungers and sun/shade with the big umbrellas.  Rooms are big - love sliding doors between bedroom and living room/kitchen - kids can go to bed while adults chill.  Terrific

Summary Heading: Why did I just spend 200k points on this crap - book somewhere else.
Summary: Find a different hotel until they figure their crap out - it's just not worth the price or points even being gold status.  Here's what happened when I stayed. Booked a king size bed, got two queens and was told by the snarky front desk the hotel was full (it wasn't, I checked with the Marriott app - I could have booked any size room.) Requested an hour early check in - room wasn't ready. Requested feather free room for allergies - room wasn't feather free. Requested a crib be in the room - guess what wasn't in the room, a crib. The sofa bed or hide away bed is literally like something from the dark ages. If you want acupuncture from each spring in the mattress it's a great place to sleep. We had to put our kids in the other queen bed it was so bad. Made for a real nice romantic
Manager Response: Dear Canyons-Skier  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I am very sorry that you had such a poor experience with us.  Please accept my most sincere apology and be assured that I have shared your feedback about the service from both the front desk and the housekeeping departments with those teams and discussed ways that we can improve in the future.  Cleanliness and a good attitude are very important and I am sorry that we did not deliver.    On the subject of the sofa beds, while it did not help you during your stay, we will be replacing the mattresses on all of our sofa beds this fall with thicker mattresses that we have been testing out and about which we have received positive feedback.    Again, thank you very much for sharing your concerns.  I would grateful if you would be willing to reach out to me directly to share any more details, such as the dates of your visit, which will help me to more directly address the problem with those involved.  Sincerely, Lucas Fiamengo General Manager

Summary Heading: DO NOT RELY ON HIDE A BED
Summary: To start off, let me say we have been to Disneyland countless times and have stayed at many competitors to this property.  First off, if you dont read the rest of this lengthy review, just read this. DO NOT RELY ON THE HIDE A BED. As a daughter with a father who snores way too loud, i’m used to being on a hide a bed. This is without a doubt the worst hide a bed i’ve ever seen. The springs stick out extremely bad. We contacted the front desk who were not surprised by the issue. They said they’d send some duvets up to put under the mattress pad, they never did. We had to go find housekeeping in the hallway ourselves and ask for some. THREE of those typical brown hide a bed blankets and TWO duvets later, it was sleep-able. Zero chance of folding up though so we were forced to leave

Plenty of space to stretch out.  The TV remote didn't work and the bathroom door didn't latch, but issues were handled quickly.  They had already sold out of Disneyland tickets on the morning of our arrival, so don't count on getting tickets there.  Disappointed that you couldn't see the Disneyland fireworks despite being so close to the park

My kids love Disney.  We usually go to Disney World in Orlando.  This year, we decided to do something different and come to Disneyland for a few days and then to a Pacific beach.  I picked this Residence's Inn based on online reviews that I read.  I was not disappointed.    I you have kids, want some extra space, and a short walk to Disneyland, this is a great option.  It's clean, well kept, and the staff is good.  We loved it here & we loved that it was right in the middle of restaurants so that we could eat outside the park and then walk back after a rest.

Summary Heading: Pretty good to stay if you have a group, next door to Convention Center
Summary: Stayed here during a four day volleyball tournament. I'm Silver Elite Marriott Member and I requested to check in early. When I arrived, the room was not ready. They said they could not tell me approximately what time it would be ready. The front desk agent advised that I could leave my bags with them. I said okay, well my daughter will need to change for her volleyball tournament so we will be waiting in lobby. He didn't bother to let us know where the bathrooms were or that there was complimentary water or coffee near wear buffet is, etc. Not very welcoming. I told him I would unload my car. I looked for luggage carts. None, I went back to front desk to ask where they were, one was kind of tucked away on the side outside. When I came back into lobby, my room was ready. The

We are here for Vidcon 2018  and Residence Inn by Marriott Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center is  the BEST place to stay.  They are located right next to the convention center. The rooms are very spacious and clean.  Updated and roomy!  We are staying in a 1 room double suite and it’s perfect for our family needs. Residence Inn’s  Desk Agent, David Contreras has been so friendly and helpful.  He has given us some great suggestions for surrounding areas and always greets us with a smile.  We are staying on the 3rd floor and a huge shout out to Housekeeping!  We asked for extra linens and within 10 minutes, we had what was requested.  All done with a smile! Will we stay here again?  Absolutely!!!  We have stayed at other hotels in the area and they don’t compare to the Residence

It's a great time to be in LA, weather was good this time of the year. We stayed in Residence Inn by Marriott at Anaheim Resort and Convention Center. Very convenient, walking to and from Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. There are a lot of pharmacies, restaurants, and convenient stores surrounding the area. Breakfast buffet is also good. The kids had a wonderful time!

Great location! Walk to stores & restaurants. Clean. Pizza Hut Express connected to it.  Free breakfast every morning. Free WIFI. The only reason I will not give this 5 stars is because they do charge $20.00 per night plus tax to park. You can move on & out as much as you like, however I was not counting on this expense. Pool area is beautiful with a very large hot tub as well & private cabanas.

Summary Heading: Not Up to Residence Inn standards
Summary: If you have used a Marriott property in the lastseveral years, you have an expectation. Clean, customer friendly, top of the line. My pros: Extremely comfortable bed. Nice pool area Very nice breakfast buffet My cons: Cleaning staff “forgot” to clean my room and the other day (back to back) did not provide towels, unacceptable for a Residence Inn. No late check out??? No shuttle service to Disneyland, come on! Breakfast buffet area and staff overwhelmed. Several In-house laundry machine washer and dryers inoperable, when you tell the front desk, the answer was “We know!”  Quite frankly for what I paid for two rooms, I did not get the deal Or service I expected. The day after my issue with cleaning and towels, the cleaners showed up at 8:59am whereas in the past it was 4pm,

We stayed here for 5 nights and we had a wonderful corner suite on the 8th floor overlooking the back of California adventure. It was so nice to have a living room to relax in and a full kitchen! One night the Disneyland Fireworks started just as we walked in, and it was a perfect view. One of the main highlights was their breakfast selection, they offered just about anything you could want, and the other was the rooftop pool. It was a nice place to come back and rest from the Disney crowds. Pizza Hut is next to the lobby and CVS is next door which was very convenient. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Disney parks, which we did in the morning, but we used Uber at night. Mainly because of the large amount of locals using the bus stop across the street as their home. In the

We always like the comfort and ease of staying at a Residence Inn. This particular location seems to be recently renovated and the decor is very modern.  Rooms are well appointed, immaculate, quiet, and spacious and the proximity to Disneyland is excellent.  It is a 12 minute walk or $5 Uber ride there.  There are lots of great restaurants nearby and a bunch in Downtown Disney.  Both Coffee Bean and Starbucks are nearby too.  The loading area can get very congested because it is small but they had valet carts at the ready to make loading from the car as easy as possible.  Staff were perfunctory and while I wouldn't say they went over and above, we didn't ask for any extra services.  The included breakfasts are very underwhelming but they have a wide variety of food.  There is a

My new Disneyland hotel! I’ve stayed at many of the Disneyland hotels and this is my new favorite. Clean, new, great service, easy walk to Disney, great breakfast set up (MUCH better than most Residence Inns). I was upgraded for free to a 2-bedroom—one bedroom with bunk beds, which worked out awesome for my group. Large kitchen, large rooms, very clean. The housekeeping was a little lax as I found an old T-shirt from someone else in the corner and our room only had decaf coffee. Otherwise it was superb. There was a large CVS next door and a Pizza Hut attached, which was convenient for long days at Disney. Highly recommend.

We stayed here, for a day, in a 2 bedroom suite, with friends and family in the month of April. After a long drive all the way from Grand Canyon, we reached the hotel in the evening. The people at the reception were very courteous and helpful, and checked us in quickly. We were grateful for the snacks that were offered as we were famished. The suite was quite spacious, and since there were 2 bathrooms, we were able to get ready quickly the next morning, to go to Disneyland.

I stayed with my family; however I would stay if traveling alone. The location was great. If going to Disneyland, you can easily walk to it. Target and Ralphs are close should you need groceries - keep in mind breakfast is included.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for two days during which we visited Disneyland.  The hotel exceeded our expectations.  The room was a decent size including the kitchen and living area.  Everything looked virtually new and was well maintained.  The shower had plentiful hot water and the bed was comfortable.  Everything in the room worked (no problems with air conditioning or other appliances).   We were in close proximity to Disney and walked there both days (I think it was about a half mile).  We also were within easy walking distance of several restaurants.    The breakfast buffet in the morning was huge and had virtually everything a person could ask for.  Our room overlooked the pool area.  The hotel does charge for parking but so does every other hotel in the area.  We

This is my favorite hotel everytime I go here in South California. Diego from the front desk is very acccomodating and very cheerful and helpful. He always have a smile on his face which makes me remember his name and greet him everytime we come here. All the staffs in the breakfast area are very friendly.

My family and I recently stayed at the Residence Inn Convention Center for a long weekend stay.  We have stayed at numerous other hotels in the Disneyland area and could never find a hotel that we wanted to go back to.  We never could find the hotel that did not have an extended walk or provided that good night's sleep that is surely needed after a day at Disney,  This property Is just a very short walk to the main entrance, which is very nice after a long day of walking around.  Once you got back, the two room suite was spacious and quiet.  The entire hotel had a modern feel while still making you feel comfortable.  The staff was extremely gracious with the over night staff being extremely kind.  Two of the four nights, we arrived back after midnight and I personally interacted

We have stayed in several different hotels in the Disneyland area and I think this is our favorite (except for the Grand Californian which is in a different class altogether).   The location: close walking distance The rooms: modern, clean, and sunny The staff: helpful and friendly  The breakfast: tasty and well maintained  Fitness center: two or three of everything We will definitely stay here again when in the area. I recommend you do the same.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel less than half mile from Disney Park entrances!
Summary: My husband and I made our first trip to Anaheim, staying less than one mile walking distance to Disneyland Parks was our goal.  Residence Inn was the BOMB!  Approx 1/2 mile to parks and downtown Disney. Cvs and Walgreens basically next door to stock your fridge with beverages and snacks.  We encountered only pleasant friendly staff.  Rooms were clean.  Rooms were graciously sized. We had king bed suite 3rd floor, view of Anaheim convention center parking ramp, but we didn't mind the view/didn't request a room with good view.  Minimal noise in hallways.  Bed for us was extremely comfortable, soft sheets and blankets. The rooftop pool and hot tub INCREDIBLE to relax and get to meet other guests from all around the world! The breakfast......OMG.......amazing job Residence Inn! If

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel within walking distance of Disneyland.
Summary: My family & I checked in for a 5-night stay at this hotel with multiple days planned for Disneyland & California Adventure. The hotel looks new & has a very comfortable feel. I was given a room upgrade that gave us a room with bunk beds for the kids (which they loved). While there were a couple of minor physical issues with the room (a couple of lamps didn't work, an electrical outlet by the bed didn't work, and the toilet wouldn't stop running), the maintenance staff were quick to respond & repair the issues.  The room itself was quite comfortable. It had a large kitchen area (with a counter & bar stools), full sized fridge, etc. There was a sofa bed in the suite area, with the two beds & bathroom on one side, and the bunk beds & second bathroom on the other side. It was an

the accommodation and facilities were good.  Breakfast included but was average.  Coffee horrible! The Reception staff unable to help with tour confirmations due to tour not being booked by them, extremely inconvinent when you do not have access to an American phone!  Convenient location to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear Courtney,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the lack of customer service you received. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: Hotel room was an excellent choice for my family. The children’s suite was excellent and accomdating to all my families needs. Very convenient location. Plenty of great restaurants and short distance to Disneyland. Delicious and Wide variety of breakfast.  coffee and hot chocolate runs all day.

Stayed 4 nights as a family. Easy check in, lovely big room, very clean modern hotel with good breakfast included in the room rate.   Pizza hut on the ground floor, CVS across the lot, and a 7 11 across the road (which is the best value). Room had a full kitchen to you can stock up.   Short and easy walk to Disney each day.   Very good pool deck up top, with splash zone for kids (which our 2 y/o loved), hot tub and pool.  Would recommend for family’s and business use give its next to the convention center.

We stayed in a 2 queen suite as a family of 4.  The room was adequately sized, clean with comfy beds. The kids loved the pool. Breakfast was standard fare and did the job. Check in and check out was quick and pain free. Nice, quick easy walk to Disneyland.  Only thing I would recommend is more hooks in the bathroom and a bedside table   by the side of the bed. I would stay here again.

Great extended stay hotel that is brand new and immaculate!  Beds are comfy and the kitchenette has everything you need (electric stovetop, microwave, dishwasher, and full size refrigerator, NO oven for baking fyi).  There is a pool with large deck, gym, and laundrymat on the 6th floor.  There is free breakfast served in the am and coffee and water 24/7.  Pizza Hut Express is in the building and will deliver right to your room.  Definitely a kid friendly hotel. Basic WiFi is free and I had no issues with it.  Premium WiFi is available for purchase.  There are a couple of public computers and a printer available for use by guests.  There is a daily parking fee but if you take the shuttle from the airport Disneyland is within walking distance so no car needed.

This is a new, well-run property. Our event (volleyball tournament) was at the convention center, so I can't comment on the convenience to the park, but I believe it is close by. As far as the convention center is concerned, it could not be closer (it is, in fact, the next building on Katella Avenue). The room makes great use of the space, with a granite (!) counter separating the full-service kitchen and the living room. The bathroom was modern and well-kept, and the bedroom featured two queen-sized beds with ample room besides. Perhaps the best part of the stay was the buffet breakfast, though. Even with a large number of guests eating simultaneously, there was more than enough seating, and the buffet did not run out of food. Finally, the staff were friendly and helpful and

We were happy with the hotel, great location, comfortable rooms and beds, except for the sofa pullout bed. The kitchen was sufficient. The breakfast that was included was adequate, with a good selection and variety of food for everyone, even gluten free options. My only complaint was that breakfast stops at 9:30 and we are late risers when on vacation. IF you intend on using the sofa bed pullout, i recommend NOT. It was the most uncomfortable bed, you're better off sleeping on the floor or perhaps on an air mattress. The coils and the wood frame are sticking out, the mattress was not even an inch thick, it was extremely uncomfortable. We will stay there again, but will never use the pullout sofa again.

After checking the reviews on Tripadvisor we booked this hotel for our Disneyland visit. It was only a short walk and the hotel itself is spotless! Super new, trendy and most important clean. Friendly staff and outstanding breakfast. Definately value for your money!! The family suits have everything you wish for, and the kids loved the pool outside.  Will recomend this place for sure!

We were in town for a convention. We stayed one night in a Disney View suite. It consists of 1 bedroom, 1 bunk bed room, 2 baths, living room and sofa bed. Roomy for a family of five. We were able to see the Disneyland fireworks in the evening.  It's located within walking distance of the parks, convention center, restaurants, CVS, and mall. The location is convenient.   Customer service was great. I don't have any complaints. We'll likely return since we're Disneyland APs.

Absolutely loved these apartments had a 2 room kitchen , bedroom , bathroom , lounge , free wifi buffet breakfast included , movies , great location if going to convention centre for an event supermarket on the corner very central to restaurants & Disney land

We stayed at this hotel in a family suite for 4 nights and couldn't have been more comfortable.  The layout was perfect for our family of 5.  We had 2 double beds and 2 bunk beds and 2 bathrooms and a kitchen and living area. The ease in getting to the parks and to restaurants was perfect. No need for a car.  The kids loved the rooftop pool and the breakfast each morning was great.  Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place for families/Close to parks
Summary: Had a wonderful time visiting this property for families annual trip to Disneyland. Only hiccup was the guest elevator was broken so we were utilizing the service elevator.  The morning breakfast and evening social was a very nice touch as well. Great way to start and end the days.  Room was very comfortable with amble space which exceeded our needs.  Staffing at the desk was very helpful and friendly and overall pleased to return to this property on our next trip.

We stayed at the Residence Inn for three days while visiting Disneyland. The location can’t be beat if this is where you are going. It’s an easy walk to the park. Our room was very clean with a great view of the park. The mattress was so comfortable and the towels were nice. I hate scratchy towels and these were not. The breakfast was hot and plentiful. The breakfast room is well laid out, so even though there were many people eating, it didn’t feel crowded.   Check-in was fast and pleasant. They even stored our suitcase until our room was ready since we go into town on an early flight.   This hotel should definitely be on your short list of places to stay in Anaheim.

Stayed here for 4 nights late November.  Location is excellent for Disneyland.  The rooms were great updated, clean, nice decor.  Breakfast was great! The Pizza Hut attaches was a bonus. As well as the CVS located right outside the main entrance.  The staff was very pleasant and accommodating.  Highly recommended!!

We had an awesome family holiday. We stayed 6 nights and it was outstanding. Rooms were clean and awesome to have a living space separate from the bedrooms. The only thing that would have been helpful is for the breakfast to start at 6 am to accommodate the magic morning.

I stayed here for two nights in order to be close to Disneyland, this was the perfect hotel. It was clean, close by the Disneyland, great breakfast, great parking, amazing rooftop pool. I really couldn’t ask for much more.  It was extremely comfortable and clean and I love the layout of the room we had a one bedroom with a very large kitchen a nice sitting area and a cute bunkbed with the second bathroom,  it was perfect for our group. We went to the pool multiple times in the day and the evening and it never disappointed. It was crowded but never felt like there wasn’t enough room for everyone. The breakfast was extremely organized and very large with plenty of food for the large crowd at this hotel.  We picked this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland and it was completely

We stayed here from March 12-16 2018. It was our families first visit to Disneyland. And we were really impressed with it. The location was by far the best. Just a small walk to Disney. Not even 5 minutes away you had a Walgreens and CVS. Everything was close by! The rooms were impeccable! So clean and very homie. It has a full kitchen! Breakfast was great. Yes it has many of the same things; eggs, bacon, waffles, etc. But it also had other choices along with that. Of course depending on what you felt like eating that morning, you could eat. The staff was very attentive and went out of their way to make it memorable. During our stay there our daughter turned 7 years old. And during breakfast she decided to wear her Disney ears. We started conversing with a young lady who asked

Summary Heading: Almost too fancy to be a Residence Inn
Summary: Loved staying at this hotel.  Has more of a Marriott feel than Residence Inn.  Great service, clean and comfy stay.   Free breakfast.  About a 15mins walk to Disney.  Did not have a chance to swim but the pool looks nice!

The hotel amenities and accommodations were great! Conveniently close to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. Nice, clean rooms and great rooftop pool area. Would definitely come here again for my next trip to Anaheim, CA!

Summary Heading: Wonderful first visit to Disneyland area
Summary: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights as part of our spring break.  There were 5 of us in a 1 Bedroom suite, which included a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a living room with a nice sleeper sofa.  The unit included a nice spacious bathroom with shower and a kitchen with small island table.  The hotel was modern, spotless and amazingly quiet for its large size.  The beds were comfortable, and each bed had 4 pillows so if you prefer a taller firmer pillow you could just stack them.  The daily breakfast had cereals, oatmeal, waffle maker and LOTS of topping, eggs, potatoes, sausage, fruits and breads.  Plenty to keep my kids full until lunchtime.  The walk to Disneyland was 10 minutes (.7 mile).  The walk to the downtown Disney area took about 20 minutes.  We took a Lyft from the

Summary Heading: Residence Inn: Great Location, Good Value
Summary: This hotel was booked for a family trip and business trip combination, and frankly was in the perfect location. It provided easy access for my family to enjoy the Anaheim Disney experience, but also was good for the business side of the trip. Rooms are recently renovated, as is the exterior. Pizza Hut as room service is a family delight, especially after a long day of walking. If you are in town for a convention center and Disney experience, i would stay here again. Gym has what you need although the machines could be upgraded, but the outdoor pool and hot tub on the 6th floor provide a nice sanctuary for the whole family. Staff is very friendly and helpful too, and all around great for Marriott Gold members!

Pros: Property is in great condition and the rooms were very clean. The 1BR suite is a must if you have an infant/children as it provides kitchenette and separation for sleeping if you have a crib or little ones (We had a 7 month old with us). Hotel accepts grocery delivers to hold for you to pick up which is very handy if you are coming in late from the airport. The hotel is 10 min walk to main Disney Gate and the included morning breakfast is a big cost saver and very good quality.   Cons: Parking is expensive at 20/day and should be noted if you are renting a car to accommodate into your pricing.   Overall I would highly recommend this hotel as it provides a lot of great ammenities at the price point and check-in/out was very efficient.   Tip: If you are are looking for a

We stayed here when visiting Disneyland/California Adventures. This is a great hotel if you are traveling with kids. We stayed in the Family Suite with Bunk Beds which was perfect. The room has a split floor plan with the kids room (and bathroom!) and one side and the king bedroom/bathroom on the other side. We walked to the park every day (and would come back for breaks/naps). During our breaks, the kids would go to the pool which has an area for toddlers as well. They had a blast there and often times were interested in just staying there rather than going back to the park.   Breakfast was good - just note that it gets packed since everyone appeared to be heading to the park for the open.   We also liked the fact that there was a CVS a short walk across the driveway. Our first

Stayed on two different trips in February and my positive impression of this hotel is changing.  Do not expect to have any of the perks to being a gold or platinum member recognized (separate line, late check out, upgrades when available).  There is no separate line for check in/check out nor are early check in/late check out requests honored.  As the front desk gentleman told me, all guests are treated the same.  We even got a smaller room than we reserved on our first February visit.  On our second stay the bed was so bad it felt like the mattress was 100 years old.  This was different than prior trips when the beds were comfortable. The hotel knew they had a large group coming in (cheerleaders) yet they were completely unprepared for the number of check ins.  The rooms were
Manager Response: Dear Eve G,  Thank you for your review about your most recent stay with us. I'm sorry the stay did not reach your expectations. As an Elite Member we value your loyalty to our brand.   Rewards members do get priority to room upgrades, early check-in/late check out, and upgraded WI-FI. However, all of these upgrades and services are based upon availability. With us being located near both Disneyland and the convention center it does make it difficult to honor early check-ins and late check outs.   I apologize that the room fell short of your expectations and that the bed was not to your liking. We hope that all our guests are comfortable in their home away from home!  I hope this helped address some of the issues. Thank you again for your feedback!  Sincerely, Alex Blume FD Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great location! Service could be improved!!
Summary: This property is pretty new and very modern and overall, very nice. We stayed here only 1 night so we didn't explore too much but it was in a great location. The breakfast was great and the staff there were so sweet and so helpful. It's packed so beware!    The front staff on the other hand, were not so sweet. As Platinum members we usually get upgraded (only upon availability, of course) and we found out there was availability and yet they didn't want to upgrade us to a bigger room. I've stayed at 100s of Marriotts and this was one of the first that had the availability and upgraded us just a room with a 'nicer view'. They said we had to pay for the bigger rooms. Again, I'm not expecting it- but when there is availability and they are being stingy- especially for one night- I'd

I was in Anaheim for a national convention and this location was PERFECT!  The hotel is great, modern and chic.  I was very happy with the amenities and offerings available to me.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and experience at the Residence Inn.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel for the Best Price!
Summary: Best check in experience with Luis M, you can tell this guy loves what he does! The whole team of guys was great when we checked in Friday Night. Also, hands down best complimentary breakfast buffet ive ever had. The rooftop firepits are awesome for a beer at night and Jacuzzi after a long day at Disney.. we loved the rooms as well. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back!! Absolutely love it here!

Summary Heading: Wish I could give it more stars
Summary: Such amazing staff. Especially Ariel at the check in desk. She truly is a blessing.  She realized we had a rough trip coming in from Vegas on a Sunday. She bought me a beverage just to be kind.   The hotel felt like a condo.  Full big fridge and an adequate dishwasher.  It was super clean.   Walk to Disney was 10 min adult walk. Close to CVs and Walgreens   We were able to eat all our meals out of our condo.   Only wish was the pool would stay open an extra hAlf hour to soak our sore joints after walking at Disney.

Modern and clean!!   Close to Disney and the convention center.  Breakfast included to get you day off to a great start.  There is a bar down stairs if you need to unwind.   There is a Pizza hut express attached.   Very close to a variety of other restaurants.  Practically in the same parking lot is an 24hr CVS.   Can not go wrong.!!!!

We are frequent travelers to Disneyland and sadly, this is our least favorite hotel to date. The rooms themselves were nice and spacious and definitely cute (we had the one bedroom with the bunk bed alcove and 2 bathrooms), and also clean. The breakfast was great too, we were there for 6 nights/7 days and there were different choices about 3 days in a row which was nice. The location was also great, just a short 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Where we were left disappointed was with the service. Upon check-in there wasn't a single friendly face. Every person we spoke to seemed to be tired or in a bad mood. Housekeeping neglected to come into our room twice and we could've really used the fresh towels. The splash pad wasn't working and when we called to ask about it we were
Manager Response: Dear ChrisNAmber,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us on TripAdvisor.   Receiving a warm welcome during check-in often times sets the tone for a great stay. Unfortunately, it is clear that we fell short of meeting your expectations when you arrived at Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  Based on your feedback, it is apparent that our team as a whole did not fulfill your, nor our, expectations. In order to better uphold our commitment to deliver exceptional service to every guest, from arrival to departure, I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team in order to improve our guest satisfaction process.   Thank you for being a valued customer and we hope to welcome you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I’m a Marriott frequent stayer.  This trip was a family vacation with me, husband, 1 yr old, 3 yr old, and 27 yr old sister in law.  We had the Monsters Inc suite.  Lots of space, cute view of backside of Carsland, two gracious bathrooms, good living room, and the small kitchen was very handy with the baby - full fridge, dishwasher, normal coffee maker, lots of cabinets, & full sink.  We never cooked so can’t comment on stove.  We also never used the breakfast (I’m not a buffet fan) or used the rooftop pool.  However, the laundry was quick, easy, & clean -  Had time  to order from Pizza Hut in the lobby, start load, set timer, run to pick up pizza, get it Tom room, & back to laundry room in time to flip clothes.   Only comment is - be aware that the bunk bed space does not have

My daughter invited me to stay with her family while her husband attended a convention. I usually stay at the Grand Californian when I go to disneyland and thought this would be a good chance to experience another place. I was not disappointed. Our room was huge, modern, roomy and very clean. The kitchenette was stocked, loved the modern bar/table and chairs. The smart tv had hulu and netflix. Loved the big windows. the bedroom has a sliding door to separate the living area which by the way had sleek leather furniture and a sofa couch. The bathroom was a shower only, nice modern new shower but we did wish it had a bath for my grandson. Free WIFI, we had 4 devices connected. The free breakfast in the morning would change every day and they were constantly cleaning and refilling

We come to Anaheim every year and have always stayed at a Hilton property.  Because Hilton has changed their points program, we decided to try Marriott this year.  From the moment we got to the hotel, Diego at the front desk made us feel welcome, held our luggage for us while we waited a short time for our room and gave us a room based on my preferences in my account. Thank you Diego! Our room was beyond our expectation.  It felt like home from the moment we walked in.  It smelled fresh and clean and it was spacious and modern.  The decor is just gorgeous!  The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we could possibly need.  The TVs were awesome, Netflix, 3 HBO channels and the furniture, beds, etc. very comfortable.  We loved the bathroom too, Paul Mitchell products and huge

Summary Heading: Rooms are big, ideal for families visiting Disney..
Summary: We stayed here for five nights  recently, and spent most of our time at Disney. Although there are closer and cheaper hotels this one is still just a 10 minute walk away and offers better facilities than most...Everything was new and fresh and the free breakfast was a plus.. The pool area is also great, although for those of us who don’t leave Disney until close, it closed a bit early at just 10 pm.This was too early for us.Rooms have full facilities and true to label/ description. So far on our trip we have stayed at two other hotels in the Southern California area but none have been as good..They also have a good laundry on-site although a bit pricey according to my wife.. Each wash being about $9 per load when you had to buy soap and use the dryer..... We would definitely

When you are a high volume (resort town), slightly dated residence inn, there is only 3 ways to get 4 stars in my book. First, great customer service and friendly. Second, keep it clean. Finally, price your rooms to reflect all of the above. They succeeded on all 3. If you are looking for modern rooms and a quality fitness center - you would not give 4 stars. But if you want friendly, clean and a good value - consider staying here.

I was attending a trade show and stayed here for 3 nights in January. We were all very happy with our stay! The room was  large and clean with a big kitchen that had everything we needed. It was very quiet and then beds were super comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is also really good with lots of options and good coffee. It's not the best location for dinner but you can walk about 10 mins up to some decent restaurants.  On top of that there is a outdoor pool and hot tub which seemed to be very well maintained - and best of all it was hardly used! I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Nice hotel.  I ordered groceries from Von's, and when arrived they had been put away in the room.  It is clean and comfortable, though the sofa is terrible.  The staff are super helpful.  The breakfast is good: quite a lot of selection. It is a close and secure walk to Disney.  As a woman, I felt completely safe waling back to the room late with my daughter.  The CVC is close and an add-on.

I was there with 2 teenagers, 2 children under  6 a baby and 3 adults.  THis hotel is fabulous  clean the free breakfast amazing and close to Disneyland.  The kitchen was very helpful to cut down on expense as we stayed a week.  Staff very helpful    Highly recommend

Summary Heading: Clean, modern, new, family friendly and so close to Disney.
Summary: Had a great stay at this very clean, new and modern hotel. So close to Disney, restaurants and a 24HR Walgreens is one block away, great for families! Rooftop pool was a hit with my son. Onsite laundry and free breakfast, again so family friendly. The free breakfast was substantial, eggs, sausages, cereal, toast, and make your own waffles! I would definitely stay here again. Room was well appointed, kitchen was great  and had a large ensuite bathroom. Not a lot of space for clothes and only a pocket door to the bathroom, so little privacy, but all in all a great place to stay. Highly recommend it for families and couples.

I know this is only a 5 star rating, but it was beyond my expectation and one of the nicest places I've ever stayed. First off the lobby is very beautiful and chic. The guest services was excellent.  The room was unbelievable. We had a 2 bedroom and 2 bath place with a kitchen and living room.  The Jacuzzi, pool and workout facility were very nice. I think this will be my new place when we come to Disneyland. It was perfect!

Very nicely appointed hotel with comfy beds and small living room with the suites that have a bunk bed room for kids. Nice breakfast provided with lots of different options such as waffles, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs etc. Disney is just a 15 min walk away so a good distance to return during the afternoon for a rest and then go back at night.

Excellent suite with decent size living and dining/bar area.  We were able to order food through UberEats and have a meal comfortably at the eat-in bar.  Well-appointed and clean.  Complimentary breakfast served.  Easy walking distance to Disney - just about half a mile walk.    CVS is nearby and was a good place to buy water, additional toiletries, etc. without paying a hotel premium.

This hotel is new, and clean. Rooms are updated and the breakfast buffet is impressive. You can walk to all of Disneyland etc. and you are really close the the I 5. The front desk staff was so helpful. We stayed 5 nights and will definitely come back. We have teenagers and had the family suite. My kids are 5’6” the bed was just a little too small. Only downside was kids bedroom has no door so you can’t hang in the living room if someone is sleeping.

Summary Heading: Two bedroom executive suite has some faults - otherwise property is modern, clean and close to Disney.
Summary: Stayed at this property for seven nights over the New Years holiday in a two bedroom “executive suite”.  Overall this is a nice modern property with an excellent location for Disney.  The term executive suite is misleading as the executive suite had the same furnishings and fixtures  as all the other rooms- it is an upgrade only in the square footage- much of which is wasted space other than the second bedroom and bathroom. Unfortunately the location of the two bedroom executive suites is such that the suites do not have windows in the living /kitchen area which makes the living room very dark.  The lighting in the living room is poor with only one floor lamp.  The two bedrooms are off the living room and separated by sliding pocket type doors that close poorly. In addition, The

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights and wow, great amenities, great service and a good variety at breakfast. I liked the fact that it is walking distance to Disneyland. Totally worth it. New everything. Stay here because it is very reasonable priced!!!

Hubs and I stayed two nights with our 3-year-old for Mickey's Birthday and were impressed with the overall comfort and convenience of our stay. Though not perfect, it's probably one of the best options in the area, especially for Disneyland visitors.  PROS: • location - about 10 or 15 minute walk to Disneyland entrance • PIzza Hut Express on site (ground level between parking structure and lobby...room delivery til 11pm) • CVS and Coffee Bean on ground floor near street entrance (both less than a minute walk from lobby) • heated rooftop adult pool and small kiddie pool with an additional little splash area (towels provided) • good standard free breakfast buffet • free wifi • ample outlets • extra large bathroom and shower (no tub, which may be a CON for some) • floor-to-ceiling

We stayed here for 5 nights and were very impressed with the new facilities and location to Disneyland. The options for accommodation in Anaheim aren't great apart from Disneyland Hotels which can be very expensive. We chose the Marriott as it was fairly new and had lots of options for families. Overall it was great, roof top pool was fun and they had movie nights and a fire pit. You could see the fireworks from the pool which was amazing. The service was friendly and while the breakfast wasn't amazing it was good enough for a family holiday to Disney. Would highly recommend.

Newer hotel in the area. Less than a 10 minute walk from Disneyland. Great breakfast, spacious pool area with a splash pad, and nice sized hot tub. Rooms were quite spacious as well… Within distance of walking to just about for anything you want to eat and also close to a pharmacy if you’re looking for some last minute items. Will definitely stay here again! Only downfall was that the hotel was in front of the Disneyland fireworks at 9:30.

Stayed December 2017 with husband and 2 girls 14 and 12. Hotel is brand new modern,spacious and clean.breakfast was good and selection was adequate. Breakfast area was spacious. Staff was friendly and kind and actually allowed us to check early at noon as we came into town early in the day.The suite was modern and the tv had many choices.The view was great.

Summary Heading: Loved our stay, very comfortable and convenient
Summary: We stayed here two nights for a family Disneyland trip.  Very comfortable hotel!  We enjoyed a "king suite" that allowed us to sleep in a separate bedroom from the kids on the sleeper sofa in the living room--- the room price was very reasonable.  The room includes a full kitchen, and while we didn't do any cooking, it looked to be fully stocked with pans, utensils, etc.  And it includes a full-size fridge.  The pool (up on a rooftop) was very nice, and we really enjoyed the jacuzzi in the evening.  The location is convenient: easy walking distance to the park entrance; and right next door are a 24hr CVS pharmacy, a Coffee Bean, and an IHOP restaurant for dinner.  The breakfast provided by the hotel was pretty extensive.  What we enjoyed most though was the pleasant breakfast

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong with this hotel
Summary: i've stayed at this location many times. It's a new hotel only a couple of years old. Very clean and comfortable. I love staying here.  Staff is very friendly and helpful and they have an excellent fitness center, great breakfast, and an awesome pool and whirlpool.   Always a fabulous time here. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great hotel within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: We booked a different hotel which didn't open in time for our trip so they protected us here at the Residence Inn. So happy with that decision. This was a large, clean, roomy hotel. Perfect for our family of 5. Close to Disneyland (we walked each day). They had a great complimentary breakfast in the mornings with one of the best setups I've seen. Plenty of room, lots of tables, lots of choices for food. It was pretty, it was clean, it was well stocked. The staff was great and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting this area.

So we went to Disneyland to see the Holiday Decorations for 2017. We stayed here for 4 days and we have no complaints. We’ll always stay here when we visit Disney. It’s a quick walk to the park and the rooms are clean. The beds are comfy and we enjoy have the two separate rooms. Thanks Residence Inn.

These hotel is only 10 mins walk to the Disney main gate and you can easily find a place to eat. It also provide free breakfast with choice of scrambled egg, sausage, self make waffle and different kinds of bread, fruit, cereal and 24 hours of coffee, cold water. It’s nice to stay here.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel with limited customer service
Summary: This hotel is absolutely perfect for a Disneyland vacation. It is modern, clean, spacious, and has a great breakfast spread in the morning. We loved our room. The pool amenities were the absolute best. The location was fabulous. It would have been 5/5 if we hadn't needed any service from the staff. In most cases, we don't need anything from hotel staff (other than check in and check out) and so wouldn't know the difference. However, on this occasion we were "higher maintenance" than usual and found the response very limited, with the exception of the ongoing efforts of the front desk staff to try to help. Our primary issue was that the cleaning staff didn't come. This wouldn't have been a challenge except that we ran out of a couple of things in our room. The front desk called

We were traveling with 3 of our kids and booked 2 adjoining rooms. When we arrived they didn't have two rooms on the same floor much less adjoining. They upgraded us to a  family suite that was simply amazing. Everything appeared brand spanking new.   Room was quiet and easily walkable to Disneyland. We even walked back for lunch a couple of times.   The parking garage is separate, and there were no connecting doors to the hotel.   The pool area was nice and we were told you could see Disneyland fireworks from the pool. That wasn't exactly true. You could see some reflection of different color in the haze sometimes if you were leaning over the edge of the railing. It wasn't a deal breaker for us.  The beds were very comfortable. One strange thing, the couch seemed like it was

Residence Inn by Marriot was amazing! Booked the family suite and enjoyed our stay very much! Amber, our hotel concierge, greeted and treated my family and I with the utmost respect and great personality! She had the best customer service and made our stay a memorable one. Due to the inconvience of dine in pizza hut that night, we were comped with dinner plus my kids enjoyed the hot cocoa station provided for all guests! This was our 1st family trip to disneyland but our stay here topped it off! The family suite was so much fun....best part was the kids bunk bed room. The pool and gym area was fun especially the mini waterpark. The bar area was perfect to getaway for a late night drink. Overall, wonderful staff and ambiance. Definitely will come back!

Anaheim near Disneyland and the Convention Center can feel overwhelming with traffic and people. Coming back to my suite at the Residence Inn felt as much like being home as anyplace away from home can be. At check-in, Kathy made sure I had a quiet location. The other staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast has something for everyone, even health conscious eaters like me. The suite was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very good, new, good location, ample rooms
Summary: The location is very convenient if you are visiting Disneylands. Most hotels are old. This one is new, the rooms are very ample, confortable. The bathroom is spacious, the breakfast is good, although it finishes at 9.30 am. A cvs 5 steps away. Very nice stay. Safe parking in the property.

We stayed at the Residence Inn for a short 4 night stay in Anaheim, and I have to say upon arriving I was really impressed.  The hotel looked brand new, and was just overall really nice.  It has a huge breakfast area, with a breakfast buffet included as part of your stay.  They also have fresh water dispensers in the lobby which helped us cut down on the cost of having to buy bottled water during our trip.  There’s a Pizza Hut express downstairs which is nice for a late night, or just to grab something for the kids.  I will say we never used it, as there is a Blaze Pizza just across the street, basically the same prices, for better quality food.   The hotel also boasts a really nice rooftop area, with a pool, very large spa that can fit about 20 people, 2 fire pits, and they
Manager Response: Dear jrobba,  Thank you for your review on your most recent stay with us. I am sorry that the stay did not meet up to your expectations. Though I am happy to see that you enjoyed many of the outlets that our property offered, I wanted to touch on an issue that you were not satisfied with.  As Marriott Rewards Elite Member, we appreciate your loyalty to the brand. As you know, our rewards members get priority to items such as upgraded Wi-Fi, room upgrades and early check in. With that, these are primarily subject to our availability. Our property, being a resort, is adjacent to not only Disneyland but the Anaheim Convention Center which houses hundreds of conventions annually. As you can imagine, our property is heavily occupied for most of the year. This makes it extremely difficult for us to honor late check outs and early check ins in order to properly accommodate our guests.   I hope that I was able to provide some additional detail to your concerns. Thank you for your feedback once again.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: wow! i will definitely stay here again! booked a 3 night stay for a bday wknd w/a group of gal pals & we got the bunk bed 2 bedroom suite theme park view. we had 7 gals & it can definitely fit 7-8 adults comfortably. never got to watch fireworks from the room but you could see a little bit i would imagine. the mini kitchen was helpful but we rarely used it except for the full fridge to keep beverages cold. free breakfast buffet was really helpful as it powered us thru most of the day at the parks (sausages, potatoes, scrambled eggs, DIY waffle station, beverage station, fruit, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal). room was clean everyday & overall it was a really comfortable stay. we felt spoiled at this hotel. I even asked front desk for a special surprise since we celebrated a bday & they

I will make this short.  Rude staff that are not empowered by the property to make service recovery decisions. Specifically, the night manager Ariel.   Called ahead and confirmed that our room had a rollaway bed. Nope. This property does not have these at all and is a “fire hazard,” according to Ariel. After speaking with her about this she offered to arrange for another hotel to bring one over. So, which is it? A fire risk or a way to not have to deal With rollaways? She was fine with me sleeping on the ground so that my son and daughter didn’t have to sleep together. I ended up getting an inflatable mattress from target. Never again.   Amenities for this hotel specifically states crib/rollaway. When I showed the staff they just looked at me with a blank stare. “Oh yeah, it
Manager Response: Dear Nathan P,  Thank you for you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  I am sorry that the stay did meet your expectations. As stated by my team, our property does not offer rollaway beds as an additional option for bedding. Every single one of our suites includes a pull out sofa bed in addition to the standard beds offered in the room. Many of our guests find the sofa sleeper very convenient when housing families with children or for any additional sleeping space.  I would also like to point out that on our Marriott website, in the Room Details section under Beds and Bedding, it states "Rollaway beds not permitted". I am sorry if there was any confusion or miscommunication.  Thank you again for your feedback.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My family and I stayed here for a week in August for a full-on Disney blowout! It was a great hotel - I love how US hotels have free coffee! The place was clean and well maintained. Our room was spacious enough for us all and the kitchenette was more than adequate - Netflix was a great bonus! My kids loved the hot tub and pool area and after a long day wandering the streets of Disney it was a great place to unwind.  It is within walking distance for Disneyland and for the Garden Grove restaurant area. The only downside was the exorbitant prices in the Walgreens onsite - shame really as I hate being ripped off. The breakfast was great and the food-area was kept clean at all times. I would stay here again, however the whole area is just too built up for me and the old Anaheim I

Summary Heading: Clean, nice bed, small, functional kitchen, friendly staff
Summary: This is a useful place to perch for short and long trips to this rather industrial area of LA. Pros: clean, helpful staff, comfortable beds, hot water, attentive staff, and toiletries are top notch Cons: interstate noise can be bothersome, limited nearby restaurants beyond fast food

Summary Heading: really like it but it's the little annoying things
Summary: An easy enough walk to disneyland, great to have free breakfast, beds are comfortable, but it's the little things that matter. Such as, we paid for a 1 bedroom suite but basically had a studio room as the pocket door was totally broken! So our little one was able to escape the pack n'play and wake everyone up in both rooms in the middle of the night!!  We brought it up with the front desk and was reassured it would get fixed and wouldn't you know it, it wasn't fixed!! They comp'ed me 2 day's parking but that hardly made up for the lost sleep. Granted, we didn't bring it up sooner with the front desk, but I expect better condition of the rooms at the Residence Inn and especially for such a newer property.   Our room was cleaned but for whatever reason, we almost ran out of soap.
Manager Response: Dear spontane0us_famly,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. While you did point out some items to your liking (such as, breakfast, comfort and our proximity to Disney), I am saddened to see that there were items that were not to your liking. I apologize that the door in your one bedroom suite was not functioning properly. It is our duty to ensure that any items that our brought up to the team are rectified immediately. In my teams effort to make things right by taking care of your parking, I understand that it can still be frustrating.  Rest assured your review has been shared with my maintenance team along with  my housekeeping team in effort for improvement. Than you again for your feedback!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Rented through Disney and was not disappointed. Upgraded from a king to a double queen suite when we arrived.  Enjoyed the expansive, free breakfast spread each morning, outdoor heated pool, ping pong table, pleasant staff, convenient Disney shuttle, comfortable beds and most of all - utter quietness for a great night's sleep each night.  Stayed four nights and very happy with the hotel.  Only down side is the $20 per day parking fee.

Had such a great time at this hotel!! We stayed in a suite which was very clean when we first arrived and very spacious. The staff was also very helpful and kind. The food in the dining area was so good! So many tables and seats so no need to rush to get your food! The walk to Disneyland is not bad at all, so overall I️ think this hotel is awesome! Definitely would want to stay here again in the future.

Nice , nearly new hotel near a number of amenities & Disneyland. We were in a 2 bedroom suite, the rooms are cleaned everyday though we didn't do any cooking.Breakfast was excellent, lots of hot food selections.

Attending a company convention and this was close by.   Rooms were clean and Marriott upgraded me which was terrific.   But the prices were on the high side, beacuse of proximety to Disney and all.   No newspapers, is this a trend at all the Marriotts now, second one that did not have anything to offer.   Also, no coffee at 5:30AM,  had to walk to Starbucks.   I did not mind the walk, but have been used to grabbing coffee and a paper to start my day in the lobby.    The breakfast area was big and quite a few choices, but pretty standard faire.   Service was good, the staff was apologetic about the lack of coffee and paper (if I could just wait until 6...)   If I was on vacation, this would have been just fine and I guess most people staying there are.. Parking is an extra $18 a

Summary Heading: Regret it - Over priced without Amenities
Summary: With options available at the vicinity chose to stay here just because they offer a kitchen for my family. Overall the staff in the front desk were rude and less helpful. On request for a baby chair to the room - they simply denied the request.  Most amenities were missing for the price we paid for the rooms. The breakfast was bad and the cleaning was always half done. Very disappointed with my stay at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Karthik B,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your most recent stay.  I apologize that our team did not provide you with the customer service that should have been provided. Please know that I have addressed your comments with my team in order for us to target any issues.    We hope that you will allow us to provide you with a positive experience in the near future!

Summary: Two adult couples spent Halloween weekend in Anaheim for a Disneyland visit.  The hotel is fairly new. Not much of a view from the hotel but it is only a 10 minute walk from the park entrance. The room included a full kitchen and a siting area. My husband is an early to bed person so this was perfect with the extra tv.   The hotel has a massive breakfast included in the cost. With the volume of people at the hotel, they managed to keep everything fully stocked and fresh.  The staff is very courteous. The bar in the lobby was a good meeting place. There is also Pizza Hut in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Great location - well suited for families
Summary: Nicely positioned hotel, very close to convention centre, and easy 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland / California Adventure with 2 children under 10.  Plenty of food at breakfast, although its a bit manic with all the families about at this time. Reception staff very helpful. Cleaners reasonably good, although on each day of our 4 night stay they seemed to time cleaning our room as we returning from a tiring day out at Disney. Storage in rooms was a bit limited, but beds were very comfortable. Short walk to pharmacies and some takeaways as well, which was helpful.

We really liked everything about this hotel! Everything was very clean and up to date. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was great and well kept up even when they were busy. Staff was friendly and very attentive. Pool area on the 6th floor was nice with the hot tub and the seating areas with the fireplaces. As wonderful as everything about the hotel is, the location is even better! 10 minute walk to the gates of Disney! Lots of restaurant options within walking distance, there were several days that we didn't move the car. You do have to pay to park, but it isn't any more expensive than parking at Disney. We will definitely stay here next time we are in town!

I can't remember the last time I've loved a hotel this much, and I've stayed in some of the highest rated hotels in the country.   Our day started with chaos - long story short, on our honeymoon, my mom had a medical emergency at home, we were staying at the Hilton down the street, tried to leave early but couldn't get a flight or a rental car until tomorrow, Hilton was overbooked, ended up here as the result of a great deal on Hotwire, hungry, stressed, tired, and crabby!  Rubin at the front desk was so sweet right off the bat, and we were impressed with the sleek and modern lobby. He upgraded us to a family suite to celebrate our honeymoon, and got us early check in so we could put our bags away. We were wowed by the room - full kitchen with every little convenience -

Clean, beautiful rooms, kitchen area and living room spacious. Great pool area!  Full breakfast buffet!  TV in living room and bedroom.  Full kitchen great for families.   Close to Disneyland.   Would stay there again!  Highly reccomend it!!

Summary Heading: Excellent modern accommodation close to Disney
Summary: This hotel is excellently situated for easy access to the Disney parks.  Be aware, as with anywhere in Anaheim, that your journey time to other parts of LA can be considerable due to the traffic (e.g. 2 hours+ to get back from Universal one time).  It's a really modern, recently renovated hotel and the quality of the accommodation was excellent. The kids loved the Monster Inc. styled bunk bed room and our king bedroom was nicely separated by a much bigger lounge area and kitchen that we were expecting to find.
