There's a nice pool on the rooftop but to be honest we only used this once or twice as you're too busy doing other stuff around the area.  The breakfast provided is probably the only slight down point. It's what you'd expect of buffet breakfast: adequate but nothing

This hotel is modern and tasteful. Our 3 grandkids loved the pool especially since they were other children to play with there.   The buffet is quite good and a wonderfulc way to get a great start to a busy Disneyland Adventure. I truly wish that they offered a courtesy shuttle of some kind since it is over a half mile walk to the entrance. The morning walk is easy but that walk back after a full day at DL and tired kiddos is quite the challenge. However a taxi cab ride back was only $5. Otherwise we had a marvelous stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

We've stayed at quite a few Residence Inns and most have a modest pool -  I think this particular one has the best pool of any I've visited. Since we were with our small grandchildren we visited the pool several times and found that the toddler in particular loved the "wet deck" area with various fountains and sprays.  Additionally, the hotel is very close to the Disney parks and has a breakfast area large enough to accomodate the hordes of tourists. This is going to be our first choice for future Disney visits.

So I've stayed here since the hotel opened. The first time I stayed the lower floor was not even open yet. Anyways, I've noticed that the reception crew is very hit or miss. As a gold member and 3 nights away from platinum, I figured service would be a little better. I did get my early check in but had to wait and had a phone call. Service at the time was good. When, I came back it was ok. When my friend checked in, she was hassled by the rep and made it very complicated for her to get a room key even though name was on reservation. I came back to rep and it was a gentleman (name might be matt) was rude. I asked why in the past the parking was included and now $16. When I got bill it $18. I believe these to be made prices like luggage fees with an airline. So I asked to get a
Manager Response: Dear Etienne L,  Thank you for your feedback on your most recent stay with us.   I am sorry that you encountered various issues during your stay. I would like to address some of the issues that you mentioned:  Early Check In- It is in our best interest to allow for early check in for all of our guests. However, because of our proximity to Disney and the Anaheim Convention Center, it is often hard for us to guarantee an early check in due to the continuous traffic.  Retrieving a Key- For the security of our guests, it is in our best interest to make sure that we gather all information first for any guests requesting access to rooms. This allows us to ensure that guests security is protected.   Parking- Our daily parking fee is $18.00 + tax notated on our property website. The parking fee is not included in the room rate.  I apologize that I was unable to speak with you in person. Please do not hesitate to contact me at the property if you would like to discuss further. Thank you again for your feedback.   "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This location is centrally located within walking distance to many restaurants and Disney Parks. Our room was a one bedroom suit and was perfect for my daughter, granddaughter and I. The room was contemporary and had kid friendly furniture ( I wasn’t a fan of ) that could be easily wiped off which is a plus with a 3 year old. The breakfast was very good and plentiful considering the amount of guest that were there. There is a parking garage next door for the hotel however you have to pay to park which will be added to the bill. They also have a laundry room with several washer and dryers along with a Bar downstairs and one next to the pool area that includes a small splash pad. They also offer kid movies every night. I would stay here again if traveling with small kids

Summary Heading: Fabulous Base Camp for Disney Parks
Summary: Great location for a base camp for the Disney parks (Disneyland and California Adventure Park). Only about half a mile from the entrance, so easy walk. Rooms are very nice, pretty quiet, modern, well equipped. (New as of August 2016). Interior doors and drawers are auto quiet close, but the main entry doors are a little noisy when they are closed. Every room has a kitchen (including a dishwasher) AND the hotel will do grocery shopping for you! They have a small shop near the front desk for a few items. The breakfast is excellent. Scrambled eggs, potatoes, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, hot oatmeal with all the fixings, fresh "make them yourself" waffels, juices, coffee/tea, toast, pastries, tortillas with various fixings, bacon or other meats and probably some stuff I am missing.

I took my family for a Disney holiday. The hotel is in a great location just minutes from the park. The rooms were very nice with a good size kitchen...great for families with kids. The outside pool and kid spray park was incredible after a hot day at Disneyland. We all had a fantastic breakfast each morning to start each day. I would definitely stay here again. My wife and kids were thanking me for booking there!

Stayed here for anniversary trip to Disneyland. This hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk depending on your pace to Disneyland/California Adventure main gates. The city provides a shuttle for 5.00 to the resort but with traffic most people we noticed walk. The views from the room was nice and the room itself was modern clean and a fantastic size. The staff at this hotel re FANTASTIC, with a friendly professional approach that is lacking at the competition. Breakfast is busy but the hotel manages well with large assortments and availbailites of fresh items. There is a bar in the lobby and a small snack drink convent store type area near the front desk (as with most Marriott). Inside you will find a Pizza hut that is super easy with available room billing. Worth the price.

Great place to stay if you are Disney bound with children! Breakfast is excellent, great variety. Caters to families, but I saw business people also. Close to CVS and lots of eating places you can walk to. The staff very helpful with towels and cleaning. Ice machines in the refrigerator, no need to go out of room. The kitchens contain stovetop and micro wave , no ovens.

The rooms are new the facility is clean but the customer service and it's staff are horrible.   It's taken me a while to write this review and mostly because I wanted to calm down as much as possible. our family was celebrating the birth of my second child we were celebrating the end of an extremely long and difficult journey and we had chosen this place to finally let loose and relax a bit. My son had been in the NICU for 100 days and off oxygen for three days we had a huge reason to celebrate the journey that was coming to an end had been exhausting and very stressful. We checked in July 3, 2017 and checked out July 5, 2017 only the first 12 hours of our stay more pleasant other than that it was mistake after mistake after mistake! On July 4 we woke up bright and early to get
Manager Response: Dear Laura P,  Thank you for your time in providing us feedback on your most recent stay.   I am sorry to read that your stay with us was less than subpar. I would like to be able to discuss the items in your review. At your convenience please contact me at the property, as I would like to speak with you personally.  Thank you and I look forward to hearing from you.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We booked 2 nights in a 2-queen room with points.  Upon checking in, the front deck agent stated they had upgraded us to the executive suite, which is 2 bedrooms (1 king + 2 queens).  This was perfect for our family of 5.  I have stayed in many Residence Inns; this one was nicer and more modern than any other I have experienced in the past.  Breakfast was better than expected for a free breakfast.  Overall excellent experience!  As a side note, we stayed "on the grounds" at the Disneyland Hotel 1.5 years ago, which was also very nice, but due to the room size and free breakfast we will be staying at the Residence Inn in the future.

The hotel is really beautiful and conveniently located near the parks.  We were able to easily walk to the parks and downtown Disney.  The hotel gym was pretty empty each time we visited which was awesome!  No fighting for the treadmill. The breakfast wasn't that good in my opinion but it is fine if you need to feed the masses.  There is Pizza Hut in the hotel and they deliver to your room if you are too tired to leave the hotel for food.  They also have movies at the pool and drinks at the pool if that is your thing. I would definitely recommend and stay again.

Great location.  Friendly staff.  Included breakfast is a bonus but the choice was a bit sketchy.  Room was clean and comfortable with all you could need. Sadly our room looked out onto the parking structure and the bright lights shone into our room at night.   10 minute walk to Disneyland and front desk staff helped us get tickets.   Lots of places to eat at within walking distance and a handy CVS on the corner.   Coffee shop across the road a lifesaver! This is a new hotel and there and the finishing is a bit rough - light above the shower not secured properly,   water pressure just a dribble and the pool needing to close for repairs the week we were there was a bit annoying but the positives far outweigh the negatives.

Summary Heading: Bumpy Check-In But They Made It Right
Summary: Anybody can look good and get five stars when everything goes right but the best way to judge a company is based on what they do when something goes wrong.  We had a late check-in, arriving after midnight to find out our prepaid room had been given to somebody else. I never knew hotels overbooked like Airlines or I would have called ahead.  When I arrived, the front desk informed me that they had no rooms left but they would get me into the hotel next door right away (I didn't have to ask - they already had a solution). Within 10 minutes of my arrival at Residence Inn, I was already in my hotel room across the street and Residence Inn covered all the fees (I still needed to give my credit card for incidentals).  The next morning, I checked into Residence Inn and Kimberly, the

Great location for Disneyland, walking distance. New hotel which is clean throughout. Excellent fitness centre. Buffet breakfast was great. Easy, quick check-in but recommend you pull up car to front door first and get room keys before using car park. On the negative side, there are no in-room safes and the so called “king” sized bed in certainly shorter in length than a regular king sized no matter what the hotel marketing says.  I would recommend and also stay here again.

Upon arriving at the reception desk we waited and waited to be addressed by the available person. (There were no other customers around.)  She finally acknowledged us by replying: "Is there something you need?"  I replied I would like to check in. We had arrived at 3:30-check in is evidently strictly at 4 pm.  The young woman stated:  " We don't do early check ins." She informed us our room was not clean. At 4pm another young lady checked us in.  After giving us our room cards she stated: "If you feel the need to use the pool, come see me and I will direct you you across the street to two other hotels."  The front desk offered no further explanation. A posting in the elevator stated there was a serious problem with the pool and it had been shut down. The pool closure was
Manager Response: Dear Idahogirl77,  Thank you for taking a moment to share your recent experience at our hotel. As we strive to provide each and every guest with an unforgettable experience, I am truly sorry to hear that we were unable to exceed your expectations.   Please accept my apology for the fact that the staff was not as responsive or informative as they needed to be. You are absolutely correct in mentioning that simple verbiage could have resulted in better communication. Rest assured, I have followed up with the team to discuss how we can do better in the future.   Your feedback is very much appreciated.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Stayed for 6 nights in a one bedroom with a park view on the 7th floor.  You can't see much of the park, but you could see the fireworks at night, which was a nice treat.  The pool was a good size and the mini spray park was nice as well. Breakfast area is huge and offers a great selection.    Parking garage is a bit awkward getting into due to the angle of the entryway, but no real issues. I wish it was connected to the hotel.   The bar down in the lobby could have a better selection, but the bartender is super friendly.   Two disappointments. Shower stall instead of a tub.  The drawers for clothes are way to small and far too few.  We ended up just living out of the suitcases for the time we were there.

We booked the two bedroom suite which was modern and spacious. Only a ten minute walk to Disneyland. Great pool area with movie showing and free popcorn for the kids. Check in was extremely smooth. Breakfast was good. Would highly recommend and I would have no hesitation booking this suite again in the future.

Summary Heading: New modern Residence Inn / short walk to Disney
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights in a 1 bedroom suite - full kitchen, small living room separate from bedroom, large bathroom with shower.  Free breakfast with extensive selection of hot & cold items. Everything was clean and comfortable. Convenient to Disney Parks, about 10-15 minute walk.  We were upgraded at check in to a "Theme Park View" suite, but on the 5th floor there wasn't much of a view of anything except the back of California Adventure, although we could see some of the fireworks.  Maybe the 7th floor has great view...but I wouldn't pay extra $$$  Tip:  If you eat early you can avoid the crowd at breakfast  & at Disney too.

Summary Heading: 2 blocks from the Happiest Place on Earth!
Summary: Brand spanking new hotel only 2 long blocks away from the Happiest Place on Earth. You could tell that the hotel only opened a few weeks ago as it had that brand new car scent to it. Also, many finishing touches were being worked on by the staff throughout the day.  Check in was a breeze and we were in our room with our luggages in less than 10 minutes. Beds were hipnotizing! Yes, the beds are really that comfortable. Rooms were extremely spacious and modern. However, the hotel's housekeeping needs some work. When we arrived, the floors were sticky and the furniture/fixtures were a bit dusty. The carpet was also never vacuumed during our entire stay. Also, on one day, the housekeeper completely forgot to shut our door after she finished cleaning our room. We got back from a long

Enjoyed our stay here.  We stayed in a family room which was a good size with good sized beds.  There were two queen beds in the bedroom and a pull out couch in the lounge/kitchen area.  Kitchen was really large and very well equipped.  Fridge was huge!  Bathroom was a good size also and shower was great.   Room was clean and there were plenty of towels, etc.  We found our room to be very quiet and were not bothered at all by any noise from either the outside or within the hotel. We weren't that impressed with the breakfast options, however it was an adequate start to the day.   Easy walking distance to Disneyland and there's plenty of restaurants and a couple of stores in between. Pool was a good size and while busy in the evening there was still plenty of room for everyone.

I was here for the half weekend Marathon since we were up so early I thought it was very nice the hotel had a table with some healthy snacks on it for those of us who couldn't utilize the free breakfast. Once I got done with the run I went back showered and was able to still use the breakfast which was very good waffle machine fresh eggs fruits , they even had explanation of how to make yourself fancy iced coffee with flavorings . The hotel was clean rooms were large great walking distance to Disney my only complaint is the parking charge but it looks like all the hotels in the area are starting to do that

Stayed here for 9 nights, double queen 1 bed suite, includes kitchen, dishwasher and microwave.  All inclusive breakfast was a bonus plenty of hot / cold options, they also include paper plates and bowls so handy if you are on an early trip you can grab food on the go.     Housekeeping a good standard plenty of towels and face cloths spacious bathroom and bedroom.  Laundry, Gym and Pool area are also of good size standard.  Close to Disney, however a good 1.5 hrs on freeway to other LA attractions but you will enjoy your stay here, would recommend.

Summary Heading: Great location but some observations too
Summary: My husband and I spent three nights at the Residence Inn and for the most part, really liked it.  It was clean, it was convenient (we walked to Disneyland-- about a 15-20 minute walk), had drug stores nearby, and plenty of restaurants, too, of course.  The room itself was a good size-- with a full kitchen and living room area with modern furnishings.  The bedroom was a good sized room as well with full bath and a shower with minimal water power, but it got the job done.  The breakfast was really good-- a large room with plenty of tables and certainly plenty of hot and cold food.  No complaints there!  Parking fee of approximately $18 per day in a multi-storied garage next to the hotel.  You have in and out privileges which is nice.  We were glad that we could walk to Disney

The hotel is in a great location and the amenities are really good the free inclusive breakfast is also excellent.  The only down side to our visit is the fact there there are no safety deposit boxes in the rooms however there are some at reception but they are limited and getting one was an issue.  The staff in general were good however they do need a bit more training in customer relations they were helpful but won't go out of their way to provide that little bit extra which you come to expect in California.  The hotel is in a superb location and fitted with our plans very well, it is convenient for Disney but also for getting around to main tourist attractions in Los Angeles. I would be happy to recommend and would also return

I called the hotel almost two weeks prior just to see if I can check in early and to ask general questions, Charday answered the phone. It was our first trip to Disneyland for my daughter's 7th birthday so I must of asked ten questions but she was very polite and answered all of them. She asked why we were coming and I told her of my daughter's birthday and she asked for her name which surprised me because most hotel people are very transactional but she was very interested and genuine.At checkin we had a family suite with two queens and a kids room with bunkbeds when we walked in the kids room was decorated with Happy birthday streamers and balloons! There was a bag of varied items like stickers,books, and coloring books and a card from Charday wishing my daughter a happy

We stayed for one night to catch an Angel game and spend a day at Disneyland. This is one of the larger Residence Inns we have stayed at but it uses the standard formula. Breakfast is included and the usual self service with a large seating area. This one differs in that it has a bar in the expansive lobby and a Pizza Hut as well. We had a one bedroom suite that was clean with a modern decor. There was no bathtub and only a shower. This was a minor inconvenience with a 3 year old but we worked it out. Construction was occurring outside our room at the convention center but our child was up before they started so it was not an issue for us. It could have been a huge issue if we had wanted to sleep in so you may want to inquire at check in about your proximity to the construction.

Easy Book in-- we just drove in and booked in- Hotel is clean , neat and fresh, Room was very clean and Neat.  We did have some noise at 7 am  weekdays,   from building site next door, other than this hotel quiet. Pool very good- lots o kids- bit noisy- but fine.  Pool side bar service could be better- girl never served anyone- she could have come to guests and taken drink orders. Breakfast excellent- Noisy- so many kids, and you need to be there before 10- we thought it was 11am- and missed one day.  Bar in Lobby -very good- Barman very helpful with tourist info.   A good stay.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney, going anywhere else requires grappling with LA traffic!
Summary: Stayed in double Queen suite with partner and three sons. Hotel overall is very high quality room was big enough to accomodate us all and the kitchen is decently equipped for the sort of meals you are likely to prepare on holiday (no oven, but who's knocking up a thanksgiving dinner on your hols?!) and the breakfasts are very good. Nice pool although the poolside bars drinks prices are the usual obscene hotel levels. Very convenient for Disney (walk in 15 mins to the turnstiles) but for those wanting to visit Hollywood or Universal, you might want to consider a nearer hotel to avoid the I5 gridlock. Nonetheless, a very good hotel and recommended.

Summary Heading: Highest End Residence Inn I have ever stayed in...
Summary: Classy, clean and comfy.  Rooms are very modern, sized perfectly and great amenities....plugs even have USB ports all over the room to help with all my electronics.  Cleaning staff are kind and constantly cleaning even in the elevators.  Property is super close to theme parks but none of the hassle that comes from being too close.  Ample parking and the front desk staff are consistent, super nice and are on top of every situation.  Well worth the experience and coming from a Marriott for life guy it takes a lot to impress me.

Clean Hotel, big studios that was available even before time, excellent customer service. nice breakfast and very pleasant atmosphere in general and I think the room fare was reasonable. Close to Disney land and very close to I5 so entry and exit was always quick.  kudos to Katty, she helped me out multiple time during my stay and was super nice/polite.  If I have a feedback for the hotel, it will be to make the fast internet free by default, Internet is available everywhere so either add the cost to the room fare or just make it free, I was getting away using my unlimited mobile data plan and tethering to other devices.  My experience in general was great, I will be staying again for sure in the hotel :-)

This is a great mid-range hotel for a family holiday. Our room had 2 queen beds plus a separate room with a sofa bed and kitchen area. There was plenty of space for a family of 5. The beds were comfortable, room was very clean, plenty of toiletries and towels. Housekeeping were very efficient. The kitchen area seemed big for a hotel room but having a fridge and microwave came in very handy. The free breakfast was very good, kitchen staff very helpful with dietary advice and the whole area was kept very clean and tidy despite it being very busy. The pool and gym area on the 6th floor were very nice. The pool did get quite busy but not completely rammed like other hotels we have stayed at in Anaheim. They show films in the pool area of an evening. There is a large guest laundry.

Stayed here from 8/9-8/16. Excellent sized room great amenities and excellent location to Disneyland and convenient stores. By far the best perk is the complementary breakfast. Good variety every morning. Overall excellent stay would definitely satay again.

The walk to Disneyland is only about 10 minutes away (with 7 year old walking and 3 year old in a stroller).  There are plenty of restaurants close to the Residence Inn. The housekeeping is terrible. Upon arrival I found lots of hair on our bathroom floor, the bunk bed sheets looked slept in, the walls in the kids room appeared to have splashes of chocolate milk or dirt (not completely sure what it was), the kids bathroom mirror had toothpaste (or something) smeared towards the top, the carpets in any of our rooms did not appear to have been vacuumed. On day two we had asked the front desk for towels to be replaced as well as toiletries replenished, and instead of decaf coffee in our room, we had requested regular coffee. This never happened, we had to track down a house keeper
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member,  Thank you for taking the time to review your current stay with us.   As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your guestroom fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team in an effort to improve our service.   We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you again the next time you visit the Anaheim Resort Area.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Stayed here for 5 days during a disney and LA trip. The hotel is easily walkable to Disney (although not so much on the way back once your feet are hurting!).  The rooms and main beds are well sized and comfortable. The sofa bed - which we had to make use of - was less comfortable and squeaked quite badly.   The breakfast at the hotel is excellent and of good quality.  Parking is a challenge when the hotel is busy. On the first night we arrived around 11pm and when i moved the car into the garage at 11:30 was told it was full and to turn around inside and then go to reception. I got lucky and met someone just leaving. On checkout I complained that the '20 minute' parking area was filled with cars that had been there for at least 2 hours. I was told that this was because the

This was a very nice hotel and the walk to Disney was very convenient since we did not have a car. We had a bedroom with 2 queen beds. The bedroom and bathroom spaces were much smaller than I expected. The CVS and Pizza Hut were very convenient when tired and walking back from attractions. There are a lot of breakfast selections to choose from. The hot items are just warm, however. Despite being near Disney and being a family hotel, it was very quiet and we slept well.  Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. We checked in very early and they were able to hold our luggage and text us during lunch when our room was ready.   The only thing that kept me from rating this property excellent is the fact that housekeeping skipped us, and we had no signs out, and we were

I stayed here before the Bar Exam, and just needed a place to stay that was close to the testing center and had everything I needed to try to keep those two days as stress free as possible. The room is incredibly updated and had a full size fridge and dishwasher and a range and microwave which was extremely helpful in cooking meals so I didn't have to leave the hotel if I didn't want to. The breakfast buffet was good, with different offering each day. They also provide gluten free options if you ask. The fitness center was also great (updated equipment, large space). Overall, great stay and just what I needed.

Summary Heading: Our Stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort/Convention Center
Summary: Service was excellent. Room was a little compact, but cute. View was amazing! Pool area was awesome. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Second Marriott we've stayed at where it felt like an actual vacation.

Great location.  Clean rooms and bathroom. Breakfast included and many varieties for breakfast.  Had a wonderful stay.  Staff were also great.  Only thing I didn't like was the parking fees, which was $18 per day.  It's not bad but would be nice to be free with stay, just saying :)

Hotel was nice and clean, as well as all staff. Hotel is only 10 minute walk to Disney with a Cvs and Walgreens within a few feet.  Only negative thing I can say is that there were no ice machines on any floor. The only way you can get ice, is if you go ask for it. I found that a bit odd. Pizza Hut Express inside hotel was convenient.

I always read Trip Advisor reviews before booking hotels, so I thought I would actually become a member just to write this review. We booked the Anaheim Hilton for two days for our Disney trip and decided to come a day earlier. Our Hilton was booked, so we chose this hotel for the one day. This hotel has been updated, it was clean, modern, and we loved it. The kids went swimming when we checked in and they were setting up a movie and free popcorn for later when the sun went down. My husband and I didn't care for the beds/pillows, but its hard for us to find something as comfortable as our bed at home. We heard a noise once from the floor above us which woke us up, but only happened once. The a/c seemed to get cooler in the 'living room' more than the bedroom area.  The breakfast

Nothing to complaint about the room and cleanliness. Had a 1 bedroom suite with beautiful mini kitchen, full size fridge, a pull out couch in the living area, floor to ceiling window, and 2 TVs that could connect to Netflix. Buffet breakfast could use a little update on varieties. Check in counter could use more staffs and better accounting system. This is Disney town so expect lots of Children and adolescence, especially at the pool.

Summary Heading: Great location! easy walk to Disney.
Summary: Quick View:   Location is great for walking to Disney. Plenty of food within walking distance. Perfect place for families! Nicely upgraded.   Details:   I had a few extra days in LA and enough points for 3 nights at this hotel. My biggest worries were proximity to the front entrance of Disney and quality. I was worried about the quality because my points got me all 3 nights but at some of the other places such as Marriott proper, I could only get 1 night. Just pulling up and going through the front entrance you can see this place has been updated fairly recently. I'm not talking 5 star, white glove service, but I am talking modern, clean, bright and open.   Checking in all the staff was very friendly and able to answer questions about food and Disney. Plenty of elevators to get

Summary Heading: Nice comfortable hotel.  A bit disappointed of construction next door at 6am.
Summary: This property was actually very nice and clean. Room was clean, beds were comfortable and a nice little kitchen. A 5 minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Center where I needed to be for 3 days at a volleyball tournament.  I was very disappointed the first morning after being woken up by banging and clunking sounds.  Construction was going on, something to do with the Convention Center.  Although this was not the hotels fault, I felt I should have been warned when I was given a room on the side of the construction.

This hotel was fantastic stem to stern.  Well located and a short walk to Disney.  We really enjoyed our suite, which was open and roomy.   Attentive service and a VERY nice breakfast bar, with lots of options and choices that satisfied both the meat lovers and vegans in our family.  Our children enjoyed the in hotel room delivery from the Pizza Hut located downstairs as well.    Service was excellent across the board.  Particularly enjoyed a very cheerful lady named Edith who worked at the breakfast bar.  She was most pleasant and cheerful when we saw her each morning busily cleaning/clearing tables and helping out guests.    Would definitely stay at this hotel again!

We stayed last week, room was comfortable, i booked a suite and had a great space for all of us, two tv with netflix, bathroom was good, and clean, overall was good, maybe we stayed in a busy time but they charge parking and the last day we couldnt find a place where to park! So we had to park in a CVS space, and at check out we complaint about that charge and also we had a 20 usd charge in food when we didnt do it, the manager fix everything son we couldnt be charged (food, park) from things we didnt spent but they cannot track who made that charges in restaurants/bars... breakfast was included and delicious! Waffles made our morning! Staff is kind!

The Residence Inn at Anaheim Convention center offers a great location between the Convention center and Disneyland. Both are about 10 minute walk. The ART bus offers service to Disneyland at cost of 5.50 per day - round trip - which is a convenience after long day at parks. You can even purchase the tickets for ART at front desk. The rooms include full kitchen were nice and modernly styled. The rooms has flatware, plates, glasses as well.  The service at the front desk was altogether okay, but we were of the opinion that the room service was very weak. We stayed for 8 nights and were skipped by housekeeping twice. Breakfast in the hotel is inclusive but it gets crowded after 8AM. The breakfast has several food options and staff tried to keep food refilled but we did have to

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Very Poor Service. Be cautious of house keeping too
Summary: My family and I stayed 5 days\4nights at this location. Piss poor customer service started when we checked in Sunday afternoon. Giovanny (supervisor according to his badge), didn't even welcome us to the hotel. After confirming our reservation and our silver member status, we were told that the only room available was on the 5th floor, although I requested the top floor. A family who checked in after us heard my conversation with Giovanny and said they got a top floor and didn't ask for it after we checked in.  Monday night, we arrived back at the hotel around midnight after returning from Disneyland, my daughter noticed her pocket mirror (we bought in Vegas) was missing from the drawer. She purposely left it in there next to the bible and Book of Mormon. We thoroughly checked
Manager Response: Dear Gunnychuck,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  I am very sorry for the troubles that you encountered during your visit.    Please accept my apology for the fact that the staff was not as friendly or as responsive as they needed to be.  I have followed up with the team members you have mentioned by name to discuss how we can do better in the future.  As far as room locations are concerned, we have 3 categories of views/locations in the hotel - standard, high floor/city view and theme park/Disney.  From what I can see on your reservation, you reserved a standard view/location room.  I also see that you requested a high floor.  Unfortunately, high floor/premium views are in high demand, especially in the peak summer travel season.  We do everything in our power to accommodate requests, but the premium locations do tend to sell out quickly this time of year so it is best to reserve them in advance.  While we were not able to place you on the 9th floor, I am pleased to see that we at least were able to find you a room on a mid level (5th floor) as opposed to a ground level room.    I am sorry to hear about your daughter's mirror.  While it's whereabouts remain a mystery, I would be happy to research this further should you have any additional specific details to provide that could give us an indication as to where it might be.  As mentioned above, I have spoken to the team about ensuring that they should the right amount of friendliness and concern in situations such as this one.  Finally, please accept my apology about the tough time you had with parking.  Please be assured that the number of parking spaces at the hotel actually exceeds the minimum standard required for our size property.  We have, on occasion, had some days where an unusually high percentage of guests choose to drive to the hotel.  This does occasional present a challenge for us and we are currently discussing ways to remedy this in the future.

Summary Heading: Modern Suite Hotel with room for improvement
Summary: For price reasons we had booked the family suite with a kids room. Our daughter is 17 and the room has no door to the kitchen and living room, which makes it loud, but a bathroom. We switched off the fridge at night. We would now book a two room suite. The hotel is new and hardly any wear and tare is to be seen. The rooms incl. the kitchen were nice and modernly styled. The service at the front desk was altogether okay, but we were of the opinion that the room service was very week. For example the mirror in the bathroom was not cleaned although stained. This really needs to be attended. The location is perfect as you can walk to Disneyland. There are two pharmacies nearby, CVS very close, which has all necessary belongings for the suite like milk, butter, toast, sandwiches,

Very good breakfast. Many kids/families but very well organized area. Nice staff.  Location is nice. It's a little hard to find a parking slot. Room was clean. Everything was nice. We were happy when we stayed here specially my son.

We rented two rooms and although they were nice; finding blood on the sheets right as we walked in was disgusting. We were told housekeeping was not avail at 10pm so     luckily we had brought extra blankets for the kids so we just tore off the sheets and slept with blankets.  Paid for parking for two cars. Security tells us parking is full and to literally "go away". Finally some employees came to move their cars so we can park after other guests complained to.   We tried to check out after our first night and get refunded for the second night but was told by front desk that they couldn't do it because of a little blood and no parking. My cousin's who paid for the rooms didn't have enough money to pay for another hotel although I offered and they stayed here as I went to a
Manager Response: Dear may0529,  Thank you for your feedback. I would like to begin by apologizing for the issues you experienced during your stay. Rest assured I have made the proper departments aware of your feedback in hopes to better improve our service. As a hotel that prides ourselves in customer service, it is our duty to ensure that of all our team members.  Thank you again and we hope to see you in the future.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Our family of 12 stayed in three rooms. The rooms are small -- only full beds in double rooms, but there is a sleeper sofa.  Because we were rarely in the room, this wasn't much of a problem for us.  The living and kitchen area are larger than the bedroom.  The morning breakfast is delicious and well presented.  I am gluten free and there were many options. The pool area is beautiful. The children really enjoyed it. The only downside is that the hotel front desk staff wasn't well informed about getting around in the area.  One night we were given shuttle times but by the next morning there was no shuttle. We asked directions to the Disneyland entrance and were given the long way around - 40 minutes as opposed to 10!!

This hotel is perfectly located to Disneyland and Disney Adventure!  They cater to families and the staff were seriously the most helpful, friendly people to deal with!  They offered assistance at any time we needed and gave my kids little gifts when we arrived.  They had wonderful suggestions of how to get around Anaheim and the hotel room itself was AMAZING!!  When we go back to Disney again in a couple years, this will definitely be the hotel we stay in!  Hands down, the best hotel experience I've ever had!

Summary Heading: Superb Hotel for Families Excellent Location
Summary: Our family of 6 enjoyed our stay at this NEW modern Residence Inn: the best Residence Inn we have ever stayed at.   The staff greets you every time you enter. You feel secure. CVS is walking distance. It has ice cream, IHOP, restaurants within walking distance. It's Anaheim, so evenings are pleasant.   Breakfast on weekdays ends at 9:30 but don't panic. It's stretched a little to accommodate everyone. The variety is superb.   The rooms are so clean. The kitchen is large. The bathrooms are spotless and mold free (our pet peeve).   If you have a large family, go for the 2 bedroom, 2 bath- it's pricey but convenient.   I hope Marriott remodels or makes all their future Residence Inns like this. We went over on our check out time, but all we got was a smile as we left. Nice.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disney.
Summary: Booked a suite with 2 queens and a sofa bed and had plenty of room for 3 adults and 3 children. The rooms were clean and spacious. They also kept the towels and supplies stocked everyday. The kitchen area was nice even though we did not cook. It was nice having an area to eat when ordered pizza or to put stuff on the counter. Also tons of outlets/USB for charging devices. The breakfast had plenty of options and plenty of tables. The pool area had a pool, hot tub and splash pad so something for everyone plus lounge chairs and furniture.

Summary Heading: Comfy beds, great breakfast and walking distance to Disney
Summary: Overall, the hotel was in good condition.  Just a word of warning on the 6F rooms since one set of them lead to the gym, pool and washing machines so heavy traffic and noisy hallways.  Not much of a view on that side of the hotel as you stare at a concrete wall.  But overall, if was very well located and the rooms were fresh and new.  Breakfast had good selection and great way to fuel up before a full day at Disney.

Attended a convention in June and stayed at the Residence Inn as we brought our two teen sons and wanted a separate bedroom.  Facility is new, beds were comfortable, room and bathroom clean.  Great location for either the Convention Center or Disneyland.  Favorite thing was the rooftop pool (6th floor level), with large hot tub, and availability to purchase drinks--although sadly the pool didn't open until 8, and closed by 10 pm, which felt confining.  Disappointed that the only bathroom was inside the bedroom, as it meant the boys woke us up coming to use it in the night.  The large hot buffet breakfast was well stocked--but get there early, or it's crazy busy!  I had boxes mailed to me, and the staff were very accommodating. 2 computers in the lobby area worked great, and a

Summary Heading: If you like feeling like a number... but in a well located hotel
Summary: Very mixed feelings about our 7 night stay in this hotel.   First, checkin was easy, but we were offered a room on the ground floor facing the convention center next door, which is currently being constructed. We asked if it would be an issue, of course we were told they didn't know. Next morning, Saturday at 5:45, trucks, lifts and hammers woke us up...  Second, housekeeping is horrible. They are only available from 9-5 we were told. They forgot to make up our room on 2 separate days (in the first 3). So we took a habit of calling every morning to make sure we'd get service. We finally managed to change to a room in the inner courtyard (to get away from the construction noise) and when we came in, the bed was 'done', however, the pillows were totally gross, as in not cleaned in

Summary Heading: Dog friendly but watch out for crowds
Summary: The good news is this hotel allows dogs. Nothing fancy or special for dogs but at least there's a small grass lawn across the parking lot for potty breaks.  We went on a holiday weekend and the crowds were overwhelming during the complimentary breakfast. People filled all the tables and seats in the dining area, lobby and bar (which is closed in the a.m.). The food couldn't be put out fast enough and the tables couldn't be cleared fast enough.
Manager Response: Dear EditorCJP,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to read that you were able to enjoy your vacation with your dog. As you mentioned, we do have an area for pets to be able to run around and play, the location is also equipped with doggie bags.   You are correct in mentioning that our property can get quite busy due to our proximity to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. Our team pushes to deliver the up most service, even during the busiest times.  We hope to see you again soon.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We arrived on June 30th in the evening and our check in experience was good, even though they didn't have a bell man to help with luggage and no carts the front desk lady was nice enough to offer one of the housekeepers to go look for a cart on the floors for us, however the check out agents on June 2nd (I believe his name was robin, and another girl working the front desk) not definitely need some customer service training, not only do they not know how to smile, but when I asked for a 30 minutes later check out, due to me being sick and throwing up, and not being able to get the kid ready and pack on time, they denied it and told me i would get charged if so. Most definitely will not come back to this place.
Manager Response: Dear Mirela L,  Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear that your check-out experience was not as pleasant as your check-in experience. As we pride ourselves in our service, it is apparent that we have fallen short. Your feedback has been addressed with our team.  We hope that you will visit us on your next trip to the Anaheim Resort area.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a youth convention. The location is a short (.4 mile) walk from the Disneyland park and about the same distance to the convention centre. This hotel offers free breakfast, which is a huge bonus compared to searching for another meal.  We also loved our room and the facilities. A kitchen is included in the two room suite as well as two TVs. If you have a larger family, there would be plenty of sofa space (besides the two double beds) for two younger kids. Finally, although there were not Keurigs in the room, the hotel coffee was bearable.  The teens I sponsored enjoyed the lap pool and hot tub. This hotel also has a splash pad for littles. Finally, there are multiple washing machines available for your needs. If you are staying in the area, I highly

We enjoyed our stay!  The hotel is beautiful and modern.  We had a queen suite, which was an excellent value.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Parking was convenient.  You can't beat the location - walking distance to the Convention Center,  Disneyland, and many great restaurants.  We appreciated having a kitchenette with a full size fridge, microwave, and mini dishwasher.  Highly recommend!

We loved this hotel! We had a room on the sixth floor right near the laundry, pool and gym. There was a kitchen, lounge room with large sofa and TV and another large TV in the bedroom.  Bedroom had two queen size beds. Perfect place for our family of two adults and two teenage kids. Ten minute easy walk to Disneyland. Stopped at CVS every night for snacks, supplies etc. Beautiful clean and modern hotel. We bought our own breakfast supplies even though it is included. It is extremely busy in the breakfast room in the mornings and it finishes at 9.30am. Being at Disneyland everyday until 10 we slept in every morning. There is hotel parking if you have a car for about US$18 per day. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

My family and i stayed in this hotel for our annual vacation. Since the time we checked in, we had a Great experience. The front desk agents are very friendly and helped us have a great time. Complimentary breakfast was good. The hotel is close to Disney, which made it easier for us. Great hotel overall. Will stay here again!

Loved this hotel!  It was on the newer side but everything here was great.  The hot breakfast was perfect & just as good as an all you can eat buffet.  There was lots to choose from and was a great start for a day at Disneyland.  The only downside of breakfast would be all the lazy people that would leave their mess for the dining room workers to clean up after them without leaving any tip.  Our room was a thumbs up & we even had a view of the California Adventure Park.  The pool a treat for the kids and my husband enjoyed the larger size gym.  The parking structure wasn't as close as I would've liked and parking was $20/day.

We choose this lovely hotel because of its proximty to Disneyland. Their rooms are large and can accomacte a big family. Its a new hotel and a built around 2016. There are lot of options for the buffet breakfast. Their staff are all accomodating. The hotel is nearby coffeshop and pharmacy. We will definitely come back here

From the moment we stepped foot in this hotel everything was pleasant, we were greeted with bright beautiful smiles from every person. Being that we had arrived early and wanted an earlier check in we also knew it was based on availability. There were no rooms available at that time but the young lady took down our information and let us know we would be contacted as soon as the room was ready for check in. Keesha which is the front desk supervisor called us to let us know our room was ready, no rush to come back but to simply say your welcome back at any time. When finally meeting her she told us to call her if we needed anything and also her days off, but did assure us any of the staff would be more than happy to help us.  Geovanny also provided his helping hand when we needed

I cannot talk about this hotel enough!!!!  The breakfast is amazing!! make sure to get there early! Everyday it was a little different so you always had plenty of options The walk to Disneyland is only 15 minutes or so which was amazing! close and simple. We flew in from Kansas and called the hotel and they were able to set me up with pick up and drop off. they even accommodated my two year old with a clean and nice car seat! Thanks Roshan!!!! when we arrived we were able to check in bags since the room wasn't ready but when we did check in, they even got us a room overlooking the pool and the kids loved it. the pool has not only a giant Jacuzzi but a Splash pad for the kids. They even had a little bar up there you can charge to the room.  our stay was amazing. The staff was

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland destination at reasonable price
Summary: I stayed in one of the suites at this hotel with my family of five just few weeks ago and h l have to say this is about the best place for your bucks! It is only a short walk from the Disneyland main entrance with tons of places to eat  nearby. The rooms are very spacious and clean (we stayed in a double queen suite) that accommodates very comfortably my fairly tall family. The gym and the rooftop pool are very well equipped and super clean. The breakfast is plentiful and the staff very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay here again!

The hotel was nice and room was great with only 1 problem.  On checking out they tried to charge me $100 more than what was on my confirmation.  When I questioned them they did change it after speaking with a manager.  Still it was a pretty cheesy move for an otherwise nice hotel.  Breakfast was great and I would stay again, just be diligent and check your final bill!

I stayed here with my son for a Disneyland trip. The room was clean, modern, and very well appointed. The kitchen in the suite was perfect for snacks and evening eats. The breakfast buffet served by the hotel was unbelievably good. The entry to Disneyland was a short 10 minute walk. The nearby CVS pharmacy was also super handy.   We booked through Get Away Today so the parking garage fee was reduced to $9/day.  We stay in a ton of hotels and this one was just great. We'll be back for sure.

Thank you to my favorite Disney character Ariel for helping me with the reservations to modify it for our needs.  Keesha for definitely providing much needed information when we checked in so we're not lost, plus notified us about the events happening locally.  The lady with the dark blue/purple hair (I forgot her name), but helped with a big change needed and CVS, good to know.  Katty for coming into my room to fix the AC in the middle of the night after being gone the whole day and coming back to the room being warm.  Throughout the night, the AC did not cool down on my last night of stay, but we appreciate the effort of her coming through.  Housekeepers on the 8th floor for having my privacy as requested.  They kept a smile on their faces and very well greeted us and helped

Staff was beyond amazing! Will definitely recommend, breakfast was amazing as well. No other place i will stay when visiting anaheim. Family and busniess friendly environment that accommodates every genre.

Summary Heading: Great Location, smaller than expected room size, new and pricey
Summary: This is brand new property with an excellent location just a few blocks from the Disney entrance, within walking distance but the bus stops are close and so are CVS and Walgreens.  I stayed in a one bedroom king and my son and his 2 boys had the 2 queen suite.  Both units were outfitted with a full kitchen, living area, bedroom and bathroom with a large shower. Everything is shiny new and the hotel is rather expensive.  The TVs have Netflix--yay! The fridge is full size but the dishwasher is half size. The rooms are nicely appointed but several things bugged me. First, the TV is flat against the wall and doesn't swivel at all; great if you are sitting on the couch, but with no desk in the room I used the counter/table as a desk so I was sitting at an angle and I had to shut the

Very new and attractive property. Nice pool area. Nice selection for breakfast. There is construction going on next door that starts early and is audible in the room. We were getting up early for Disneyland anyway, but may bother people who want to sleep in. 15 minute walk to Disneyland. CVS and Walgreens nearby. Pizza hut on property and coffee bean in adjacent hotel.

The location was very accessible and very clean.  The interior appeared to be very updated.  The breakfast was pretty healthy for a Buffett.  The location was within walking distance of the parks.  The parking garage is adjacent and would be nice if there was access not requiring you to go outside.

Very clean.  Nice rooms.  Delicious breakfast.  Friendly staff.  Great location.  The only thing I didn't like was their $18 per day charge for parking.  By paying almost $200 per night, Parkin for guests should be complementary.

From the moment of check in to checking out was a great experience. This brand new hotel, just built in August 2016 has everything you need. Everyone so welcoming and friendly. Rooms large and bright and kitchen is a plus! Great for families traveling with kids. The roof top pool area has a wonderful hot tub and a small water are park area for little ones. If I could have one thing to make it perfect it would be a hotel shuttle. It's not a far walk, 15 minutes, but after walking Disneyland all day/night a shuttle would be sooo nice. I highly recommend this hotel.

The staff was VERY accommodating and professional throughout our stay.   My granddaughters loved it here. The hotel was beautiful and modern throughout.  It is definitely a spot for families.   The breakfast choices are very good although it is a little chaotic at times with the  number of families heading off to Disneyland.   The parking lot does fill up in the late afternoon/evening and I had to wait for someone to leave before I was able to enter the garage. The walk to DL was a little much for the 5 year old so we took ART back.  The ART system was very easy to use.

Summary Heading: Our whole family agreed-----it was Top Notch, The Best!
Summary: We had a large group of us (6 family members) stay for four nights at in the Suite. Our room was able to allow for ample space. We loved how the suite can close off two areas (Bedroom and Living Room) for privacy...perfect for a large group. There was also a fully stocked Kitchen!! Our room was able to accommodate 6 guests, which is hard to find in nearby area. The hotel is newer, fresh, modern feel, and very clean and updated. The front desk, housekeeping and entire staff were super friendly and always willing to help right away. We enjoyed that we were able to purchase Disney Tickets at the front Desk, and even better, just a short 10 minute walk to the Disney Park gates. But perhaps the real bonus for our family was the delicious breakfast buffet available each morning! The

This is a really great place to spend with family or friends, great location, great staff, in overall, best to ever been so far. I will gladly recommend this hotel to everyone if you really want to have a great experience.

We have stayed in multiple hotels in Anaheim since we visit the area for pleasure and business about 2 or 3 times per year.  This is the fist time we stay at this Residence Inn.  It is the BEST in the area by far. It is modern, clean, spacious, service is excellent.   We had a 2 room suite which had a room for the kids with fun colors and bunk beds and a room for the parents. It was just fantastic!  The decoration, furniture and layout is just perfect!   Our son loved it!   We will definitely be back.  This is now our favorite hotel in Anaheim by far.  The swimming pool area is a lot of fun for grown ups and kids.  It is walking distance from the Convention Center and Disneyland.   Great hotel!!

Summary Heading: Great stay, breakfast, pool, walk to Disney all good
Summary: Room:  Kitchen and separate living area, great for putting kids to bed, shower and no tub is a bit of a minus. Internet TV meant we could watch netflix and there was a pizza hut onsite that delivered to the room within 15 mins. Couch was a strange leather/fake leather and not too comfortable.  Pool: Better than expected, little bar up there selling drinks, big hot tub and splash pad. Someone had a dog out there which was weird though.    Breakfast: Fantastic, waffles, eggs, bagels, bacon, etc Can't complain, we were early though so there was always lots of seating and food available.  Location:  10 min walk to the park, easier than a shuttle, but still a bit of a hike. Certainly worth it if you are comparing to the the old hotels directly across the street from the park

This hotel is beautiful, modern and new.  We had a great experience at check in, the young lady was very helpful and accommodating.  The rooms and bathrooms are very large.  The soft closing doors inside are a nice touch.  My only complaint of this property is the housekeeping.  The main areas seem to be fine, but the doors, handles and light switches were for lack of a better word...gross.  There was everything from just smudges to actual food, and in the bathroom what appeared to be splattered make up on the door. The elevator buttons had not been cleaned or touched in the 3 days we were there. I realize with being suites designed for families they will get some wear, but it does not feel clean when you see things like this. We have stayed at many residence inn's and usually

Summary Heading: Did I just walk into IKEA??
Summary: IKEA inspired everything in this hotel, it's like I just walked into an IKEA show room. We got a corner king room "facing" the park. Facing in quotes because it doesn't matter that you are facing the park if you are not on the higher floors, otherwise all you see is the back walls of Disneyland and hear the busy street below. The front desk could have cared less and were  totally unhelpful. As far as the room goes, the architect was high on something. Tiny bedroom with a tiny space that was supposed to be a closet of some sorts yet the bathroom was huge.... this seemed a total waste of space. A partial wall divided the bedroom from the so called  sitting area that barely had enough room for  three people. To make things even better, the Einstein who designed this room stuck the
Manager Response: Dear Sheekar,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry that your stay with us did not meet up to your expectations. I have addressed your comments with the proper departments so that we can improve in the areas that can benefit our property.   We appreciate your feedback.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Normally I stay in a Residence Inn when traveling for business but this time we booked while taking the family to Disneyland. The hotel is a short walk for the Disney Park Entrance. There are also nearby restaurants (fast food, Downtown Disney, etc) and stores (CVS, 7-11, Walgreens).  Pros - location - staff - lobby bar - full kitchen  Cons  - parking fee $18 - no bowls

This is a great option to stay in Anaheim! Are like little loft apartments, great beds, very near Disney Parks, the complementary breakfast is delicious with different options for everybody.  Each room have kitchen so you can cook your own food if you want, and they have self loundry that is a good option when you are traveling for long!

Summary Heading: LOVELY PLACE TO STAY NEAR DISNEYLAND
Summary: This is a pretty new hotel.  Everything is pristine and rooms are spacious.  The service here is excellent.  Friendly staff and the best breakfast buffet with plenty of hot and cold choices of food.  This is a large hotel and while there were lots of people eating breakfast, there were plenty tables and chairs available. The walk to Disneyland took only about 10 minutes.  There were several nice restaurants to eat dinner that were a 5 minute walk.  The sitting area in our room had 2 ottomans which were greatly appreciated after standing and walking all day in Disneyland.  We would definitely stay there again when we return to Disneyland.

We stayed here for our Disney trip and were really impressed! Fantastic room, new, clean. Kitchen had everything we needed and more. The hotel offered free groceries delivery service so all we had to do was give the front desk our groceries list and they delivered the items the next day! The hotel is walking distance from DL, or one bus stop away if you are tired in the evening and don't want to walk. Free  breakfasts were fabulous. Definitely recommend this place for those visiting Anaheim!

It's rare that you can't fault a stay in any way - but I really can't.  The location is great, a 10 minute walk to the Disney parks, close to plenty of dining options and shopping.  My room was terrific. Big, clean, new, private and well appointed with everything I needed. My family of four had plenty of space and never felt cramped.  Even though the breakfast area was busy every morning, I was always able to get a table and get food without waiting.  Facilities are good too. A gym, pool and a laundry are really handy if you're staying any length of time.  I didn't interact with the staff too much, but when I did they were courteous and efficient.  I would happily stay here again.

Superb rooms, very spacious and well-kept. The kitchen is spacious, as well. Hotel looks brand new and is kept very clean. Beds are super comfortable.   Breakfast is amazing, just get there on time as it is always packed. There is also a small Pizza Hut right beside the parking lot in case you have late-night craves.  Parking fee is about $20 dollars per night, which is the only inconvenience I found in this property.  Disney entrance is a 10-minute walk away. Convenience stores, pharmacies and restaurants are a very short walk away.

I stayed here with my 2 friends for the Tinkerbell 10k and half marathon.  The hotel was perfect -- good walking distance to Disneyland and the race, comfortable spacious room with kitchen.  I had read that the service was lacking, but we found all the staff more than happy to help and accommodate us.    Even though breakfast officially started at 7am, some breakfast items (bananas, coffee, bread/bagels, peanut butter) was available at 3am for the race participants which absolutely made our stay perfect.

Summary Heading: Does this hotel have an email address for enquiries?
Summary: Planning a trip from Australia in May 2018 and this hotel looks perfect for our family - 3 kids under 10 years of age.  Keen to book a family room for 14 nights and get some more information but I can't find an email address to contact the hotel.  Be grateful for any assistance.  Thanks!  Andrew, Adelaide Australia
Manager Response: Hi andrew0faustralia, you may contact us directly at sales@residenceanaheimresort.com and we will be happy to assist you.

Summary Heading: Best Residence Inn I've ever stayed at, hands down
Summary: I travel a lot for work and pleasure and have stayed at many Residence Inns. This by far was the best residence Inn if ever stayed in.  Why?  Richly appointed brand new rooms, clean clean clean, gorgeous lobby and breakfast area, HUGE breakfast selection, extremely plentiful and friendly staff, awesome location walking distance to Disney, restaurants, and stores. I just wish we could have stayed longer. We are now at a Hyatt in another Californian city and are longing for the Residence Inn!

Summary Heading: Yikes, the dishes, what's with the lights?!?
Summary: The room was upgraded because of our rewards status. We were forced to wait until 4 pm to check in, then told only 2 days would be an upgrade then to a one bedroom suite.  The room was magnificent with the layout that when my wife or I went to the bathroom, the light would be in our spouses eyes. Why wasn't the closet and bathroom switched to avoid waking others in the room??  Does Courtyard need a "regular" travelers input??  I volunteer to avoid the inconvenience to other travelers. Shame on the planners or engineers. Seems simple. The large ball glasses fit directly into the drain in the sink, oops, maybe why we were met with a sink full of filth. Apparently the cleaning crew couldn't remove the glass stuck in the drain.  The dishes were atrocious. I can only think the
Manager Response: Dear Brentsp,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issues that you experienced. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   We appreciate your time and hope to accommodate you back again in the future.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I had a 4 day conference at the Convention Center. I usually stay at the Marriott right at the Convention Center, but I tried booking too late. I reserved at the Residence Inn instead and what a wonderful place it was. Actually almost better because it didn't have the conference crowds all around. Easy walking distance to Convention Center and many local restaurants. Parked car in covered garage and only needed it once.  Breakfast was a full array of items and quite good. Everything tasted fresh.  The room was very spacious and had everything I needed (Except for a tub that I would have liked to have.) The outside pool and spa on the 6th floor was quiet since it was not on the ground floor. Unfortunately the gym was hot and stuffy so that was out. There was a maintenance issue

Perfect for Disney trip, great location. Easy access to park. 15 minute walk. Plenty of dining close by. Pizza Hut on site. Kids loved the pool & splash pad. Would stay here next time. Good value for money

The hotel was really clean, very modern, the perfect location. The service was spot on. We would stay here for a Disneyland trip any time in the future!  The beds were very comfortable. It was a quick walk to the main gate. Great family vacation here.

Just returned from a trip to Anaheim, where I was attending a trade show at the convention center.  I'm a fan of the Residence Inn chain, this hotel exceeded my expectations and may be one of the best I've stayed at.  My room was large and well kept, this includes the kitchen and bathroom.  Rooms and hallways were quiet.  The lobby was quite large, with a nice size bar area right off of it.  There was a large area for breakfast, it never felt crowded.  The breakfast buffet was standard for a Residence Inn, including both hot and cold options.  A coffee shop, Pizza Hut and CVS were just steps out the front door.  The location was fantastic, the convention center was a quick 10 minute walk and Disney was an easy 20 min walk.  Lots of food and shopping options, which made this a

I booked a less expensive hotel but when I walked in I was pleasantly surprised. Full kitchen, stove, full size refrigerator, dishwasher. Cabinets are fully stocked. Nice living room with leather couch, which converts to a double bed. Bed room 2 queen beds, bathroom spacious glas shower. All ultra modern. For the price it was absolutely perfect. Walking distance to Disney.

From the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. Geovanny was so professional and helpful assisting us with our check in, (we will be forever grateful to him as he went so above and beyond). The location was perfect as it was just a short walk to Disney. The room was perfect, tastefully decorated and lovely, and just as pictured on line. The buffet breakfast was amazing with a great assortment of hot and cold items to choose from, we loved getting up, having a full breakfast then heading straight to the parks. Now that we have found this amazing new hotel we will make it our choice for our yearly trips to Disney, can't wait to return......

I usually stay at the residence inn around the corner on Clementine so this was my first time here. I have mixed feelings about it. It's more of a hotel set up than most Residence Inns in that all rooms are inside and you have to take the elevator. The pluses are close to convention center, and, and pizza! I did miss walking around the grounds like the one on Clementine.  You could see the fireworks from there. Better price here though. Good breakfast. Definitely different vibe here...more sterile but it's ok. Lots of kids but pretty quiet. Parking 18.00 a day...boooo.

Summary Heading: Nice alternative to Disney main gate hotels
Summary: Spent two nights at this Residence Inn and enjoyed our stay.  The desk staff were very pleasant.  The woman on check in worked hard to put both our room on the same floor.  She was very helpful with suggestions.  The rooms were clean and nice.  It was an easy walk to Disneyland.  There is a small lobby bar which was a nice touch.  CVS is very close.

This hotel is new compared to the other hotels nearby. It is clean and room is spacious. Buffet breakfast has mediocre food. Don't expect too much. They have the staple food though. Bagels, bread, fruits, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, fruits, scrambled eggs, sausage, canadian bacon, fried potato, waffles, cereal. They offer free coffee all day,  super cold water and flavored water at the lobby.    Suite room has kitchenette, living room which has sofa bed and can sleep 3.  Just ask for extra toilet paper. Our room is good for 6 people and we only had one toilet paper and no spare in the bathroom. If somebody will sleep on the the sofa bed, ask for extra comforter. They have spare pillows and very thin sheets but no comforter. Beds are comfortable but pillows seems too fluffy.

This my first time in Anaheim, and we went to take our kid to Disneyland. This hotel was amazing, what was even better then the hotel was how incredibly helpful and nice the staff was. They definitely went out of their way to accommodate us any way they could. I wanted to use the gym at the hotel and when I went in the gym I noticed the weights were missing. I went and told front desk staff and he told me that they had issues with people taking weights to their room, so they temporarily removed them. So he called the hotel next door and told them to let me use their gym, that was very nice of them. That was just one example of how helpful they were.  We stayed in a 2 queen bedroom suite and we were a 5-10 minute drive to Disneyland. It was clean and had great view of the city.

Summary Heading: Good, once we got our rooms
Summary: I booked 3 rooms, 6 mo. ahead. My reservation said check in was 3:00, they did not honor that. Two year old was having a meltdown, needed nap. Staff changed, Amber was great, got us a room at 3:40. waited for other 2 rooms. Check out at 11:00, hard to believe no rooms clean before 4:00??? Once we got rooms, great stay, everyone very friendly, great breakfast, great pool area, wished we had more time to spend at the hotel, but Disneyland called, not a bad walk to park. We'll be back...and confirm check in time.

Summary Heading: Forget the rest. This is above and beyond the norm!
Summary: I have stayed at many hotels in the last 60 years and have never had a better experience. We are on the last few days of a week here with 6 of us including 4 grandchildren and have to say the service, staff, accomodations, amenities are the absolute finest. Front desk employees Alice aka Kathy and Matt were extremely informative and helpful with first rate advice to accomodate our special needs. The 6th floor rooftop pool, jacuzzi, play area, fire pits, excercise and laundry room were a big plus and as everything here were always immaculate and ready for use. The breakfast was gourmet all the way with hundreds of hot and cold scrumptious options including unique offerings that surprised us all. For any family on a budget looking for the very best value when visiting Disneyland,

The front desk staff was so very professional, after a long overseas trip they were able to accommodate all of our needs. With 4 kids in tow it was a blessing. Our room was everything it said it would be and roomy and comfortable, they had everything we needed, which made it great after a long day of theme parks visiting. The breakfast buffet was spot on, kids loved making their own waffles and enough topping to satisfy them. I highly, highly recommend staying here, especially with family, you have stores (CVS 24 hr) and eateries close by. We will definitely book this hotel for our next visit to Orange County. We had a room on the first floor so no waiting for elevator, still felt safe and comfortable. Loved this hotel.

This is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean and spacious. Full kitchens and a separate bedroom.   The location is within walking distance to the parks, Garden Walk, and convention area.  Most importantly, the best free breakfast in Anaheim!  Parking is a bit expensive, but this is definitely a hotel worth staying at.

Summary Heading: Nice and good hotel A/C not working
Summary: We spend a nighr on this hotel. Nice suites excellent ubication but the A/C was not working at all.  It includes a hot breakfast. A pharmacy is nearby and thats great. The rooms are new and clean. Everything wqs excellent except the AC
Manager Response: Dear xanda26,  Thank you for your review. We apologize that the A/C was not working properly. Please know that this issue has been brought to the attention of our maintenance team. We are happy to read that you enjoyed the rest of your stay despite the minor issues you experienced.  We hope to see you back soon.  "Suit" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Staff was awesome!  Everyone went out of their way.  Great customer service!
Summary: Stayed for five nights with eight students attending a conference.  Buffet breakfast in the morning offered a variety of items.  Pool area with fire places was fabulous for all of us.  The resort was able to handle the large amount of people staying there.  All of the staff were customer oriented.  I would stay here again.

Our experience so far has been phenomenal!  The staff at the front door are excellent. Our bartender Rebekha has been outstanding. And I believe her name is Tiffany;l, who seems to look after things at the front end is on top of everything.  The suites have been comfortable; really everything we needed. It's nice and close to Disneyland, and the pool area is awesome.

My family reserved two rooms for three nights.  One room had wonderful service.  My son-in-law and daughter had a room for their family of four which included two young children. While the facilities were terrific, not one housekeeping service was allotted to my daughter's room - for three days.  No one made up beds, changed out towels, emptied trash (including diapers) nor cleaned the bathroom.  Isn't this part of the service that a hotel provides?  If this was what my family wanted they would have gone camping.  No excuse here!
Manager Response: Dear CARallteacher,  Thank you for your review.  We appreciate you taking the write about your time here with us. With that said, I am sorry that you housekeeping did not service your room. You are absolutely correct in that housekeeping is part of service that a hotel provides, and we dropped the ball.  Please know that your comment have been shared with my housekeeping team. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to accommodate you again soon.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Truly perfect for family of 4 visiting Disneyland
Summary: Pleasant staff, helpful too. Convenient location. Plenty of self parking. Pet friendly. Nice and clean rooms. Easy walking distance to disneyland. Coffee store outside, pizza hut too. This was a goldmine of a find. Will use again...

Fantastic location 10min walk to Disneyland, and very close to Cheescake & Bubba Gump. Very comfortable rooms, clean and plenty of space we booked on the morning of our stay at last minute.  Called and they were very friendly, we booked a 1 bed suite with 2 x queen beds.  Very happy perfect for a family.  Kitchen has all you need and with CVS and Pizza hut on location makes it very handy.  We were also very appreciative of the hotel holding our bags all day for us as we had a late flight out and went to Disneyland.

The 6 of us stayed 7 night March 26 to February 5, 2017 in room 341.   Not used staying at such a nice fancy new hotel!  The photos provided by Marriot actually looked like the hotel property!  All the hotel guest walk to Disneyland but make sure you have a good stroller for the kids.  Because of the area, it was common to encounter some very strange characters high on drugs wondering the sidewalk even in front of the hotel.  All staff and guests were super friendly.  Our 1 bedroom room suite had a nice view of the front entrance.  Kitchen had full size fridge with handy ice maker.  2 burner stove but no oven.  There is a small dishwasher which I thought was silly but it turned out we actually used it every night!  Utensils, cookware and dishware included for simple meals.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Holiday
Summary: UK family of 4 staying in a deluxe queen suite.  Thought the hotel was well up with expectations.  The room was a decent size (sometimes photos can exaggerate the size) and big enough for 4.  6 sharing might be cramped with the sofa bed in operation.  The beds were really comfy, but the bedroom lacked drawer space.  The drawers were also very shallow, so we left a lot in our cases by the beds, which made our room look a bit messy.  The kitchen area was great and although we did little cooking, having a full size fridge (and freezer) made food prep, mainly sandwiches (for Disney and LA) easy, and somewhere to store large water and juice bottles.  The lounge area was spacious for 4 sat on the sofa, and tv had a good range of programmes, especially sports.  Plenty of plug sockets

Summary Heading: Brand new Hip and Trendy Property
Summary: Stayed here for three nights to do Disney. Reserved a family suite in advance. Used the Mobile check in feature on the APP, but front desk checked us in old school.
