As a Gold Member was hoping for a little love for an upgrade to a room with the fireworks view or larger suite but alas not to be. In fact was not even recognized as a rewards member at all, so that was a bit odd.  Room on the 7th floor was nice and what we had reserved. Very modern.  One room with two queens and the other with Bunk Beds. My 11 year old loved the bunk bed room, the 14 year old not so much as he barely fit on the bottom bunk....The Bunk Bed room was large with the largest bathroom with wasted space I've ever seen..It was really big, but just a ton of extra space. Had a tub in it so was great for a

We stayed at the SpringHill Suites March 29-31. We went to Disneyland and needed a place that could accommodate 2 adults and 4 kids. We also wanted a hotel close to Disney and within walking distance. It took us about 15 min to walk to Disneyland. Not bad but it can seem so far at the end of the day when you are exhausted.  We stayed in a room that had 2 queen beds, a mini kitchen and sofa bed. There were 2 Smart TV's in the room. One in the living/kitchen area and the other in the main room. The 2 rooms were separated by a double door. The room was great. We loved everything about it. It's spacious enough for all us, and the bathroom was big and beautiful. The only thing that was a little annoying is that the door to the bathroom also closes the closet in the room. Oh, and the

This is a brand new property that caters well.  Very large crowds for the breakfast and the hotel was prepared.  Very short walking distance to Disney parks...only a few blocks. Friendly staff, great roof top pool area and a contemporary decor. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Family vacation from Florida was made even better when greeted by Betty while checking in.  She was friendly, knowledgeable and patient with me and my family.  She took the time to educate me on the property and the local area.  Finally, she was able to go above and beyond in finding the right room for our stay.  Ask for Betty!!!

Summary Heading: Great family hotel near Disney and Convention Center
Summary: The entire experience was good from check-in to check-out.  The front desk staff was helpful and friendly.  Maybe not quite as well trained or professional as at a Marriott or Hilton, but still very good.  I brought my family with me on a work trip that happened to be the local spring break.  The hotel was jam packed with Disney-bound families.  Even with all the rooms full, housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean every day.  The room seemed a bit hot and stuffy, so I called the front desk for help.  The controller to the HVAC unit had an issue and a repair person was sent during a time that we requested - the repair person fixed the unit right away and was very friendly. The beds were comfortable and clean.  The hide-a-bed was very uncomfortable and made a ton of

Great and awesome clean spacious room is nice for family to stay great and tasty complimentary breakfast free coffee hot choxolate all day  its gonna be back here anytime  when we got to anahiem disneyland. Lot of stores arounds and restaurant

Loved this hotel! As our family grows we need a room that is more flexible for multiple adults and kids. Kid suite was perfect! Staff was very friendly! An amazing breakfast Buffett! Super quiet...felt like we were the only ones there! Best part...easy walk to Disneyland even with 2 in strollers and a 6 year old!

Summary Heading: Upgraded To Executive Suite With Ritz Card!
Summary: We booked a room with a Disneyland view, but resort staff informed us the room had maintenance issues. So, they decided to upgrade us to an EXECUTIVE SUITE. It was massive-- a huge living room, two bedrooms, three beds, two bathrooms. Great stay!

Beautiful new property with prime location at the convention center and across from Disneyland.  Impressive breakfast buffet-better than most concierge floor offerings at standard Marriotts. Kids suite was exactly what we needed and cute décor. Absolutely will be back; hoping it stays this nice after a few years.

This hotel looks like it is pretty new and it is shiny and clean.  Rooms were modern, spacious and functional. The breakfast area was huge and they needed the space. It was very busy but the staff did a good job of keeping it clean. I was given a room on the back of the hotel which is an alley between the hotel and convention center.  No problem, i'm not there for the view.  The problem is they are doing construction on the convention center and started jack hammering at 6:20am.  I also got a nice dose of a truck mounted power washer cleaning the sidewalk right outside the window at 10pm. The front desk said it was the city washing the sidewalk and out of their control. They would be done soon and nobody else is complaining about it.. Really? The city works at 10pm?  On an
Manager Response: Dear 107Wailea,  Thank you for taking the time to express your feedback during your most recent stay. I would like to apologize for the external noise issues that interrupted your stay.  As mentioned, many of the construction tasks that are taking place at the Anaheim Convention Center are out of our hands. However, we should have made it a point to assist you to the best of our abilities, and for that, we dropped the ball. I have brought your feedback to the attention of upper management so that we can better handle these challenges for the future.   "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed during our Sprimg break. This hotel is new and very modern and beautiful. It has a good breakfast buffet included as well as parking. The rooms are beautiful and spacious and very well equipped kitchen. Great to travel with kids. The pool is big and the spa too where more than one family can fit.
Manager Response: Dear Milichavar,  Thank you for your review. We are glad to read that you enjoyed your Spring Break with us.  See you back very soon!  "Suite' Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We have a bigger family and always look for rooms with more size or suites. This hotel did Not disappoint in room size, pool area and breakfast. They even have Pizza Hut on site that delivers to your room.
Manager Response: Dear us5forHim,  We are happy to read that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for mentioning our Pizza Hut Express, which you mentioned, delivers to the room for an easy dinner!  Thank you again and see you back the next time you are in the Anaheim area!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: New and clean, great for kids and walking distance to disneyland
Summary: Nice property... one of the better Residence Inn's.  About 10-15 min walk to Disneyland as promised.  Kids Suites are awesome... they have a 2nd bathroom and bunk beds, which made our stay very comfortable.  The pool area had a hot tub, swimming pool, as well as a splash playground for the kids.  Probably could see the fireworks from up there.  Highly recommended!
Manager Response: Dear ajoglekar,  Thank you for your informative review. I am pleased to read that you enjoyed our amenities on property.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We booked this room on Hotwire very last minute because my daughter needed medical attention after a performance at Disney. We were shocked when we walked into the room. The rate was very low for the area, but we wound up in one of their studio suites. It was so great to be in such a beautiful and comfortable room after such a stressful evening. We wound up needing assistance in our room in the middle of the night (1:00 AM) but the stag was friendly and quick to respond to our needs. The breakfast in the morning was great with a wide variety of options that included hot breakfast choices. You will pay for parking, but it was worth it to our family. Huge thank you to this hotel. We will be back!!!

We visited this hotel because it was close to Disney and didn't want to pay the outrageous price for on site Disney hotels.  The hotel was clean, well designed, and the staff was pleasant.  There is the standard breakfast included for Marriotts, and water and coffee was alway available.   There is an on-site Pizza Hut and CVS feet away.   It is a twenty minute walk to Disney.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and well designed.  Marriotts now have a great cable tv setup.  The TV was a smart TV with access to NetFlix and more.  The pool is on the 6th floor.  It was warm and had a huge hot tub.  At night there were gas fire pits that were very nice as it was cool at night.  If you don't have a view of the nightly fireworks across the street, you can get a great

I am completely in love with this hotel. This Residence Inn has a pool, large hot-tub, firepits, and child's splash area on the 6th floor rooftop and it was fantastic. Great views and relaxing furniture all around. The bar in the lobby made our drinks and we took them up there several times during our vacation. Our 4 kids ages 5-15 all loved this area.  We had a kids' suite and it was perfect for a family of 6. The only small complaint is no door on the kids's suite and it would have been nice (although the kids' bathroom does have one). The rooms are very spacious and modern, with a smaller kitchen area than your standard RI. Still has a full fridge, dishwasher and microwave, but only a cooktop and no oven. That wasn't an issue for us at all. Lots of charging stations and

Summary Heading: Canada, Belgium, and Upland CA Unite!
Summary: Rebecka is the best and she made great drinks. We had a great time at the resort and the breakfast was amazing! We met this lady named Kim and she's fabulous and she got a new position. Good things happen at Rebecka's bar!

Summary Heading: Nice inn for a family stay
Summary: A spacious room for a family. Nice breakfast buffet with all day long complimentary drinks. Close location to Disneyland. Worth the price for the Inn. Hotels staff are also nice to foreigners. Would stay there again if going to the Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay with room to move!
Summary: Loved this modern hotel.  Loved the full kitchen! There was room for my family of six to move around and the kitchen gave us room to prep our food for Disney.   The breakfast is amazing with different selections everyday.   Not a bad walk to Disney and CVS and Walgreen next door incase you forgot something.   The only thing I would ask for differently would be a shuttle to the parks, that would make this place perfection!

I was up graded from another hotel. What a great surprise.  I would stay here anytime they have everything in the rooms.  You can cook meals and sleep up to six people. Clean and new.  The staff is helpful. Okay fitness center and large pool.

Summary Heading: Mickey Mouse would love this place
Summary: Great location to Disney Land Park. New hotel with great accommodations and a wonderful staff. Rooftop pool is awesome along with a full breakfast bar. It's a 5-10 minute walk to Disney main entrance.

We stayed for 4 nights in a family bunk suite and were so impressed with this hotel. We usually stay at another Marriott property for Disney but decided to give this new hotel a try and were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived to when we checked out the staff (especially Giovanni and Betty at the front desk!) couldn't do enough for us. Always around, always smiling and greeting guests, felt like we were truly welcome. We had questions about our accessible suite which we had booked and the front desk supervisor personally showed us other room options and said they would do "anything they could to ensure we had what we needed".   The biggest perk of this hotel aside from the awesome suite was the amazing breakfast. Huge (huge!) dining area and everything you could want in

My family of 4 loved staying at this hotel.  Overall, it was an excellent value for a hotel that was in a good location, had large rooms, and included a free buffet breakfast.  Check-in - smooth and fast.  I have to say the front desk staff, while friendly and polite, seemed a little less friendly than the rest of the staff I encountered during my stay.  Can't put my finger on it - but I almost got a crabby or snobby vibe.  Rooms - we had a one bedroom, two queen room.  There was more than enough living and sleeping space for our family.  The two HUGE TVs in each room were wonderful!  Beds were firm, but comfy (the way I like 'em!). The full kitchen and eating area for four was a nice bonus. The only downside was that there was only a shower in the bathroom (no tub) but that was

Summary Heading: Perfect location near Disneyland.  We'll be back!!!
Summary: Arrived super early in the morning around 6am.  We were expecting to just drop off our luggage and have the hotel hold it as rooms normally aren't ready until the afternoon.  Coming off a red eye flight we were surprised, and very thankful, that a room was available when we arrived at 6am! We were able to settle in to the room, get a short nap, freshen up, and start our day at Disneyland.  LOVED that this hotel is only a short 10-15 minute walk to the main gate.  With a 3 year old, we stayed at the park until he got tired, around 2-3pm, would walk back to the hotel to take a short nap, and head back to the park again later in the evening.  The stay included breakfast, a great spread of waffles, breakfast meats, starches, cereal, fruits and drinks.  It was nice to go to the park

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel with a Great Location
Summary: I chose the hotel because I love Residence Inn. My next priority was that it was close enough to Downtown Disney for dinner. Since I was going with my daughter I wanted to make sure that we had a pool and breakfast so she could have something to do after competition and have a healthy meal before competing. This hotel was amazing! From the moment I walked in, I felt special - I was recognized as an elite member with my name on a frame at the front desk to welcome me. The hotel is beautiful and I love the updated look. The room we stayed in (family suite) was absolutely perfect. It was like a small apartment. We had a wonderful view of the rooftop pool. I would definitely choose to stay at this location again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you are in town for a few days
Summary: Great hotel for both families visiting Disneyland or convention attendees.  The rooms in the hotel are modern and spacious. We had a family room that had separate sections for adults and kids. Our kids enjoyed their own TV and bunks. There is no room service but there is a restaurant downstairs for breakfast thru to dinner and many take out / delivery options available with menu's provided by the hotel. Its a 10 min walk to Disneyland and 2 minute walk to the convention centre. A great choice if you are staying a couple days but it does not offer resort facilities like pools, spa's etc.  There is a small gym and laundry facilities.

Summary Heading: Excellent family hotel| Perfect for Disneyland
Summary: We have had a wonderful time at the Residence Inn. We are currently on our final night of our 3 night stay after a fun couple of very busy Disneyland days. Firstly, let me say this hotel is excellent, the rooms, amenities and the staff. We arrived a little earlier than check in time and we were pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready and waiting and check in was quick and easy and arranged with big smiles from the staff. This was very appreciated after a 14 hour flight from Australia. We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite which looks exactly like the website, new and bright and the kids loved the bunks and decor. My Son is 12 and easily fit into the bunks. All the beds were super comfortable and the pillows were great. The kitchen is new, clean and fully equipped with
Manager Response: Dear Jackie H,  Thank you for your review. I am delighted to read that you had a "wonderful time" at our property. It seems as you were able to enjoy just about all of our amenities on property such as the pool, the gym and our complimentary hot buffet breakfast.   We hope to see you again soon the next time you plan your return to the Anaheim Resort Area!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My family and I tend to stay at Residence Inns on every trip. This one was one of my favorites. I would definitely recommend it! The location was perfect because it was a short walking distance from here to Disneyland, and there are many restaurants and a cute cafe nearby. My large family stayed in the handicapped room, even though none of us are handicapped, because we needed the large room to fit our family. The staff was very friendly and the room service was rather quick. I loved the modern decor in the lobby and the comfortable atmosphere. The room was clean and extremely nice as well. It included a kitchenette, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a living room. Each morning, we were greeted with a free breakfast and room service. Such a wonderful experience!
Manager Response: Dear mormor127,  Thank you for your feedback. As an avid Residence Inn traveler, we really appreciate your kind words from your recent stay with us. I am pleased to read that all of our team members were kind and accommodating.   Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Yes, the bed was very comfortable. Yes, the room was clean. Any yes, the hotel was brand new and very nice. But, without good people working there those other things don't matter.  Every employee we spoke with was kind, courteous, respectful, and VERY accomodating!! I didn't catch the name of the first manager I spoke with when we needed to make a change but wow, so kind....not just in that moment but said hi and was kind every time we saw him afterwards. Keesha Velasco really helped us out when we had to check out early to beat a Nor'easter storm. Understanding and kind, that's why I will go back!!
Manager Response: Dear pretzelman,  Thank you so much for your feedback!  I am so proud to read that all of our staff was kind, courteous, respectful and "VERY" accommodating. Your review has also been shared with Keesha who was able to accommodate your early check out. Thank you again for your time in writing us your review.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: A wonderful stay at the Resdence Inn!
Summary: We've stayed in other Residence Inns before but this one was by far the best. It came recommended to us by a family member who had been here recently. The hotel is only about a year old I think and has a new clean and fresh look from other Residence Inns, very modern. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The breakfast buffet was awesome! That alone got my kids up early and running down to the eating area! There's nothing like a good breakfast before a long day at Disneyland and this one exceeded our expectations. The room was nice and comfortable with plenty of room for the five of us. And it was close enough to walk to the park, only about a 12 minute walk maybe. You can also by park tickets right at the front desk for the same price that you would at the park. And with
Manager Response: Dear Cory N,  I am so pleased to read such a great review! You are correct in that are hotel is just 5 months shy of a year open. We pride ourselves in consistently growing and developing our service for our guests.  We appreciate your time and hope to accommodate you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Highly Recommended - Close to Disney, SUPER close to Convention, & Sound Proof Rooms!
Summary: Prior to staying here, I read reviews here and on Yelp. Majority of the reviews were average at best however I still hoped for the best because the hotel's location best suited my needs and I'm a Marriott platinum member. UPDATE: Now that I'm leaving my review, I've seen the ratings on both sites go up. It really is a good stay and highly recommended!   Arrival: Easy. No wait, friendly front desk agents, and they gave me a comp upgrade as a platinum member and early check-in at 9:50am.   Room: Clean, comfortable beds, great water pressure and temp, and quiet. FYI, I stayed at the nearby Hyatt House on the same street in December, also with a Disney view for fireworks. When the fireworks went off when I was at Hyatt, the sound was startling - it was so LOUD it woke our 1 year old
Manager Response: Dear caliiitrav,  Wow! Thank you for such a wonderful review. I appreciate the breakdown of your journey to staying with us. Thank you also for providing information for our future guests. I would like to add that the hours for our breakfast are from 6:30am-9:30am during the week and 7:00am to 10:00am on the weekends.   I will be sure to share your review with both my team members, Beatriz and Keesha as they would be glad to read they contributed to making your trip that much more special.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Modern, clean rooms. Becca, at the bar, was amazing! Breakfast had lots of options and the staff worked really hard to keep everything stocked & clean. Rooftop pool & hot tub offered a great way to start the day and/or relax after a long day.
Manager Response: Dear Tinkerbell5625,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to read that Becca and the team were accommodating. I will be sure to share your review with the team.  We hope to see you back the next time you are in the Anaheim Area!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel especially for a family
Summary: My family and I stayed there March third and fourth. I wish we were there for the whole week it was a great place. The room was super spacious and had everything a family would need. The room was clean and there was no issues whatsoever. Our room had two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. The beds were comfortable and in a seperate bedroom which was separated by a sliding door.The bedroom area had a flat screen tv. The bath room was accessed through the bedroom had a walk in shower with glass doors. There was one sink and the toilet was located in the same room.The amenities were standard for a bathroom soap,Paul Mitchell shampoo and conditioner.In the room where the sofa was located there was another tv. There was lots of room in there which was nice if the kids wanted to sit on
Manager Response: Dear fresnonittanylion,  What a great review! Thank you for your great and informative comments. The CVS that you mentioned is very convenient for last minute items and it is only a couple of steps away from our property. We also have a 24-hour market on property that has plenty of snacks, desserts, frozen dinner and beer & wine.   Thank you again for your comments and we hope to see you back soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Check in was quick and easy, the staff at the front desk were also very helpful. The rooms are fresh and very clean.  We had a room on the 4th floor with a park view... It was so nice to be able to sit in the living room area and watch the fireworks at night, but getting a good nights rest with the street noise was near to impossible (we ran down to CVS & got a small fan and ear plugs which did help).  The main reason we love staying at Residence Inn's is the kitchen area... if you're traveling with little ones, it's a must! Breakfast was always loud, packed, and crazy, but the variety and quality of food was really good & we could always find a clean place to sit.  The pool area was also very nice--large pool, small area for the little kids to run and play, and plenty of chairs
Manager Response: Dear Lindsey D,  Thank you for a great review. I am happy to read that my front desk team was very helpful. You are correct in mentioning that our fully equipped kitchens make it so much more convenient and cost efficient for our guests.   We hope to see you back real soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Recent design, well located. Large rooms.
Summary: Many visitors from my company stayed here during a major recent event. 20+ rooms were reserved. We previously stayed at another property in Anaheim. This is a very significant upgrade in terms of comfort, location and overall experience. The hotel is rather new, rooms are modern (suite-style, with sofa area and kitchenette) and very spacious. Bathrooms are also pretty nice. Location is a 10 minutes (or less) walk from the Anaheim Convention Center. Overall recommended. Very basic breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Larry121,  Thank you for your review! I am pleased to read that your company resided with us. We hope to be able to accommodate you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Hotel was excellent, clean and very modern, pool and hot tub was nice after a day of walking around Disney.  The rooms are very quiet, well insulated so you don't hear noise from people above or beside you.  The room is a good size with 2 queen beds and a full kitchen.  Having the bedroom was great for putting our son to bed when we still wanted to stay up for a while.  Short walk to Disneyland, we walked every day, took about 15mins.  Having breakfast included everyday was great, good selection and above average in terms of free hotel breakfasts.  Would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Marcel L,  Thank you for your review! I appreciate the information provided for our future hotel guests. You are correct in mentioning the quick walk to Disney which is only about 10-15 minutes walking. For those interested in taking a shuttle, the city if Anaheim provided a shuttle at a fee that picks up on our property!  Thank you for your feedback again and we hope to see you back soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: The hotel was very nice and in a great location close to the conference center. Check in was fast and efficient even very late at night. The rooms were clean and nicely done. The location of the TV was strange though as there was no way to watch TV from any location in the room without moving the TV.
Manager Response: Dear Wala69,  Thank you for your feedback! We are glad check in was "fast" and "efficient". We hope to see you back again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: First Stay in Anaheim at the Best Hotel
Summary: My daughter booked this hotel for a family vacation at Disneyland and it was perfect.  The breakfast was above average with many choices.  The hotel staff was friendly and ready to help in any way.  It is a beautiful, modern, clean hotel.  Our rooms were immaculate and having a kitchen is such a plus, especially with children!  The pool and hot tub were also great.  About a ten minute walk to Disneyland.  Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear 268jaredb,  Thank you for your feedback! I am pleased to read that we were your first choice for your very first stay in the Anaheim Resort Area. We understand there are many hotel options in the area and value your choice.   We hope to accommodate you again very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This hotel is beautiful and clean.  The location is near many dining options and a Target store.  Best of all this hotel has the friendliest staff, always welcoming and helpful.  Rocio and the young gentlemen at the counter made a departure so pleasant. This hotel is always my first choice.
Manager Response: Dear patigonzales322,  Thank you for your review! Being that you are a frequent visitor to Anaheim, I'm glad that we were your number one choice for lodging. We hope to accommodate you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Everything is Awesome about this hotel
Summary: We had a family emergency my son had an asthma attack at 3 am and within minutes of hanging up with 911.  We had security at our door asking if we where ok.   Well I was freaking out and so was my husband but it was nice to know that we had the hotel staff there to help out.  The even extended us to late check out once we got back to the hotel room.     The hotel is also awesome we stayed in the 1 bedroom suite.   The kitchen is awesome for long stays with a big family, the bathroom showers are awesome.   The icing on the cake is the free breakfast.     We had a great stay and this will be our go to hotel from know on.
Manager Response: Dear Minerva S,  Thank you for your review. I want to begin by saying I hope that your son is doing okay, I am sure that was a freighting experience. With that, I am glad that my team was able to offer you as much assistance as possible. Overall, I am happy that you enjoyed the stay and will be returning in the future.  We look forward to seeing you again.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Perfect Family Hotel for a Trip to Disney!
Summary: We decided to try both this hotel and Disney's Grand Californian. Based on the price difference, the Residence Inn by FAR takes the cake! We enjoyed our time at the Residence Inn far more than the Grand Californian. Breakfast every morning was amazing, the rooms were clean, the pool is amazing and there are rooms that even have bunk beds! Our kids LOVED it!   I highly recommend that if you're going to visit Disneyland that you choose this hotel. The staff is amazing, the rooms are large and clean and the food is great! And you're within walking distance to the "Happiest Place on Earth"!
Manager Response: Dear dstravelman,  Thank you for your review! I'm pleased to read that you enjoyed our property overall. I will definitely share your compliments of the "amazing staff" to the team. We hope to see you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Great place for Business or pleasure!!
Summary: Fatalistic new property--Just opened in 2016.   Clean, Quiet and a great breakfast included with the room.   The room I had was a small suite which you could use for a stay over a week and still be comfortable.  Just a short walk to Disney and the convention center.  24 hr CVS very close if you need anything.   This is my go to location inn Orange County.
Manager Response: Dear LFA11111,  Thank you for your informative review. You are absolutely correct in mentioning that our property is great for both leisure and business travelers. With our proximity to both the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland, we accommodate many guests!  Thank you again and we hope to see you again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: My friends and I stayed here last week when we visited Disneyland.  The hotel was very clean, spacious, and staff was very friendly.  We reserved a 1-bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and for the 3 of us that was more than enough room. The room also had a kitchen with a full size fridge (for those of you who plan to save money and do some of your own cooking).   We took advantage of the included continental breakfast buffet which was provided every morning.  Again staff here were friendly and very attentive in keeping the areas clean.  The only thing that I wish I could change would be the location as it's a bit far from the entrance to the parks but for us we managed.  If you have little kids make sure you bring a stroller.  All in all a great hotel.
Manager Response: Dear nanasrs68,  Thank you for your feedback. You have mentioned such great points about our property. You are correct in mentioning that all of our rooms come fully equipped with kitchens to make it convenient for cooking. I am glad that you enjoyed all of the amenities our property had to offer.  We will see you very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Beautiful new property!  Awesome recognition for Plat Elite guests with framed welcome note. Great room in 801 which was a corner suite with great views and peaceful.   Breakfast is a nightmare. Words cannot describe the ensuing melee. Dodging dozens of strollers and kids in an attempt to quickly grab a seat. The primary concerns are the lack of food. For two consecutive days, we attempted to enjoy fruit but the property stated they were out by 8:15am(breakfast ends at 9:30am).  Beds are the absolute worst I have been exposed to. Hard as a board. Literally.   Brought concerns to front desk and was brushed off. Be aware prior to staying at this property. Bring extra fluffy blankets to offset the mattress and buy a pizza the night before for breakfast, and you're good to go.
Manager Response: Dear Justin C,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to read that you enjoyed the recognition to our Marriott Rewards members! Though you enjoyed your arrival experience, I am sorry to read that some items did not meet up to your expectations.   Our complimentary breakfast, which is served from 6:30am to 9:30am on the weekdays and 7am to 10am on the weekends, is a large reason why family's choose Residence Inn's. With our proximity to Disney, our breakfast is not only popular but also in high demand. Our breakfast team works diligently to make sure we are consistently replenished. It is possible that in the midst of replenishing, it took longer than expected, and for that we apologize.   We hope to be able to accommodate you again in the near future.   "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: One of the best Residence Inn Hotels I've ever stayed in
Summary: I just returned from a trip to Disneyland with my wife and 2 kids (aged 12 and 10).  We had reserved a 1-bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and upon check-in, inquired about a room with bunk-beds as I wanted to surprise the kids.  Kelly at the Front Desk was able to find us something and we were thrilled.  The room was spacious and we loved the new look of this modern Residence Inn.  The lobby was huge and had a bar off the side and the breakfast room was also very spacious.  As for the breakfast itself - I was literally speechless.  I've never seen anything like it.  The buffet is set up in a dedicated room and there was so much choice and plenty of it.  In fact, there were 2 sets of buffet set up so you never had to wait.  If you're familiar with the Residence Inn brand, you know
Manager Response: Dear Victoria_BCTall_Guy,  Wow! Your review was such a pleasure to read. I am so happy that my team and I were able to accommodate you. Please don't hesitate to reach out the next time you are planning your return to Anaheim!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel. Best choice around Disneyland
Summary: Our 4th visit to Disneyland in 10 years. The best hotel so far - which includes the Disneyland Hotel itself. We stay at a 1 bedroom suite (I am writing this while still there). Spacious, CLEAN, good internet, good service and only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. We are a family of 8 and share 2 suites - no problem at all. This hotel can compete with many upscale hotels around the world. Definitely our choice for our next visit.
Manager Response: Dear Frank_Staiger,  Thank you so much for your feedback.   I am glad that your stay was both spacious and clean. We strive to continuously grow for the sake of our guests.  See you very soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Just one word : Perfect. Nothing more to say, it was perfect in every way and less than 10 mn walk to Disneyland parks. I highly recommend, very modern, clean hotel with included breakfast buffet. Do not hesitate!
Manager Response: Dear bibmag,  Wow! We are so happy to read that you felt our property was "PERFECT". Thank you for your recommendations and we cannot wait to accommodate you again!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: One of the best in town!
Summary: The Residence Inn was amazing! The room was very spacious and the kids loved having their own lights by their bunk beds. The breakfast was delicious with many options. We felt like it was gourmet dining with the offerings. It was a little challenging finding a table, but when we found people that were done, the attendants were quick to clear everything so we could be seated. It took us no time at all to get to Disney. Would love to stay again!
Manager Response: Dear The K,  Thank you for a great review! I'm glad that you enjoyed our complimentary hot breakfast buffet. This amenity is very convenient to help energize families before a long day at Disney.  We would love to have you stay again!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We are in day 4 of our 8 night Disneyland trip and have found this hotel a very good option for the following reasons:  - great room layout (with both firm and soft pillows and non pilly sheets) with fully equiped kitchen including fridge with ice maker, dishwasher, coffee maker (daily decaf and reg coffee), microwave (daily microwave popcorn!), dishes inc pyrex containers etc - good selection of tv channels inc netflix, hbo, disney, etc - free breakfast with many options inc a variety of cereals and yogurt inc greek, fresh fruit (different daily - apples, bananas, melons, mix berries, grapes, pineapples), waffles and all trimmings, scrambled and boiled eggs, different daily meat (sausage, canadian bacon, chicken sausages), vegetarian mix (kinda like a falafal), hash browns,
Manager Response: Dear BeenDARE-_-doneTHAT,  Thank you  for such an informative review! We appreciate your feedback and will definitely share with our team. We hope to see you back again soon!  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: A Nice, New Hotel for Families, But It Needs to Kick It Up a Notch to Be First-Class
Summary: I stayed at week at this Residence Inn, in Feb 2017, and was generally pleased. However, there were some surprising nuances which diminished what might have otherwise been a first-class visit. Here are the details; you decide if they're important to you:  In terms of location, this hotel is terrific. It is immediately adjacent to the Anaheim Convention Center and across the street for the huge Disney park. It's 30 minutes from  John Wayne Airport (maybe a $40 ride) and about an hour south of LAX. The neighborhood is full of a variety of restaurants, so everybody will find a choice that fits their mood and budget.  The building itself is brand-new, open about six months as I write this. Its a medium-sized hotel of about 350 rooms on nine floors. The ground floor includes a large
Manager Response: Dear PilotMike2009,  Thank you for your information filled review. We appreciate your feedback and your comments on our team. We will present this review with our management team to spark conversation as to how we can improve our property.   Thank you again.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: my family drove all the way from sacramento and initially had booked to stay at disneyland paradise pier however upon checking in they would not accommodate us due to the fact that my infant counted as a 6th person and that was too many people in a room.  long story short we were accommodated at residence Inn Marriott.  the reps at the hotel desk were so friendly and caring.  they checked is in right away.  it was totally worth the money!!! rooms are very spacious and clean.  the bed were comfortable and it was really convenient having a little kitchenette since I had to warm my infants milk during nighttime.  the breakfast buffet was awesome and they changed the menu a little everyday.  we also rented a scooter for my dad which they were very kind to allow us to pick up and
Manager Response: Dear sanjay5,  Thank you for a wonderful review! I am pleased to read that our team was both "friendly" and "caring". Keep us in mind the next time you travel to the Anaheim Resort Area.  "Suite" Regards, Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I stayed here with my extended family on a trip to Disneyland for 4 nights from the 23rd-27th Jan 2016. We were in Room 806. On the 27th Jan, we had packed up our things to check out and my mother left her longchamp handbag (empty) on top of her suitcase. She thought it would be ok to leave it there if she went down to breakfast for 15mins. Upon her return, she found the housekeeper looking suspicious, quickly coming out of the room even though we were checking out that morning and the room should have been cleaned after we left. We were in a rush and didn't realize till we got to San Diego that it was missing.   The bag was a sentimental gift from my sister and I for my mum and we are upset that it was stolen.  The housekeeper had brown hair and was overweight. Be wary of
Manager Response: Dear Jezz3,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  I am very sorry for your mother's loss.  Having lost items in my travels myself, including the occasional item of sentimental value, I understand how frustrating this is.  We have checked with the hotel team, including the housekeeper who cleaned your room, as well as through our lost and found department, and have not found it.  Please be assured that the well being of our guests and their belongings is important to me.  We have a very large and secure lost and found area with all manner of items turned in daily, including items of high intrinsic value and those that seem to be worth very little in terms of dollars though they may be very valuable to the owners.  Unfortunately, with the information you provided and the variables involved, such as your being in a rush and not noticing the item was missing until you were in San Diego, there is simply no way to ascertain exactly what may have happened to the handbag.   Traveling can be hectic. and we receive calls regularly from customers who are missing items only to discover that they actually had misplaced them when they packed their luggage and never lost them.  I encourage you to search again in your car and home in the hopes that this may be the case.  Likewise, we will check our lost and found periodically in the coming weeks in case it turn up here as we find that items are sometimes dropped in hallways or parking lots and go unnoticed for a bit before someone finds them and turns them in.    Thank you again for your feedback - I hope that the handbag turns up.

Summary: This is a nice place to stay for families. Anaheim need a lot more places like this since Disneyland is for families. I would stay here over the Disney properties. I have stayed in all 3 and this one is a lot better for families who don't want to rent 2 rooms. They have lots of different rooms to choose from. There breakfast has a good selection and it changed a little each day. There is a Pizza Hut  in the hotel which is so nice when you stay in. The pool is chilly which they should heat it up a little more but the hot tub is really nice.

I really enjoyed my stay at RI, the hotel is really family oriented as it is very close to Disneyland, so many family with young children stayed here.   Lobby and front desk are minimalist and efficient. The room I stayed was at the first floor so actually just stroll  my luggage to the room after check in. It was a big room I stayed (I was alone on my business trip). It has a kitchen, mini bar, microwave, so it is actually very good for a long stay. Bathroom and the bedroom is very spacious, it even has couch. Cleanliness and tidiness are really good.   The breakfast is good too, not many option but it is enough for me (American breakfast menu).   I only stayed 1 night for a business trip, and overall, I am satisfied with the hotel facility and service. So it is recommended.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel With Horrible Customer Service
Summary: We go to Disney 1-2 times per year and hoped this could be our new hotel of choice but that was not the case! Hotel is new and very nice! Breakfast is decent and a nice way to start your day at Disney but customer service is non-existent. 2 queen with sofa bed is not advisable for families of 5 or more as the sofa bed is horrible. Shame that the culture of this hotel is no service as it could be a great hotel. Stay across the street at Desert Palms or Hyatt House do not stay here unless you want to be treated terribly
Manager Response: Dear Shaun S,  Thank you for your feedback. While I am glad to read that you felt our hotel was nice and our breakfast was suitable for you, I am sad to see that you felt our customer service did not reach your expectations. I would appreciate if you reach out to me so we can discuss what it was exactly that you were unhappy with. This helps me better train my team and target what we need to work on.  Feel free to contact the property at your convenience so we can further discuss. Thank you again.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed here after leaving a motel we had checked into and did not like. We drove by this Residence Inn on our way to downtown Disney and thought it looked nice. Our room was plenty of space for two adults and two little ones.  The room itself was really clean and modern. We enjoyed the USB ports for charging our phones and the smart tv that had the ability to log into our Netflix was great for early morning cartoons before heading to the parks.  The walk to Disney is maybe a little longer than 10 minutes, so this location was great. Our view was unfortunately a construction site. Had the parks had fireworks during our visit, we might have paid more for that view. I wish we'd had time to see the rooftop pool but did not this trip.  The breakfast had a huge selection of foods,

This and the courtyard property with the water slides are by far the nicest in the area!  Brand new.  I've stayed at every Marriott property in this area and this is a great choice.  A good trek from Disney but easy and cheap uber ride.  (If you walk you may regret it later) Having the full kitchen is GREAT.

We just stayed in this hotel in January, we had family time. We enjoyed our stay, breakfast was very good.  we go to Disneyland every year in October and we decided to book this hotel for our next we have stayed in different hotels in and outside Disneyland and to us we have enjoyed this hotel even better then the grand California.  we will be seeing you guys this October for five nights.

My sister and I met in Anaheim and I chose this hotel because it is larger than the Spring Hill suites that I have stayed at right next-door which I have given a five star  review. When I went to check in I had a very young, very nice young person check me in. She said I was being upgraded to the ninth floor with the Cityview. We get up to the room we bring all our luggage we unpack into the very short 6 inch deep three small drawers.  We also hung what we could in the very small closet.    After we had packed I looked out to see the beautiful city view    We were the brunt of the joke. It was a view of construction workers working on a parking garage I was about nine stories tall. There was no Cityview none at all. I called down to see what time construction would start as it
Manager Response: Dear Janiemcauburn,  Thank you for your review.  I am sorry that your room did not live up to your expectations.   Naturally, when your are given what is described as a city view room you should be able to see something.  We are in the process of reviewing are room type descriptions due to the expansion at the convention center across the street.  It would appear that the front desk was confused due to the changes as some rooms on that side of the building are no longer classified as city view rooms.  As to the construction, it should not be starting before 7AM.  Occasionally, the site is allowed to start a bit earlier to receive deliveries so that large trucks are not blocking traffic during rush hour.  I keep in contact with the city and will continue to remind them that that they should be following the rules about start times whenever possible.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: We spent 4 nights here. The apartment was fantastic, very modern, roomy, well equipped and comfortable. There was no outside noise what so ever(we were on the 5th floor). The breakfast was great, a large variety and always plenty on hand no matter what time we went down to eat. The pool/spa area was excellent as was the gym.There is a little snack shop and ATM machine as well as a Pizza Hut express in the hotel. Although no shuttle to Disneyland it was walk-able or you can do as we did,  catch a bus to and from Disneyland and never have to wait more than a few minutes. Reliable fast WiFi too. There is a a pharmacy(more like a general store) next door that had everything from wine and beer through to food and suitcases! The down side for us was that one of the beds clearly hadn't
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia k,  Thank you for your review. I really appreciate the highlights you mentioned during your stay here. I also want to apologize once again for the issues that you experienced while staying with us. We take guest our guest feedback very seriously and we strongly believe in turning things around for the better. Rest assured, I have discussed this matter with my Housekeeping Manager and we currently taking corrective action for our team. It was a pleasure meeting with you and I have utilized your review as a reference guide for my team along with others on property.   "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Good all round hotel for families
Summary: Super clean, large rooms with great kitchen facilities, which are a godsend for families. We stayed 8 nights and were able to eat in a few times as many of the restaurant options nearby are just boring burger and fries option. The Pizza Hut on the premises was a great bonus and we frequented that after long days at Disneyland. Very close to all facilities, Disney is just up the road. The wifi is brilliant. Breakfast buffet was standard fare. Aside from the construction next door which sadly woke us pretty much every morning there - which we understand is of no fault of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: A few issues but still a nice stay!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 days while at Disneyland as it is only a 1/2 mile walk away.  It is a modern and new hotel marketed towards families.  Our room, which was a deluxe king suite, was of reasonable size and had a partition between the bedroom and sitting area/kitchenette.  The fixtures were in good condition and were quite modern including a stainless regular size fridge/stove top and microwave.  We were on the fifth floor away from the construction so it was quiet while we were there.  Every morning there is a large buffet breakfast which was awesome to fill up on before the long days at the park.  It was reasonably warm enough to hang out in the pool area which was clean and relaxing while we were there.   Our only issue was with the cleanliness of our room.  I realize that

Summary Heading: Walk to Disney, Relax at the Residence
Summary: We're Marriott platinum and used points to stay here over New Year's weekend. It was a great value for the points required. The hotel is within a short walk to Disney. It rained while we were at Disney, so we walked back in the middle of the day but took an Uber back to the park for the evening show. The hotel itself is very relaxing. The suites are spacious, and it was nice to be able to spread out during our stay. We're from Ohio where it was snowing, so my kids enjoyed swimming in the rooftop pool in unseasonably cool SoCal temperatures. The guest laundry facilities were conveniently located next to the pool. Despite the crowd, the breakfast area was efficiently organized with adequate tables. Garage parking was a plus.

Stayed in a two bedroom kids room for 5 nights in October as a family of four.  A very new property so everything is clean and fresh.  The room was a great size and our kids loved the bunk beds and having their own bathroom. Housekeeping was not great and very inconsistent.  Sometimes not servicing the room completely, leaving beds unmade and dirty dishes unwashed. Various towells were not replaced which was just frustrating.  A buffet breakfast is included and can only be described as a circus. This is not the fault of the staff but the gluttonous hotel guests, leaving so much wasted food and mess. There is not enough staff to cope with the clearing and cleaning of tables so if you have breakfast later in the morning, it is just a disgusting mess. Choices and quality of food is
Manager Response: Dear Tiffany L,  Thank you for your review and your feedback. I am sorry to hear that you experienced some issues during your stay. In regards to breakfast, our dining area has the tendency of getting busy especially when we have many families visiting for Disney. At check in, we provide our guests with information about our property which also has a recommended time grid for our breakfast. This grid shows the hours of opening to closing and highlights calm time frames versus busier time frames. With that said, we are always open to our guests feedback and where we could use room for improvement. I appreciate you providing us information that will benefit our property.  We hope to be able to serve you again in the future.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We stayed here Dec.30-Jan. 7 and upon checking in I noticed that the warmth was missing. Over 20 years of travel we try to stay at Residence Inns and are always greeted with a smile but not here. Last year we were next door at the Springhill suites and loved it but I missed having a kitchen at RI. I walked over after check in this year and was immediately greeted by a welcoming front desk, when traveling with children this feels heavenly! We were in the family suite which was nice and well laid out but the view was of the parking garage, they did move us upon request but it took a little longer. Housekeeping needs help, they have not be trained very well. They sweep everything from the kitchen out into the hall and in the 8 nights I was there I didn't here a vacuum in the hall
Manager Response: Dear LaToya234,  Thank you for your feedback.  I am sorry to read that your stay was not to your complete expectations. As a loyal customer to Marriott I understand what anticipations you have of our property. Although I am happy to see that my team tried to assist you to the best of their abilities, it is clear that there are still some items that we need to revisit.  Rest assured, I will be discussing your feedback with my team, along with other departments. Thank you again and we hope to see you back real soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Long travel day punctuated by flight delays - I presented myself at the desk and somehow the notes on my reservation had gone missing.  Thankfully Ciara took matters in hand, found me a suitable replacement after numerous consultations with the hotel staff, upgraded my room type, and even took me to the room to ensure it suited my purpose.  Lifetime platinum, and THIS is why I'll travel miles out of my way to stay in a Marriott property.  Thanks Ciara!!

Summary Heading: Awful experience and staff fit to be working in a motel
Summary: My family and I checked in and we were so excited to spend New Year's Eve paying an exuberant rate for 1 night but I think now we would have gotten better service from a motel. The girl that checked us in should not be working in hospitality as didn't even give me a proper greeting, nor asked me how I was doing, our needs, etc. she didn't go over the reservation or the special requests we had put in (I.e. Crib). She just handed me the key. Didn't even bother to go over the amenities. I am well verse in staying at hotels and know good service when I see it. I just expected that from a Marriott brand. After that we checked into our room where the crib was not there. No surprise. Since I had a cranky baby and needed to get her in bed right away, called the front desk. I called 7
Manager Response: Dear Matthew D, thank you for sharing your experience with us.   I am very sorry that we did not meet your expectations for the level of service, friendliness and responsiveness.   We strive to provide the best service possible at all times and in your we failed.  While there no excuses, this was our first New Years Eve since our opening.  Rest assured, we are evaluating the feedback from guests and the staff to make improvements to our operations so that this does not happen again.   Thank you again for your valuable feedback.

Summary Heading: Nice Property but not for Families
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during our visit to Disneyland. We knew the details of the hotel, but the room turned out to be smaller than we had imagined. The hotel does offer some larger rooms for families, but not very many and they are very expensive. The hotel is a good hotel for business travelers, but being so close to Disney, you would think they would have designed it more for families.   The bathroom has a shower, toilet and vanity all in the same room. It's very difficult for more than one person to be in the bathroom at one time. With no tub, you can't bathe small children. If I was. the room is so small, the bathroom door doubles as the closet door. You close the bathroom door to get to the closet. The dresser is tiny. You basically can't unpack because the drawers are so
Manager Response: Dear Patrick S,  Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to read that your stay was not completely up to your expectations. You are correct in that we attract guests primarily for Disney, as well as the Anaheim Convention Center. Depending on the room type, we have different accommodations to appeal to every guest.   I hope that upon your next return to Disney, we can help better accommodate you. Thank you again.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We had 10 in our family party to Disneyland. Two rooms each with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa in a separate room. One bathroom and a kitchen. Rooms were nice and hotel location convenient to the parks. We were able to catch the ART bus close and could of walked to parks but didn't want to. There is a drug store on the property for incidentials which was convenient. The hotel had a Pizza Hut and complimentary breakfast. It did not have the complimentary evening snack like most Residence Inns have. The pool area was roof top and was very nice with large pool, hot tub and kids splash pad. There is construction next door but wasn't bad. The only criticism we had was the cleaning or lack of. Kleenex and toilet didn't get filled; we had to ask. No sheets for pull out couch in

We hadn't gone to Disneyland in a couple if years and we're booking just a couple weeks before the trip. I read about this hotel and it had a great rating especially for a new hotel. Rooms were comfortable, kitchen is well stocked, the breakfast is quite large and has lots of variety. I wish the shower had more water pressure but that's a little problem in the scheme of things. The walk to Disney is 10-15 minutes but after walking for 9+ hours at the parks, we often took the ART bus as the kids were exhausted. The cool thing about this hotel is the modern accents like wall plug ins already adapted for your electronic device cords  (you don't have to choose between unplugging the light or alarm clock to plug in your phone). If you want to see the disneyland fireworks from the

Great place! The hotel itself is very new, well appointed especially for the Anaheim  disneyland market which has grown too comfortable with making big money while letting the properties get old and dumpy. would highly recommend for family travelers. Hotel itself is very close to the park. Great amenities nearby.

We booked this hotel mainly due to expectations of a Marriott premier hotel and the location. We literally got off a 13 hour flight from Australia and drove straight to the hotel.The location is awesome if Disneyland is your destination as it is only a short walk to the park. Check in was seamless and friendly and vibrant staff greeted us and let us into the room early as it was ready. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. The breakfast was extensive and hot and well done. We decided to have a quick shower after the long flight and found no water. I immediately contacted reception and was advised that an issue had just arisen and it appeared to be a mains fault and that maintenance was already on to the problem. We left the park un showered but eager to explore. After

Our family of 4 stayed in December.   The hotel room was clean and nicely furnished.  This hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland gates.  Our 5 and 7 year old kids managed to enjoy the park all day and walk back to the hotel no problem (but this was December and it was not hot outside).  The breakfast buffet was well organized and clean considering the number of guests (I have stayed at other Residence Inn locations and this is not always the norm).  I cannot comment on the pool as it was too cold for a swim.  I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for a family trip to Disneyland
Summary: This is a new hotel and and the layout is great. Good parking building structure, big and nice lobby with coffee and orange, lime + lemon water for free, big and  fast elevators, huge breakfast area, very efficient staff, Pizza Hut restaurant in the house, windows all over, fixtures are all nice, and clean and stylish restrooms. Pool, spa and gym at the 6th, and a somewhat business center at the lobby. You can get upgraded when there's availability (just like us) and can have a late check out. It's a walking distance to Disneyland entrance and drugstores, Coffee Bean and IHop are all close by. Highly recommended and we will be back.
Manager Response: Dear jrponciano,  Thank you for your review. I appreciate you providing plenty of information for our future guests.   Due to our proximity to Disney, special requests are in high demand. Our team does their best to try and accommodate the needs of our guests. Of course, it may not always be guaranteed as our requests are high.  We look forward to seeing you again real soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: First of all, the room was beautiful.  It surpassed any other hotel we have stayed at in Anaheim and we have stayed at many.   But, unless you can pay for an upgraded view,  don't expect much outside your room.   We had construction and it was so close we had to keep curtains closed. But, the biggest disappointment was the laundry.  I have to say if you have laundry to do, don't come to this hotel.  The washers are terrible. They didn't even have enough water going through it to dissolve a pod and those start to dissolve if you have wet hands. I am still finding residue on my clothes from it so need to rewash much of what I washed.   I am putting four stars because room was so nice,  but don't expect anything great outside the room.
Manager Response: Dear KatG227,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to read that you enjoyed your room. I would like to apologize for the washer situation. I have presented this review to our team and we are currently taking steps to target the issue.  We hope to be able to accommodate you again soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: We enjoyed our stay. This has being the nicest and cleanest hotels. Breakfast was pretty good to be included in the price. The rooms are really nice decorated and modern. It didn't felt dingy or stuffy at all. The only eye sore is the construction next door.
Manager Response: Dear Verenice C,  Thank you for your review. I appreciate you mentioning our complimentary hot breakfast. This added amenity saves families time and money before heading over to the park.  Thank you again!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Quality hotel, reasonably priced and convenient to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here recently for four days on a trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is new, clean and well maintained.  Rooms are large (we had a one bedroom suite) with plenty of space to spread out.  Our room was pleasantly quiet even though the hotel was full of families with small children.  HVAC is unobtrusive and effective.  There are plenty of convenient plugs and USB ports for electronic devices.  Furnishings in the living room are a little spartan but that is probably necessitated by the use they will get.  A kitchen is adjacent to the living room offering the options one would expect and separated from the living room by a dining counter  There were two TV's, one in the living room and one in the bedroom.  There is no tub in the bathroom.  The complimentary breakfast was handled
Manager Response: Dear bfred33235,  Thank you for your review from your most recent stay with us. I appreciate you providing our future guests with such an informative review.   We hope to be able to better serve you upon your future visit back to Anaheim.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Our receptionist, Katty, went out of her way to make sure that we had a great stay! The hotel and location were amazing. We had an amazing view of the park and the fireworks from our room. We will definitely be returning to stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Dave C,  Thank you for your great review. I am glad that our team went out of their was to make your stay "great"!  See you again soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Amazing Service - Best Place to Stay in Anaheim
Summary: My fiancé (then boyfriend) and I were booked to stay at this hotel.  From the moment we walked in, we were created with smiles and amazing customer service.  They gave us a beautiful room with a gorgeous view, provided us with champagne and did all they could to ensure a wonderful visit.  They knew my boyfriend was going to propose to me in Disneyland on this trip so offered him any help they could from their end.  After the proposal in Disneyland, they spent time with us to congratulate us upon our return to the hotel.  We will definitely stay with them on our next visit.  Thank you for everything!
Manager Response: Dear Salimam M,  Thank you for your review.   Firstly, congratulations to both of you on the engagement! I am delighted to read that your trip here with us will be one to remember. We hope to see you back soon following the BIG day!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I stayed here Thanksgiving weekend and will be going back to this hotel moving forward. Our room was the Deluxe Studio which included a king size bed, a futon Couch, and a complete kitchen. The room was very clean and modern. The trip was only my fiancé and I however this would be a great room for a family. A buffet style breakfast was included every morning in the downstairs dinning area but there was the option of taking it back to the room. There was a variety of options and the food was always hot and the workers would be constantly switching it out with freshly made. There is a CVS next door which was convenient for necessities that we forgot to pack. We also bought a small pack of water and stored the case in refrigerator. The walk to Disney is about 15 min, not bad.
Manager Response: Dear LoveLily789,  Thank you for your review. I appreciate your information packed review.  I am so glad to read that we are your choice hotel for your future trips to Anaheim.   See you very soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: I had an unusual request that I made through the Marriott app only a few hours before arrival and did they deliver!  My family was celebrating Christmas as well as Thanksgiving that week because my husband works overseas.  I let the hotel know and somehow they found a medium size tree for our room.  I was overjoyed and truly delighted but such responsive and caring service.    We had a "kids room" which was perfect for us and our three kids--plenty of room for them with a HUGE bathroom of their own and privacy for us with our own bedroom and bath.  Having a kitchen was also a big bonus for our family.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The only issue we experienced was trying with breakfast--one of the days we arrived to find the room packed, not unexpected during
Manager Response: Dear TheRonsWife,  Thank you so much for your review!  I am so happy to read that you enjoyed the small surprise that our team put together. It is always a pleasure to make our guests feel at home.  During the holidays, it is quite common for the surrounding Disney hotels to be quite full. However, we always make sure that our guests needs are met. Thank you for the feedback as I will be bringing it to the attention of the appropriate department.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Just visited the week of Thanksgiving. At first I was skeptical because of some bad reviews but they had a too good to pass deal! Only things i will mention right off the bat, we were given a handicap room without telling us which had no tub. Didn't realize until we had settled in and did not want to move so no tub. Also, there is construction of a structure right behind the hotel which our room was facing and work starts at 6 am. Lots of banging, but we were up already getting ready so it wasn't an issue. Hotel is beautiful.  Very modern and clean. Gym is big with more equipment then the usual hotel gym, laundry room has multiple washers and dryers, pool area is beautiful and spacious. The room was clean and kitche well equipped.  I only cooked 2x but it was nice to have the
Manager Response: Dear Elaina B,  Thank you for such a detailed and informative review!  I am happy to read you decided to experience our property and you enjoyed it. I appreciate you bringing up construction that is taking place at the Anaheim Convention Center. Although this is something that is out of our control, we like to make our guests aware so they know in advance.   Thank you for bringing up our parking fee. You are correct in that there is a fee of $18.00 + tax which comes out to $21.06.   Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to see you again soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay at for a convention
Summary: It's right down the street from Disney, the convention center and a great strip of places to eat. The rooms were clean and the staff was really friendly. It's a little pricey compared to other residence inns but it's in a Disney town so what else would you expect. Easy walk to downtown disney
Manager Response: Dear Rob M,  Thank you for your review.  We appreciate you mentioning our convenient location to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. Aside from these locations, we are within 5-10 minute walking distance to eateries such as: The Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, Bubba Gump Shrimp and our very own Pizza Hut Express on property.  We hope to see you back again soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This hotel is new and made a good choice for my recent visit to Disneyland. Free breakfast was very good with ample choices. We were there for five nights and the only negatives I found were that house keeping could have been better, we used the pullout sofa bed and I really don't think the bedding had been changed post other guest, as we found  belongings  after pulling the bed out. As well as the overall cleanliness of the room.The main beds were not comfortable especially for 5 nights disappointing for a new hotel, not up to past Marriott experiences. Hotel is close to ART transportation and Disneyland express stops two pharmacies that have everything you may need and within 10- 15 mins walking distance to the parks.
Manager Response: Dear Rondo01,  Thank you for your feedback on your most recent stay with us.  Thank you for pointing out our daily complimentary breakfast. This is a huge benefit for families planning on going to the Disney parks, as it saves time and money.   I would like to apologize for some of the housekeeping items that you brought to our attention. Rest assured, all of our bedding is completely changed out whenever a guest checks out. Your review has been shared with our Housekeeping Manager so that the appropriate actions can be taken.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: Our family stayed at the Residence Inn by the Convention Center this past October. What a beautiful, new hotel to come take a break from the Disneyland parks. The walk was about 10 minutes in the morning (fresh legs) and about 15-20 at night (tired legs, with younger kids). Spend that much time walking and waiting for trams and busses.   It was great having a fridge to store water and other drinks to take into the park. Beds comfortable. Breakfast had many options and was a good way to get some energy before going to Disneyland.   Also, our kids really enjoyed the roof top pool and splash park. Comfort, cleanliness, and great service is why we like Marriott properties so much. This hotel did not disappoint. Look forward to spending time at this hotel for future Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: Dear Christopher P,  Thank you for such a great review!   I am happy to read that you found our fully equipped kitchens useful during your trip. They become especially helpful if you decide to prepare meals in your room rather than spend additional money on eating out.   We hope to see you back real soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Stayed here with 3 kids in double Queen 1 bedroom.  With double Queens and pullout couch sleeping arrangements worked well. Breakfast area was set up and stuffed to deal with high volume of family guests. Was a newer property and would defiantly stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Rkucker,  Thank you for your feedback. I am happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to be able to accommodate you again the next time you are in the Anaheim Resort Area.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: This Hotel is quite new and only a short walk from Disneyland. Breakfast was really good with lots of choice hot and cold. Plenty of space to sit eat and enjoy. Rooms spacious and spotless with many amenities coffee maker large fridge fully kitted out kitchen. Not that much space to hang clothers. Swimming pool on 6th floor along with laundry and fitness room.We found the staff helpful and friendly. Coffee shop very close  as well as Pizza Hut Express. Others shops closeby and short walk to other restaurants. Would certainly stay at Residence Inn again.
Manager Response: Dear Vera K,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate some of the feedback you provided.  We have many snack options on property in our Market that range from chips and candy to Stouffers frozen dinners. In addition, we have a Pizza Hut Express that delivers fresh hot pizza directly to your room. You are correct in mentioning that right across the walk way there is a Coffee Bean along with a CVS to cater to any additional needs.  We hope to see you again!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: No hot water and terrible breakfast experience
Summary: I've got more than 340 nights in Marriotts over the past 5 years and this was far and away the worst.  First, the positives: -staff was very friendly upon arrival -upon finding out we were there on a honeymoon, the desk associate comped our parking and apologized for not having any upgrades available, neither of which would I have expected, so it was a nice surprise -surprisingly quiet rooms -short walk to Disneyland/ California Adventure  Negatives: -our toilet leaked and required us to take the tank lid off to manually manipulate to stop the leaking. Engineering resolved the issue on day 2 for us. -the breakfast area is a messy disaster. Tables piled with dirty dishes and staff unable to keep up, through no lack of trying, though.  -Staff members audibly complaining about the
Manager Response: Dear Johnsonnathan718,  I am very sorry to hear about your experience with us.  You touched on many points, though the water issue does appear to be the biggest event during your visit.  We had the main pipe that delivers hot water to the building fail without warning.  This necessitated the shut off of all hot water to the building until an emergency repair could be made.  We had a large crew working on this, but due to the level of damage, it did take longer than we would have hoped to repair.  I am sorry that this happened to you - this is the last thing that you should have had t0 deal with while visiting us.  Please be assured that the staff worked very hard to do what they could to mitigate the situation, but as you alluded to, they were under a great deal of stress and may not have been as appropriately empathetic or as calm as they should have been at all times.  This certainly does not make it OK and I will be following up with the team so that we can learn how to better handle unexpected situations such as this one should they arise in the future.  Thank you for your understanding.  My records show that our team has reached out to you and offered you compensation for the inconvenience.  Please accept this along with our most since apology.

Summary: Stayed at Residence Inn by Marriott at Anaheim.  This hotel was very clean with so many amenities.  The rooms are spotless, with kitchens, separate seating area, and a beautiful bedroom and bathroom.  The breakfast was excellent.  It was a full breakfast.  My granddaughter was really sick, so we had to cut our stay short.  Mathew at the front desk was very understanding and helpful.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: Dear Marsha1954,  Thank you for your review! We are glad that you had such a great stay with us. We hope that you will be able to return and enjoy another memorable time with us. I hope that your granddaughter is feeling much better!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Beautiful new hotel with spacious common areas, a large parking garage, and lovely large rooms. The young man at the front desk was wonderful. Disneyland was a quick walk away.  We loved everything about our stay and very highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear SwissOrangeChip,  Thank you for such a wonderful review! I am so happy to read you had a "Perfect Disneyland Stay"!  We will see you back very soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary: Brand new, great location, lots of space in the rooms. Much nicer than the garden grove location. Pizza Hut attached to lobby. Only quirk was complete lack of furniture to store your cloths. In 2 bedroom suite, one bedroom had no closet no drawers, just bed and mini desk. Great view of the fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear Alfonso d,  Thank you for your review. We are happy to read that you decided to stay at our property. We hope that you will return the next time you are in the Anaheim Resort Area.  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales

Summary Heading: New, clean, friendly staff, and amazing breakfast!
Summary: I had an amazing stay here during a convention. It's an easy walk to the Anaheim Convention Center, and a much calmer place to come home to during a busy convention compared to the Marriott or Hilton. The staff was incredibly friendly and thoughtful (special thanks to Geovanny at the front desk for all his help!). And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the breakfast! They have the same items as many complimentary breakfast, but the execution is exceptional. Easy flow through the server area makes grabbing food a pleasant experience, and all the items are fresh and tasty.   I can't rave enough about this place, and will definitely be staying here next time I'm in town.
Manager Response: Dear elizabethaschaefer,  Wow, what a great review to read! I appreciate you providing information for our guests. We hope to be able to accommodate you again real soon!  "Suite" Regards,  Kimberly Rosales
